story:
My Story:

Message from Mark Skinner (17 year old, grade 12 student)-

Iâ€™m excited to introduce you to the Empathy Factory and my new awareness campaign.

The Empathy Factory is a registered not-for-profit that works with youth in Nova Scotia from 8 year olds all the way to High School seniors like me. They teach us what empathy is, why itâ€™s important, and they empower us to use it to make the world a better place.

The program Iâ€™m in encourages 17 and 18 year olds to take an idea for a social enterprise and put it into action. I saw a problem, worked on a solution, and here I am to introduce you to my enterprise, Phone Home, Save a Life.


Introduction:

Thirty percent of Canadians who are awaiting an organ will die before they receive it. It has been proven that the vast majority of Canadians support organ donation, but less than half are actually registered donors. To add to this, studies suggest that between 20% and 40% of eligible, registered donors do not ultimately donate their organs because they didnâ€™t make their wishes known to their immediate family - Donation can take place only if the donorâ€™s family has given consent at the time of death.

In the event that the prospective donor makes his or her desires known to their family, the chances that their wishes are respected increase to between 90% and 95%.

Because signing your donor card is not legally binding, itâ€™s of the utmost importance that the final decision makers â€“ oneâ€™s next of kin â€“ be consulted. We must make our wishes known.

Phone Home, Save a Life:

Phone Home, Save a Life (PHSL) is a campaign that will facilitate the conversation about organ donation between university students across Canada and their loved ones at home.

PHSL aims to host an event at every university and college in the country. The events will encourage and engage students who are registered donors to phone home (for free) and express their wishes. In the event that a student is not registered, they will also be able to call and talk about what donation means to them and their family. They will have the opportunity to learn more about the topic, and sign up on the spot if that is their choice. PHSL will bring their events to students, and host events that are engaging, eye-catching, and inspiring. We will help save lives by registering new donors, creating awareness, and facilitating important conversations. 


What We Need:

Before we kick off our campaign, and start our tour around the country, we need to run a pilot event; to work out the kinks. Our Indiegogo project is in hopes of raising enough money to purchase some of the start up products and materials we'll need to make it happen.


We'll need a booth, banners, and other promotional materials. We'll also need to train volunteers, pay for long distance calls, and supply prizes, music, snacks, etc. (to make it a real kick-butt event).


We've put in our budget that it will cost us $4,750 to run our first event, but most of those costs will not recur for each subsequent event. That is, once we have a branded booth and banners, for instance, we'll never need to buy them again. We'll spend time on developing training manuals and materials for volunteers, so that they can easily run these events at other schools across the country.


We will also be compiling video footage, testimonials, and appeals into a Phone Home, Save a Life documentary. Trust me, you'll want to be a part of that!


How You Can Help:

Indiegogo makes it easy! All you have to do is click - and pledge! It's that simple.


We make it easy, too. Our pledge levels start as low as $10.00 and go up to $2,500.00


I'm hoping that you'll see the value in this campaign, maybe think it's kind of neat that I'm doing this, and really just want to ride the wave and save a life or two. If you're not able to pledge (and I know not everyone can) you could still help by passing this link on to your friends, post it on Facebook, or Tweet it!


Remember: Don't take your organs to Heaven. Heaven knows we need them here :) 

See Empathy Factory CEO, Blair Ryan make a personal appeal.


Learn more about the Empathy Factory here.
story_txt:
My Story:

Message from Mark Skinner (17 year old, grade 12 student)-

Iâ€™m excited to introduce you to the Empathy Factory and my
new awareness campaign.

The Empathy Factory is a registered not-for-profit that
works with youth in Nova Scotia from 8 year olds all the way to High School
seniors like me. They teach us what empathy is, why itâ€™s important, and they
empower us to use it to make the world a better place.

The program Iâ€™m in encourages 17 and 18 year olds to take an
idea for a social enterprise and put it into action. I saw a problem, worked on
a solution, and here I am to introduce you to my enterprise, Phone Home, Save a
Life.





Introduction:

Thirty percent of Canadians who are awaiting an organ will
die before they receive it. It has been proven that the vast majority of
Canadians support organ donation, but less than half are actually registered
donors. To add to this, studies suggest that between 20% and 40% of eligible,
registered donors do not ultimately donate their organs because they didnâ€™t
make their wishes known to their immediate family - Donation can take place
only if the donorâ€™s family has given consent at the time of death.

In the event that the prospective donor makes his or her
desires known to their family, the chances that their wishes are respected
increase to between 90% and 95%.

Because signing your donor card is not legally binding, itâ€™s of the utmost importance that the final decision makers â€“ oneâ€™s
next of kin â€“ be consulted. We must make our wishes known.

Phone Home, Save a Life:
Phone Home, Save a Life (PHSL) is a campaign that will
facilitate the conversation about organ donation between university students
across Canada and their loved ones at home.

PHSL aims to host an event at every university and college
in the country. The events will encourage and engage students who are
registered donors to phone home (for free) and express their wishes. In the
event that a student is not registered, they will also be able to call and talk
about what donation means to them and their family. They will have the
opportunity to learn more about the topic, and sign up on the spot if that is
their choice. PHSL will bring their events to students, and host events
that are engaging, eye-catching, and inspiring. We will help save lives by registering new donors, creating
awareness, and facilitating important conversations. 





What We Need:
Before we kick off our campaign, and start our tour around the country, we need to run a pilot event; to work out the kinks. Our Indiegogo project is in hopes of raising enough money to purchase some of the start up products and materials we'll need to make it happen.

We'll need a booth, banners, and other promotional materials. We'll also need to train volunteers, pay for long distance calls, and supply prizes, music, snacks, etc. (to make it a real kick-butt event).

We've put in our budget that it will cost us $4,750 to run our first event, but most of those costs will not recur for each subsequent event. That is, once we have a branded booth and banners, for instance, we'll never need to buy them again. We'll spend time on developing training manuals and materials for volunteers, so that they can easily run these events at other schools across the country.

We will also be compiling video footage, testimonials, and appeals into a Phone Home, Save a Life documentary. Trust me, you'll want to be a part of that!


How You Can Help:

Indiegogo makes it easy! All you have to do is click - and pledge! It's that simple.

We make it easy, too. Our pledge levels start as low as $10.00 and go up to $2,500.00

I'm hoping that you'll see the value in this campaign, maybe think it's kind of neat that I'm doing this, and really just want to ride the wave and save a life or two. If you're not able to pledge (and I know not everyone can) you could still help by passing this link on to your friends, post it on Facebook, or Tweet it!
Remember: Don't take your organs to Heaven. Heaven knows we need them here :) 
See Empathy Factory CEO, Blair Ryan make a personal appeal.

Learn more about the Empathy Factory here.

story:
I woke up fat today.


I started this campaign because I woke up fat today. Today my weight was no different than it has been for many years, except that I decided I don't need to live this way anymore. My husband and I are raising funds to pay for a Vertical Sleeve Gastrectomy (VSG). Our family's insurance policy does not cover this procedure. It is in fact specifically excluded in such a way that we cannot even appeal.

I carry an extra person with me everywhere I go. This extra person started growing when I was 9 years old. I have a combination of PCOS and Insulin Resistance that are the primary cause of my weight gain and inability to loose. That extra person is creating stresses and strains on my body that it cannot and is not sustaining. The weight, PCOS, and Insulin Resistance are beginning to create peripheral medical problems such as joint damage, high blood pressure, and the beginnings of fatty liver.

I've tried it all

I've tried every weight loss technique out there: grapefruit diets, ladies only work facilities, medically managed programs, juice fasts, calorie counting, food logs, and more. Success at weight loss is something I've never had but not for a lack of trying. Doctors have always told me to lose weight but they follow that with a reminder that I won't be able to because of the PCOS. Weight gain and the inability to lose are hallmarks of this syndrome that has defined my life. I finally want to WIN againt it! 

Where will this journey take me

I don't fully know where this journey will take me. I expect that I will meet some amazing people who have struggled just like me. I expect there will be days I cry in frustration, dance with joy, and many emotions in between. Most of all I expect more days with my husband and children and family. More days I can write. More days I can take pictures. More days I can laugh and cry. More days. 

What do I want from this process

I am a wife and a mom of 3 amazing kids. I want to live to see my children grow up, marry, and have children of their own. I want to stand next to my husband and feel small and protected. I want to have a body that is not constantly in pain. I want to cross my legs while sitting and talking with friends. I want to not have to seek out the strongest looking chair in the room. I want to have a lap for my children to sit on. I want my children not to be afraid of looking like Momma when they grow up.

story:
My daughter Penelope was born perfect; Apgar scores of 8/9 with pink skin and healthy cry. I felt like my hard work had paid off.  I rushed home to begin my life as a Mommy.

     She developed faster than most:

- began signing at 3 months to get needs met (Momma, Dadda, Milk, Pain, Bath). 
- By 4 months, Penelope started talking and left us breathless. (Momma, Daddy, Night-Night, Milk, Pain, Bath, cat, book)
- Started using sign language even more efficiently after that introducing words like diaper and change.  
- By 10 months, our daughter was reading about 60 sight words.
- By the age of 1 year she was reading at about a kindergarten level and had literally hundreds of words in her functional vocabulary.  
- She walked normally and had imaginary play and artistic play much more quickly than others. 

Pretty Amazing right? Yeah we thought maybe we took the wrong baby home from the hospital.....


     She always had a very weak belly and we had to be very careful about her diet.  I went through MONTHS of colic!  It seems like it happened all at once that she couldn't eat or digest solid foods. 

One by one, every food she loved made her sick and:
- she stopped talking 
- developed a severe limp 
   - displayed signs of vertigo or severe dizziness and had to often use a wall or furniture to stand or walk without falling over
- violent twitch
   - Severe charlie horses, muscle cramping and loss of muscle tone
- couldn't fall or stay asleep
- She stopped smiling 
   - stopped making eye contact
- stopped responding to her name or even trying to get her needs met! 
- curled in a ball and rocked and said "pain" over and over 
   - her entire body swelled up and retained fluids

We went back and forth to doctors but because her symptoms on paper looked like "autism" no one listened to us just equating the food issues and the talking to the autism experience and they overlooked all other symptoms as just coincidental and not correlated. She lost pound after pound and one by one doctors would mention Autism before even seeing our child! At one point she was in the 10th percentile (failure to thrive) and failing fast. 

Studies have PROVEN that intolerances and allergies like Celiacs disease and soy intolerances (one of the ones my daughter has) can cause or mimic autism like disorders!  The sad reality however is that there are many doctors who either don't believe that or aren't up to date on new research.  It turns out that a severe food intolerance was doing damage to her body and brain and as a result we now have a Sensory Processing and Integration disorder.  She has issues with walking and using her arms. 
http://www.sinetwork.org/about-sensory-processing-disorder.html
 
 

We still don't have a diagnosis as to what is really going on with her but once we removed sugars and put her on the Elemental formula she began talking again and we saw improvements in her motor control!  She cannot eat solid foods at all without becoming physically ill and her blood tests show all sorts of issues. Her doctors are leaning toward a very rare condition known as HFI (hereditary Fructose Intolerance) which can lead to early liver disease and death.



We just want to heal her.  At this point having a child who can read at the age of two seems silly compared to the value of having a HEALTHY child! We used to worry about her fitting in with her peers when they can barely talk let alone comfortable in two languages and reading, now we just want her to EAT!
 
http://www.youtube.com/user/Penelopesproudmommy/videos

Her formula that is necessary to keep her healthy is 50 dollars a can! Can you believe that? I went from having a baby I could breastfeed and keep very healthy with a hand made organic diet, tons of yummy whole foods...to a child that can't tolerate anything in my diet and now has to have a liquid diet?  I just want her better but it is going to cost thousands of dollars. Why? One word...Insurance. We have it but there are co-pays and out of network doctors and uncovered tests and reimbursements 
 
Please help us heal our daughter!  Take a few moments to visit our Youtube page and share your prayers with Mom and Dad and Penny!

http://www.youtube.com/user/Penelopesproudmommy/videos
 
http://www.youtube.com/user/Penelopesproudmommy?feature=mhee
 
I can't thank you enough from the bottom of my heart for the positive energy and the donation! 
 

Benefit fund created for our daughter Penelope in the hopes to have enough money to get her tested and to be able to travel back and forth to hospitals and doctors without worry!

story:
Like many stories of this nature, ours began when boy met girl...

Jason and I (Shauna) met in 2000 through a mutual friend. After 3 years of dating, we were married poolside in a beautiful backyard ceremony with 60 of our closest family and friends there to share our joy. Today, 9 years later, we are still as much in love as we were that day.

Our (no) baby story...

Like a lot of young girls, I imagined my life following a certain path – growing-up, meeting the man of my dreams, getting married, and having a baby (in a baby carriage, no less). The problem – that last part has been a little harder to attain than I had anticipated.

For as long as I can remember – I’ve wanted to be a mommy. Unfortunately, my lady parts don’t function as they were intended and getting a baby bump of my own has been challenging to say the least. Back in 2002, at the age of 19, I was (finally) diagnosed with Endometriosis – which ultimately made trying to start our family naturally, from 2005-2010, nearly impossible. In 2010, physically worn and mentally drained, we took a break from fertility treatments and in early 2012, our journey took another turn and lead us to where we are today, ready to take the leap and begin IVF (In Vitro Fertilization). We are left with a new sense of hope – that with the help of IVF, someday soon, our family will be complete.

The sad reality is that the only thing standing between us and a baby is money. Our insurance company refuses to cover any portion of testing or treatment for infertility and the cost of IVF is very expensive - to the tune of around $18,000.

Where your donation will go...

Here's a breakdown of the testing and procedures your donation will go towards in helping make our dream of becoming parents a reality:

  • Fertility Medications
  • Cycle Stimulation, Monitoring and Ultrasounds
  • Egg retrieval with Anesthesia
  • ICSI (Intra Cytoplasmic Sperm Injection)
  • Assisted Egg Hatching
  • Embryo Transfer
  • Laboratory Screening and Pregnancy Testing

Other ways you can help...

We understand that finances are tight nowadays and making a donation may not be possible, here are some other ways you can help us reach our goal:

  • Share this page on your Facebook, Twitter or blog
  • Help us spread the word by passing along this link to family, friends and co-workers

Follow us on our journey through our blog Where's The Baby Carriage.

Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
On November 6, 2012 Melissa was rear ended in a car accident. The impact of the accident caused the seat to break away from the truck which caused her to slam forward and back. Her head hit the rear window and shattered the window. She was taken to the hospital and received a CT and MRI. The MRI revealed a Meningioma (brain tumor) behind her left eye. It is approximately the size of a nickel and needs to be removed. It is close to several important structures and will be a complicated surgery. Doctors are hopeful that it is benign, but will not know for certain until after the surgery.

Melissa is a single woman with many dear friends and family. She is a valuable member of the community. Melissa is the type of person to bring a meal when you have a baby or are sick. She hosts cookie parties for children several times a year. Melissa is the type of person that we all feel proud to know. Melissa has built her own house cleaning business and that is her only source of income.

Melissa is currently recovering from her injuries from the car accident. This has caused her to be unable to work until her doctors release her. It appears that insurance is covering her vehicle repairs, which are extensive, and her rental car except possibly one day. There are many expenses that she does need assistance with. At this time the loss of her income is a financial challenge. Friends and family have pitched in to help with bringing meals and money to help with groceries and getting her immediate expenses paid (food, utilities, house payment etc.) We are attempting to raise $6,000 for her which will specifically cover her $5,000 insurance deductible for the brain surgery, expected to happen in January. The remaining $1,000 is to cover her prescriptions. After she has paid $1,000 for prescriptions her insurance will cover the remaining. These two items total the $6,000 requested. Anything over that amount would truly be a blessing, as she does not know how much work she will have to miss.

Melissa is living the American Dream and has fallen on tough times. The accident may have been a blessing in disguise, but the impact of the accident and the tumor is incredibly difficult. This could happen to any of us. Your help is truly appreciated. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are unable to make a financial contribution please help to get her story out.  Please share with everyone you know and ask them to share with others.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Kelton Hollister, and I am a 21-year-old trans man living in Greensboro, North Carolina. I am in need of vital gender confirmation surgery, otherwise known as top surgery, to remove breast tissue and give me a flat chest. I currently wear a compression top to help disguise the appearance of my breast tissue, and this has begun to cause me some serious health complications. Due to the constricting nature of this chest binder, I have begun to suffer from rib pain, back problems, chest pains, difficulty breathing, and lung inflammation.
 
I've been saving up for this needed surgery, but I'm currently very far away from my financial goal. So now, I'm turning to fundraising to help afford surgery before these health complications get worse.

What I Need & What You Get

So how much do I need?
I'm trying to raise enough money to cover the surgery itself. This amounts to $6,500. I'm planning on covering prescription costs, travel expenses, and the cost of staying in a hotel during the recovery process myself. If I raise more than the $6,500 goal, the additional funds will go toward these other expenses, as well as paying off the indiegogo fees.
 
What do you get?
As well as my undying gratitude, I am providing a range of perks for those who donate certain set amounts. Depending on the amount you donate, you can get a postcard, handmade friendship bracelets, free food or drinks (I'll be taking you out to lunch, coffee, or drinks, you lucky duck!), digital art commissions, or knit sweatbands.

The Impact

If I can fundraise enough money to at least partially pay for top surgery, the impact on my life will be immeasurable. Being able to get this surgery as soon as possible will prevent my current binding-related health problems from getting worse. Binding over a long period of time has proven to often cause irreversible health problems, including but not limited to rib breaking or deformation, permanent organ deformation and damage, and heart and lung problems. In addition, the longer I wear a binder over a protracted period of time, the more my breast tissue and skin elasticity degrade, making the surgery more difficult and less effective.
 
Fundraising for the top surgery will also have other long-reaching effects in my life. I plan on going into LGBTQ* advocacy and education in the future, and I will need to complete a graduate degree in order to do so. As it is right now, all of my savings are going toward top surgery. If I can use fundraising to fund the surgery, more of my savings can go toward affording grad school. I truly believe that if I can afford graduate school and move into advocacy and education, I can have a positive impact on the world and the lives of LGBTQ* individuals. Being able to get top surgery out of the way would help me do this sooner rather than later.
 
As you can see, there are plenty of reasons to donate and spread the word, and plenty of impact your contribution will have on my life and the world!
 
Please note: While I am accepting donations both through credit card and paypal, credit card is preferred over paypal, as paypal takes a tax from donations. If you must use paypal, please list the donation as a "gift" so that the tax is lesser. Thank you!

I currently wear a compression top to help disguise the appearance of my breast tissue, and this has begun to cause me some serious health complications. Due to the constricting nature of this chest binder, I have begun to suffer from rib pain, back problems, chest pains, difficulty breathing, and lung inflammation.
 
I've been saving up for this needed surgery, but I'm currently very far away from my financial goal. So now, I'm turning to fundraising to help afford surgery before these health complications get worse.

What I Need & What You Get
So how much do I need?

I'm trying to raise enough money to cover the surgery itself. This amounts to $6,500. I'm planning on covering prescription costs, travel expenses, and the cost of staying in a hotel during the recovery process myself. If I raise more than the $6,500 goal, the additional funds will go toward these other expenses, as well as paying off the indiegogo fees.
 
What do you get?
As well as my undying gratitude, I am providing a range of perks for those who donate certain set amounts. Depending on the amount you donate, you can get a postcard, handmade friendship bracelets, free food or drinks (I'll be taking you out to lunch, coffee, or drinks, you lucky duck!), digital art commissions, or knit sweatbands.

The Impact
If I can fundraise enough money to at least partially pay for top surgery, the impact on my life will be immeasurable. Being able to get this surgery as soon as possible will prevent my current binding-related health problems from getting worse. Binding over a long period of time has proven to often cause irreversible health problems, including but not limited to rib breaking or deformation, permanent organ deformation and damage, and heart and lung problems. In addition, the longer I wear a binder over a protracted period of time, the more my breast tissue and skin elasticity degrade, making the surgery more difficult and less effective.
 
Fundraising for the top surgery will also have other long-reaching effects in my life. I plan on going into LGBTQ* advocacy and education in the future, and I will need to complete a graduate degree in order to do so. As it is right now, all of my savings are going toward top surgery. If I can use fundraising to fund the surgery, more of my savings can go toward affording grad school. I truly believe that if I can afford graduate school and move into advocacy and education, I can have a positive impact on the world and the lives of LGBTQ* individuals. Being able to get top surgery out of the way would help me do this sooner rather than later.
 
As you can see, there are plenty of reasons to donate and spread the word, and plenty of impact your contribution will have on my life and the world!
 

Please note: While I am accepting donations both through credit card and paypal, credit card is preferred over paypal, as paypal takes a tax from donations. If you must use paypal, please list the donation as a "gift" so that the tax is lesser. Thank you!

story:
It would be useless for us to give any description of the events that transpired on Monday, April 15th at the Boston Marathon. We’ve all seen them on TV, heard them on radio and read about them in the press. Americans from across the country sat glued to their TVs and the Internet as updates came pouring in from Boston. Thoughts and prayers flooded social networks with iconic images spurring from all over the country. We are taking these thoughts and prayers one step further! We believe Americans and especially Bostonians are resilient people! In times of need, we look toward the San Diego community to unite in helping in any way we can!

Why a fundraising campaign?

Actions speak louder than words! While none of our statements can turn back time, we can move forward and help out! We are fundraising for a total of $5000 (min) and hoping to bring San Diego together and send a message of brotherhood and love to our friends in Boston.

We have decided to focus our fundraising campaign on Mr. Jeff Bauman Jr., the man pictured below, who lost both legs in the blast and is currently in the hospital recovering. Mr. Bauman Jr. didn't even get out of intensive care and already has helped the FBI identify the individuals responsible for the Boston attacks. Read more here.

IMPORTANT

We had initially started the campaign with the thought of splitting the donations between Mr. Bauman Jr. and the Red Cross and fully intend on honoring that commitment to our donors who have ALREADY DONATED as of 4/19 at 4:15PM Pacific Standard Time (PST). We have reached out to our donors to determine how much of the money will be going to the Red Cross. Anything raised BEYOND the timepoint above will be going to Mr. Bauman Jr.

 

We were hesitant to mention Jeff's name for a while until we were able to reach his family and get permission. Good news! We were able to reach Jennifer Maybury and John Sullivan who are there with Jeff. They gave permission and now the San Diego community knows the positive identity of our beneficiary! 

Jeff is recovering in the hospital and even had a visit paid to him by actor Bradley Cooper, pictured below. We thank his friends and family for taking the time to keep us updated on his condition and send our thoughts and prayers to them! 

### Thank you to the friends and family of Jeff Bauman Jr. for connecting with us and confirming his identity! ###

 

What we need

Any amount will help us reach our goal of $5000. We are providing updates to our benefactors through the IndieGoGo campaign as we reach milestones during our fundraising campaign. Please find it in your heart and donate at least $1 to our efforts. If times are tough and money is short, you can also help us by sharing this campaign with your family, friends and co-workers! 

100% of the proceeds (after IndieGoGo fees) will be distributed according to the information above. While many news outlets have reported "overnight charities" being started after the attack, we asure you that this is a legitimate attempt to bring the community together and help one man in need! This fundraising campaign is run by Bogdan Rau, a graduate student in the Graduate School of Public Health at San Diego State University. With the help of journalism students at San Diego State University, our campaign has taken off on Twitter using hashtag #SDSUlovesBoston. 

We encourage everyone to donate to any legitimate charity and we hope that you will consider contributing what you can to our cause. For information or concerns, please email Bogdan at bogdan dot rau at gmail dot com.

Please also remember to share this campaign with your family and friends. Every like and every tweet helps us get closer to our $5000 goal!

 

Thoughts from donors

One of our donors from IRELAND visited Boston last year and has a soft spot for the city ever since. Seeing the horrible news prompted her to join in on our efforts! From BOGDAN: I am extremely grateful for the help that you have provided and for going beyond clicking on the CONTRIBUTE button!

Another benefactor contributed because she had a personal connection to the Boston Marathon. Two friends were in Boston at the time, one of them suporting a friend. This personal connection struck a chord.

For our donors: if you've donated and would like to share your thoughts, please email Bogdan at bogdan dot rau at gmail dot com. Anything that you share will be posted annonymously on this campaign page. 

 

IN THE PRESS

  • San Diego Union Tribune: Through the #SDSUlovesBoston twitter hashtag, our campagin received some media coverage, particularly from the San Diego Union Tribune. Article available here. 
  • Boston Magazine: Full article available here.
  • The Daily Aztec: Full article available here.
  • FOX 5 San Diego: The #SDSUlovesBoston hashtag also received local coverage on FOX5 San Diego.
  • CBS 8 San Diego: #SDSUlovesBoston and our fundraising efforts covered during the CBS 8 11PM news! 
  • Additionally, our efforts have also been recognized by local sports blog San Diego Sports Domination. Click here for the original article!
 
We are looking to partner with the media and share our message and campaign to the broader San Diego audience and make this happen! If you would like to speak to us, please contact Bogdan at bogdan dot rau at gmail dot com. We are also looking for help from the media to help us contact the family of the man in the picture. Any information is greatly appreciated. 
 
We are in contact with the Lowell Sun to reach his family and are trying to get in contact with the New York Times for additional help. 
 
 

OPEN LETTER TO THE San Diego Small Business Community

We believe that San Diego has a flourishing and entrepreneurial business community. For those business owners that have a sense for social justice and social enterprise, please read my Open Request to the San Diego Small Business Community and consider getting involved! 

 

THANK YOU!

We appreciate everyone that has donated even $1 to our cause. Know that you are doing an amazing thing! We hope that you continue to share our cause with your family, friends and co-workers. We have a limited timeframe to raise the funds. 

 

NOTICE: in order to preserve transparency, we need to mention (as IndieGoGo mentions in their terms and conditions) that certain fees are assessed by IndieGoGo for maintaining this campaign. If this campaign is successfully funded (we reach at least $5000), IndieGoGo will charge 4% of the total amount as a fee. We have reached out to IndieGoGo staff to determine if this fee can be waived and are awaiting response.

story:
We need your help.

 

Have you enjoyed time in our hot-tub here at Easton Mountain? Soaking with an old friend or new lover? Well our hot-tub is broken. We have been putting Band-Aids on it for months and it has finally reached it's end. And now we need your help to bring a new hot-tub to Easton Mountain, 

 

Hot Tub!

 

All funds raised will go toward the purchase of a new hot-tub and the repairs that need to be made to the area around and under the current hot-tub. Big or small, every little bit helps. 

 

 If we reach our goal.....

 

If we happen to go over and above our goal (which we hope we do), any money beyond the purchase of the Hot Tub will go to purchase new commercial size washing machines for the laundry room. Can you believe we do all that laundry with 2 small household size washers? Crazy.

 

Thanks for all our help and support

 

www.eastonmountain.org

Thanks for all our help and support
 
www.eastonmountain.org

story:
Hello friends. I've created this campaign to raise funds for my upcoming fight.

Many of you don't know that renewing your professional license yearly is very expensive. The cost of medicals is $730 and getting sponsors to pay for it at the lower levels is very difficult to come by. The cost of training, medicals, gear, etc, without any sponsors is very costly. I work 11 hours a day between my regualr job and teaching MMA, most of the money going to bills and the baby. So I'm asking for any donation. Anything you can give to my campaign is greatly appreciated. I know times are tough for a lot of people so if you cannot donate I totally understand but if you can share this on your page that will help a lot as well. Any little helps, even if its just a dollar. for the first 10 that donates $100, I will put you on my walkout shirt as well as give a free shirt if you have a business logo, I will advertise it. My fight will be streaming live for thousands to see. Thank you all for your love and support. From #teamflash

story:
I wanted to take a moment to tell you about my amazing sister, Carroll Meilleur, and her ultimate act of kindness; she is donating her kidney to a stranger.  Yes, a complete stranger! Carroll just turned 40, and is a single mother to two children, Jacob 9 and Alyssa 13. She has donated blood since she was old enough to do so- started at age 17. Carroll felt donating blood was vital, but that it seemed like there was more she could do. She wasn’t sure what that was until a friend from high school told her about a Facebook page called, “Are you and O?” As it turned out, Carroll was, indeed, and O! She read about Gord Johnson, and how his kidneys failed after a cut received playing hockey became infected. She read how he has two young children with whom he can no longer run and play because he feels like he constantly has the flu. She discovered Gord was on the deceased donor list for kidney, but they estimated it would take many more years, by which time he would most likely be too sick to be a candidate for the surgery. She thought about the children, and how their dad had been sick for so long that they didn’t really remember what he was like healthy. Gord’s story touched her heart, and she decided that this was that something more she could do. Many tests later, Carroll has discovered she is a perfect match and an excellent donor candidate. Now, she is simply waiting for them to book the surgery.

Most people’s reactions have been positive, but some people think she is a bit crazy, especially when they discover she has an 8-10 week recovery period to get through. When I found out about the recovery being so long, I asked her how she would get by missing so much work. I figured there must be some sort of fund to help donors get through such a long period without work. As it turns out, there isn't a lot. She can go on unemployment during this time, but that is nowhere near her usual pay. I can’t believe my sister is going to lose money donating her kidney. Of course, this isn’t holding her back. She’s determined to go through with her donation, and now I am determined to make sure she is not going to suffer financially from her act of kindness.

Carroll wants people to know how easy it is to get tested for donating. There are many tests, that is for certain. The upside, she says, is that she has been scanned and tested from top to bottom, and now she knows she is in excellent health. She also thinks more people would donate if there was a way they wouldn’t lose money doing so.

One way we are trying to help Carroll, is through fundraising with Indiegogo. We want to raise just $1000 through this site to get her through the weeks she isn’t working. We will be fundraising in any other way we can, but I hope the kind people of the internet can help Carroll as well.

Thank you in advance for your kindness!

If you want to find out your blood type, or find out more info about the living donor program, call BC Transplant at 604-875-5182, or visit www.transplant.bc.ca

story:
Hello! We are the Fast and Furious Sport Stacking Team from Colorado. Our team formed in 2008 with Segovia Garcia, Kellon Mitchell, and Jordan Green. Over the years we are honored to have added Aaron Shultz, Josh Schwarz, and Tim Mellen to our team. We are a group of great friends that met doing what we love, Sport Stacking. The Fast and Furious team has won numerous State, National, and World awards and currently hold Colorado State records. We have competed against teams from countries across the globe. Now, we need your help going to the 2016 World Sport Stacking Championships... in Speichersdorf, Germany!


For the six of us and two parents to travel to Speichersdorf, the trip will cost a total of about $15,000. 

  • Plane Tickets: $10,400 (At current rates)
  • Train Tickets: $100 (To and from Speichersdorf)
  • Hotel: $800 (Hotels are cheap in Europe!)
  • Food: $2,500 
  • Misc (Registration, souvenirs, etc.): $800
  • Cushion Money (Just in Case!): $340
If sufficient funds are not provided for this trip, all funds raised would go into our team savings account, helping fund trips to future tournaments. 

Our team has gone to 6 of the last 8 world championships, our most recent being the 2015 championships in Montreál, Canada. Every time, we have relied on close friends, relatives, and the generosity of people to help get us to these amazing events. However, this event is the most expensive we have had to raise funds for. That is why we are expanding our reach for this trip!

 

We understand not everyone can donate monetarily. That is why we are asking everyone to share this campaign. Get the word out! We would greatly appreciate it!

story:
Our friend Miguel (our beloved provider of libations)...

...is having surgery 01/26 and will be on medical leave for 6 weeks. It's a minor procedure, but he's been working extra shifts to help cover his temporary disability from work.  As a nice gesture, we would like to collect some money to provide him a "tip" of our appreciation to entertain him while he's recovering.  

What you can do...

We have set up this Indiegogo project site to help raise funds online.  In addition, we will also have a "tip jar" for anyone who would like to contribute in Evanston.  A few items of note:

  • Although I have set a bar to raise $500, there is no ceiling or basement.  Whatever we raise will be appreciated
  • All funds go to Miguel
  • Although the close date of this project is much later than the surgery date (early February), we will likely take the funds out sooner to give Miguel the initial gift.  Any money coming in later will be provided to him later.  
  • Any recommendations on how we provide the gift are appreciated.  We will update the site on how to submit those later

Please respond soon.

Given that the surgery is only a short time away, we will want to pull our collective funds together asap.  Please give whatever you are comfortable with to the project or in the tip jar.  

Special Thanks...

...to all those who helped come up with the idea of raising some money for Miguel and were/area eager to chip in for a very good cause.  

...and to Miguel who has helped make networking and socializing at Northwestern Kellogg that much easier. And being a really good guy!

story:
Summary

My name is Ali McWeeny, 24 year old athlete and above knee amputee. I've played sports my entire life, went off to college to become a coach and Physical Education teacher and collegiate athlete at Central Washington University.

7/4/2009-At the age of 20, as a Jr. at CWU I was in a boating accident that changed my life. I was left with an above knee amputation on my left side and severe damage to my right hamstring and gluteus maximus. My doctors told me I had to change my hobbies (sports) and my career goal (a Physical Education teacher). I refused to do so and now 3 years later I have graduated college with a Physical Education Degree and a Coaching Minor.

My medical insurance only covers one prosthetic leg and that is the one I use for everyday life, coaching, and teaching, but I want to do more!

I have found a prosthetic leg that will allow me to return to the extreme sports I love before my accident; wake boarding, snow boarding, natural rock climbing, surfing, etc.  I'm asking for helping to purchase a new leg and most importantly new life!

Not only will this new prosthetic allow me to return to my extreme sport hobbies, it will also assist my teaching.  With the "new" P.E. that I have been educated to apply includes rock climbing, hiking, geocaching, watersports, etc. This new prosthetic knee will allow me to teach all of these skills to my students without having to worry about water, weather, and heavy resistance damage.  With the prosthesis my insurance covers I cannot risk any sports or activities that could damage or leave the ability of my only prosthetic in question.

What We Need & The Possibilities

The prosthetic knee that this is for is the Bartlett Tendon Universal Knee, designed by professional downhill mountain biker and above knee amputee, Brian Bartlett. Brian works with my prosthetic doctor, Dave Hughes, out of Cornerstone Prosthetics in Everett, Washington. 

The price of the leg after taxes is just under $7,000 and I have been told it is worth every penny.  This leg will allow me to return to:

Winter Sports: Snowboarding, Alpine skiing, Telemark skiing, Cross country skiing, and Snow kiting.

Water Sports: Water skiing, Wakeboarding, Wind surfing, Kite boarding, Scuba diving, Swimming, and Surfing.

Summer Sports: Mountain biking, Road cycling, Skate boarding, and Inline skating.

Moto Sports: Moto-cross, Trail riding, and Snowmobile riding.

Rehabilitation: Build muscle, Promote general fitness, Increase active, and quality time with family

This is everything I've been asking for and more!!

All of the funds raised will go straight to the purchase of this leg, but if we raise more than what is needed I plan to give the rest to a charity for others in need of help in getting a prosthetic.

website for the prosthetic: http://leftsideinc.com/

The Impact

After being told I would never compete in the same sports again, I have become the Only girl in the World to compete in Powerlifting fully on one leg without a prosthesis.  My new personal records for my one-legged competitions @ 125 lbs. are Bench-172 lbs., Squat-104 lbs. and Deadlift-204 lbs.  My next competition is in Elizabethton, Tennessee at the Night of The Living Deadlift where all of the best deadlifters in the world come to compete on the same stage. My personal goal will be deadlift 250 lbs. at this meet and my fundraiser will run until the day after this meet, October 13th and end October 14th.

This prosthetic leg will allow me to become the Physical Education teacher that I've aspired to be for so long. With losing my leg when I was only half way finished with my teaching degree I could've listened to the doctors and given up, but I didn't. I knew that it would not be easy finishing college and adapting my teaching and life to my new condition, but I conquered that as well. Now I've finished college and soon entering the teaching world all I can think of is what I won't be able to do with my students since my insured prosthetic is so sensitive to being damaged and out of commission.  I have finally found the leg that will allow me to reach any height I want as well as with my students, not holding anyone around me back. 

With your help we can make this happen! I am also starting a personal blog very soon that I will be documenting all of my adventures on so you can follow what you've done for me!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are financially unable to donate, you can help by sharing my story and fundraisers with anyone and everyone you can!!  

There is Indiegogo sharing tools to post this on your facebook, twitter, myspace, email, etc. as well.

THANK YOU AGAIN FOR YOUR TIME!! AND REMEMBER,

NEVER GIVE UP

NEVER LOOK BACK!
story_txt:
Summary
My name is Ali McWeeny, 24 year old athlete and above knee amputee. I've played sports my entire life, went off to college to become a coach and Physical Education teacher and collegiate athlete at Central Washington University.
7/4/2009-At the age of 20, as a Jr. at CWU I was in a boating accident that changed my life. I was left with an above knee amputation on my left side and severe damage to my right hamstring and gluteus maximus. My doctors told me I had to change my hobbies (sports) and my career goal (a Physical Education teacher). I refused to do so and now 3 years later I have graduated college with a Physical Education Degree and a Coaching Minor.
My medical insurance only covers one prosthetic leg and that is the one I use for everyday life, coaching, and teaching, but I want to do more!
I have found a prosthetic leg that will allow me to return to the extreme sports I love before my accident; wake boarding, snow boarding, natural rock climbing, surfing, etc.  I'm asking for helping to purchase a new leg and most importantly new life!
Not only will this new prosthetic allow me to return to my extreme sport hobbies, it will also assist my teaching.  With the "new" P.E. that I have been educated to apply includes rock climbing, hiking, geocaching, watersports, etc. This new prosthetic knee will allow me to teach all of these skills to my students without having to worry about water, weather, and heavy resistance damage.  With the prosthesis my insurance covers I cannot risk any sports or activities that could damage or leave the ability of my only prosthetic in question.

The prosthetic knee that this is for is the Bartlett Tendon Universal Knee, designed by professional downhill mountain biker and above knee amputee, Brian Bartlett. Brian works with my prosthetic doctor, Dave Hughes, out of Cornerstone Prosthetics in Everett, Washington. 
The price of the leg after taxes is just under $7,000 and I have been told it is worth every penny.  This leg will allow me to return to:

Water Sports: Water skiing, Wakeboarding, Wind surfing, Kite boarding, Scuba diving, Swimming, and Surfing.
Summer Sports: Mountain biking, Road cycling, Skate boarding, and Inline skating.
Moto Sports: Moto-cross, Trail riding, and Snowmobile riding.
Rehabilitation: Build muscle, Promote general fitness, Increase active, and quality time with family
This is everything I've been asking for and more!!
All of the funds raised will go straight to the purchase of this leg, but if we raise more than what is needed I plan to give the rest to a charity for others in need of help in getting a prosthetic.
website for the prosthetic: http://leftsideinc.com/
The Impact
After being told I would never compete in the same sports again, I have become the Only girl in the World to compete in Powerlifting fully on one leg without a prosthesis.  My new personal records for my one-legged competitions @ 125 lbs. are Bench-172 lbs., Squat-104 lbs. and Deadlift-204 lbs.  My next competition is in Elizabethton, Tennessee at the Night of The Living Deadlift where all of the best deadlifters in the world come to compete on the same stage. My personal goal will be deadlift 250 lbs. at this meet and my fundraiser will run until the day after this meet, October 13th and end October 14th.

With losing my leg when I was only half way finished with my teaching degree I could've listened to the doctors and given up, but I didn't. With your help we can make this happen! I am also starting a personal blog very soon that I will be documenting all of my adventures on so you can follow what you've done for me!
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are financially unable to donate, you can help by sharing my story and fundraisers with anyone and everyone you can!!  
There is Indiegogo sharing tools to post this on your facebook, twitter, myspace, email, etc. as well.
THANK YOU AGAIN FOR YOUR TIME!! AND REMEMBER,
NEVER GIVE UP
NEVER LOOK BACK!

story:
GO GREEN, GO CLEAN !

By choosing this theme, a small team and me, Erich Goergens, want to stress the importance of using non-polluting energy resources at all levels – in families, companies, communities and nations to protect our environment!

Languages
This campaign text is, of course, available in ENGLISH as well as GERMAN (Bitte scrollen Sie nach unten, um zur deutschen Version zu gelangen.)

Supporters from the very beginning
Nestled in the Songshan Mountains, Henan Province and with a history of more than 1,500 years, Shaolin Temple is UNESCO heritage listed and has long been considered as the cradle of Chinese kung fu and home of Zen Buddhism.

Acknowledgment
We like to express our deepest gratitude to the Venerable Grandmaster Shi Yong Chuan, Abbot of the Shaolin Temple Germany for granting permission to support our campaign. Special thanks goes to Dr Ding, General Secretary of the Shaolin Culture Center, Berlin, Germany for his efforts and encouragement. And last but not least, we like to thank the monks and the community of the Shaolin Culture Center in Berlin for their support. May our joint effort ensure the global use of a clean, renewable and affordable energy technology.

Aims
Ensure the application of the Potential Energy Drive (PE-Drive) as a key-technology to overcome environmental problems and threats such as air pollution (caused by CO2 emissions) or shortages of drinking water (due to the lack of energy for water conditioning and purification treatment). This would be achieved by collecting funds to present the PE-Drive and to acquire licensees.

Why an international Indiegogo campagne?
Because Indiegogo provides a suitable, professional platform to generate enthusiasm throughout the world, get in touch with supporters, promote the idea and last but not least, collect funds. Moreover, people can contribute their capabilities to make this campaign a success. Supporters and patrons will be kept informed of the progress via the Indiegogo campaign page.

What is the solution?
The PE-Drive uses patent-pending mechanics to avoid the loss of a supported load's potential energy while compensating drive resistances, maintaining the state of equilibrium and overcome solely frictional resistance. This way you could use existing infrastructure without making a detour through generating steam to drive turbines. Besides, this technology is available at any time and anywhere.

What makes the PE-Drive unique?
It is a reversible, self-sufficient, safe and clean technology providing an adjusted energy balance, a coefficient of performance (COP) > 9, hence exceeding the state of the art techniques.

Plea
Dear reader, become a team member or patron and support our initiative to use a clean technology to protect the environment! Everybody is welcome to participate. Start now, become an environmental envoy and talk about this campaign with people you know and promote our cause.

Passion: Promote the use of clean technology and non-polluting energy resources to protect our environment.

Location: Moenchengladbach, Germany.

Category: Establish contacts to business partners and licensees.

Flexible funding: Every contribution to protect the environment counts.

Dateline: February 25 to April 4, 2013 (40 days)

Profile: Since the 60s, I have worked as a designer among other things in structural engineering, especially in the field of safety relevant pipe and components construction for nuclear power plants with emphasis on earthquake-proof support systems. 2005-2010 I did research on the increase of drive system efficiency. In the wake of Fukushima, I took up again development of the PE-Drive. Currently, I am working on the promotion of this new technology.

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
D E U T S C H E  VERSION  (Text in German Language following)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GO GREEN, GO CLEAN !

Mit diesem Motto möchten mein kleines Team und ich, Erich Goergens, die Bedeutung der Nutzung umweltfreundlicher Technologien hervorheben, und zwar in allen Bereichen unseres Lebens: in Familien, Firmen, Städten und gleichermassen für Nationen. Nur gemeinsam können wir die Umwelt verbessern!

Unterstützer der ersten Stunde
Eingebettet in den Bergen von Songshan in der chinesischen Provinz Henan liegt der Shaolin Tempel. Mit seiner mehr als 1500-jährigen Geschichte steht er auf der UNESCO-Liste des Weltkulturerbes. Schon seit langer Zeit gilt er als Wiege des Kung Fu und Heimstatt des Zen-Buddhismus.

Danksagung
Wir bedanken uns beim ehrwürdigen Grossmeister Shi Yongchuan, Abt des Shaolin Tempels Deutschland, für seine dem Berliner Shaolin Kulturzentrum gegebene Erlaubnis unsere Kampagne zu unterstützen. Besonderer Dank gilt hier dem Generalsekretär des Shaolin Kulturzentrums, Berlin, Herrn Dr. Ding, für seine Bemühungen und seinen Einsatz. Nicht zuletzt gilt unser Dank den Mönchen und der Gemeinschaft des Berliner Shaolin Kulturzentrums für ihre Unterstützung. Mögen unsere gemeinsamen Anstrengungen zum weltweiten Einsatz einer umweltfreundlichen, erneuerbaren und erschwinglichen Technologie führen.

Ziele
Einsatz des PE-Drive (Potential Energy Drive, d.h. Antriebstechnologie unter Nutzung potentieller Energie) als Schlüsseltechnologie zur Lösung von Umweltproblemen wie beispielsweise der Luftverschmutzung durch CO-Emissionen oder der Trinkwasserverknappung aufgrund energetisch aufwendiger Aufbereitung. All dies wollen wir durch das Sammeln von Spenden zur Vermarktung und Lizenzierung des PE-Drive erreichen.

Warum eine internationale Indiegogo Kampagne ?
Weil Indiegogo eine geeignete Plattform bietet, um weltweit Menschen zu begeistern, Unterstützer zu finden, die Idee bekannt zu machen und nicht zuletzt Spenden zu sammeln. Ausserdem können bei Indiegogo Menschen nicht nur mit finanziellen Beiträgen, sondern auch durch Einsatz ihrer vielfältigen Fähigheit zum Erfolg einer Kampagne beitragen. Unterstützer und Spender können sich auf dieser Kampagnen-Seite über den Fortgang informieren.

Wie sieht die Lösung aus ?
Die PE-Drive Technologie kann jeder Zeit, an jedem Ort, völlig umweltfreundlich und ohne äußere Energieressourcen, rein mechanisch potenzielle Energie so stützen, dass zwischen beliebigen treibenden- und getriebenen- Systemen Gleichgewicht eingestellt wird und bleibt. Dann ist nur noch zur Überwindung der Reibung Antriebsenergie erforderlich, um beispielsweise Generatoren in Kraftwerken ohne Verbrennungsprozesse und ohne Turbine anzutreiben.

Was sind die Alleinstellungsmerkmale ?
Die PE-Drive Technologie ist reversibel, autonom, erreicht positive Energiebilanzen, Leistungszahlen > 9, ihr Neuerungsgrad liegt weit über dem Stand der Technik und sie ist patentrechtlich geschützt.

Bitte an die Leser !
Liebe Leser, werden Sie Team-Mitglied, Spender oder Unterstützer unserer Initiative zur Nutzung umweltfreundlicher Technologie! Jeder ist willkommen, um im Rahmen seiner Möglichkeiten zum Erfolg beizutragen. Fangen Sie jetzt an, werden Sie Umweltbotschafter und geben Sie diese Information an Menschen weiter, die Sie kennen. Sprechen Sie mit Freunden und Bekannten und helfen damit nicht nur unserer Kampagne, sondern auch der Umwelt.

Leidenschaft: Die Anwendung umweltfreundlicher Technologien zur Verbesserung unserer Umgebung.

Ort: Mönchengladbach, Deutschland.

Kategorie: Technik, Kontakte zu potentiellen Geschäftspartnern und Lizenzgebern.

Flexibles Modell: Jeder Beitrag zum Schutz der Umwelt zählt.

Zeitraum: 21. Februar bis 8. April 2013 (47 Tage)

Profil: Seit 1965 als Maschinenbauer u.a. im AKW-Kraftwerksbau in Europa und den USA tätig, waren die Konstruktion erdbebensicherer Stützsysteme, Analyse und Sicherung statisch-/dynamischer Verhaltensformen mittels passiver Verformungskontrolle, Schwerpunkte meiner der Tätigkeit, die sich auch auf Bereiche der Fahrzeugdynamik, Umformtechnik, den Brückenbau und schlanke, hohe Bauwerke, ausdehnte. 1975 begannen energetische Konzepte zunehmend zur Ursache und Grundlage der heutigen PE-Drive Technologie zu werden. 1990 habe ich diese Entwicklung unterbrochen. 2005-2011 konnte ich in einem Technikum nach Lösungen zur Effizienzsteigerung beliebiger Antriebssysteme forschen. Nach dem Unfall in Fukushima (im März 2011) glaubte ich an eine Zeitenwende, weshalb ich die 1990 unterbrochene Entwicklung zur PE-Drive Technologie wieder aufnahm.

Aktuell: Jetzt sind wir ein Team. Gemeinsam haben wir die Chance, diese Technologie zur Lösung von Umwelt- und Energieproblemen und damit die Gestaltung einer besseren Zukunft voranzutreiben.

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
C H I N E S E  VERSION  (Text in Chinese Language following)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

走向绿色！走向洁净！

 

这是本人埃里希·桂尔根斯和我的小团队的座右铭，我们强调利用有利于环境的技术，并且是在我们的所有生活领域：家庭、公司、城市还有国家。我们只有共同来做才能改善环境！

 

最初的支持者

 

位于中国河南省的嵩山少林寺具有1500多年的历史，列入联合国教科文组织的世界文化遗产名录，早就是功夫的摇篮和禅宗发源地。

 

感谢

 

 

我们感谢德国少林寺住持释永传大师，感谢他允许其位于柏林的少林文化中心支持我们的宣传，特别要感谢欧洲少林联合会秘书长丁丁博士的努力，还要感谢柏林的德国少林寺僧人的支持。愿我们的共同努力导致有利于环境的、可再生、可负担得起的技术得到应用。

 

目标

 

采用PE驱动（位能驱动，即利用位能的驱动技术）作为关键技术来解决环境问题，例如由于碳排放导致的空气污染或因耗能加工导致的饮水紧缺。我们想通过募捐将PE驱动投放市场和发放许可证。

 

为何采用国际众筹平台（Indiegogo）宣传？

 

众筹平台提供合适的平台，在全世界激励人们发现支持者，让创意为人所知，筹集捐款。此外，通过众筹平台不仅可以捐款、而且也可通过自己的才能为宣传的成功做出贡献。支持者和捐款者可以通过这个宣传页了解进展。

 

解决办法

 

PE驱动技术可在任何时候、任何地点完全环保地依靠纯粹机械位能，无需外在能源，让任意驱动与被驱动系统之间调整并保持平衡。例如，只需要消除驱动能的损耗，即可无需燃烧过程和涡轮机来驱动发电厂的发动机。

 

独特之处

 

PE驱动技术是可逆、自动的，达到良性能量平衡，功能系数>9，其革新程度远超过技术现状，受到专利法保护。

 

请告知读者！

 

亲爱的读者，支持我们利用有利于环境的技术倡议，成为团队成员、捐款者或支持者吧！欢迎大家各尽所能为取得成功做出贡献。从现在开始，您就是环境大使，把这个信息传递给您认识的人，与您的朋友熟人谈论它，不仅帮助这个宣传而且也帮助环境。

 

热情所在：采用有利于环境的技术改善我们的周围环境。

 

所在地点：德国Mönchengladbach

归属类别：技术，与潜在商业伙伴和许可证发放者联系。

 

灵活模式： 保护环境的任何贡献都有作用。

 

时间范围：2013年2月21日至4月8日（47天）

个人简介：自1965年作为机械工程师在欧洲和美国从事核电站建造，设计抗震的支撑系统，通过被动变形控制分析和保障静态和动态行为形态，工作重点扩展到汽车动力、变形技术、桥梁建造和狭长的高层建筑领域。1975年开始探究能量方案的原因和基础，日益成为今天的PE驱动技术。1990年中断了这个发展。2005年至2011年得以在一所工业学校研究任意驱动系统效率提高的解决办法。日本福岛灾难（2011年3月）之后，我相信转机到来，于是重新捡起1990年中断的PE-驱动技术。

 

当前现状：我们现在有个团队，推进这个解决环境和能源问题的技术、从而构建更好的未来，是我们大家的共同机遇。

Sprechen Sie mit Freunden und Bekannten und helfen damit nicht nur unserer Kampagne, sondern auch der Umwelt.Leidenschaft: Die Anwendung umweltfreundlicher Technologien zur Verbesserung unserer Umgebung.Ort: Mönchengladbach, Deutschland.Kategorie: Technik, Kontakte zu potentiellen Geschäftspartnern und Lizenzgebern.Flexibles Modell: Jeder Beitrag zum Schutz der Umwelt zählt.Zeitraum: 21. Februar bis 8. April 2013 (47 Tage)Profil: Seit 1965 als Maschinenbauer u.a. im AKW-Kraftwerksbau in Europa und den USA tätig, waren die Konstruktion erdbebensicherer Stützsysteme, Analyse und Sicherung statisch-/dynamischer Verhaltensformen mittels passiver Verformungskontrolle, Schwerpunkte meiner der Tätigkeit, die sich auch auf Bereiche der Fahrzeugdynamik, Umformtechnik, den Brückenbau und schlanke, hohe Bauwerke, ausdehnte. 1975 begannen energetische Konzepte zunehmend zur Ursache und Grundlage der heutigen PE-Drive Technologie zu werden. 1990 habe ich diese Entwicklung unterbrochen. 2005-2011 konnte ich in einem Technikum nach Lösungen zur Effizienzsteigerung beliebiger Antriebssysteme forschen. Nach dem Unfall in Fukushima (im März 2011) glaubte ich an eine Zeitenwende, weshalb ich die 1990 unterbrochene Entwicklung zur PE-Drive Technologie wieder aufnahm.Aktuell: Jetzt sind wir ein Team. Gemeinsam haben wir die Chance, diese Technologie zur Lösung von Umwelt- und Energieproblemen und damit die Gestaltung einer besseren Zukunft voranzutreiben.
 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------C H I N E S E  VERSION  (Text in Chinese Language following)---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
走向绿色！走向洁净！
 
这是本人埃里希·桂尔根斯和我的小团队的座右铭，我们强调利用有利于环境的技术，并且是在我们的所有生活领域：家庭、公司、城市还有国家。我们只有共同来做才能改善环境！
 
最初的支持者
 
位于中国河南省的嵩山少林寺具有1500多年的历史，列入联合国教科文组织的世界文化遗产名录，早就是功夫的摇篮和禅宗发源地。
 
感谢
 
 
我们感谢德国少林寺住持释永传大师，感谢他允许其位于柏林的少林文化中心支持我们的宣传，特别要感谢欧洲少林联合会秘书长丁丁博士的努力，还要感谢柏林的德国少林寺僧人的支持。愿我们的共同努力导致有利于环境的、可再生、可负担得起的技术得到应用。
 
目标
 
采用PE驱动（位能驱动，即利用位能的驱动技术）作为关键技术来解决环境问题，例如由于碳排放导致的空气污染或因耗能加工导致的饮水紧缺。我们想通过募捐将PE驱动投放市场和发放许可证。
 
为何采用国际众筹平台（Indiegogo）宣传？
 
众筹平台提供合适的平台，在全世界激励人们发现支持者，让创意为人所知，筹集捐款。此外，通过众筹平台不仅可以捐款、而且也可通过自己的才能为宣传的成功做出贡献。支持者和捐款者可以通过这个宣传页了解进展。
 
解决办法
 
PE驱动技术可在任何时候、任何地点完全环保地依靠纯粹机械位能，无需外在能源，让任意驱动与被驱动系统之间调整并保持平衡。例如，只需要消除驱动能的损耗，即可无需燃烧过程和涡轮机来驱动发电厂的发动机。
 
独特之处
 
PE驱动技术是可逆、自动的，达到良性能量平衡，功能系数>9，其革新程度远超过技术现状，受到专利法保护。
 
请告知读者！
 
亲爱的读者，支持我们利用有利于环境的技术倡议，成为团队成员、捐款者或支持者吧！欢迎大家各尽所能为取得成功做出贡献。从现在开始，您就是环境大使，把这个信息传递给您认识的人，与您的朋友熟人谈论它，不仅帮助这个宣传而且也帮助环境。
 
热情所在：采用有利于环境的技术改善我们的周围环境。
 
所在地点：德国Mönchengladbach
归属类别：技术，与潜在商业伙伴和许可证发放者联系。
 
灵活模式： 保护环境的任何贡献都有作用。
 
时间范围：2013年2月21日至4月8日（47天）
个人简介：自1965年作为机械工程师在欧洲和美国从事核电站建造，设计抗震的支撑系统，通过被动变形控制分析和保障静态和动态行为形态，工作重点扩展到汽车动力、变形技术、桥梁建造和狭长的高层建筑领域。1975年开始探究能量方案的原因和基础，日益成为今天的PE驱动技术。1990年中断了这个发展。2005年至2011年得以在一所工业学校研究任意驱动系统效率提高的解决办法。日本福岛灾难（2011年3月）之后，我相信转机到来，于是重新捡起1990年中断的PE-驱动技术。
 
当前现状：我们现在有个团队，推进这个解决环境和能源问题的技术、从而构建更好的未来，是我们大家的共同机遇。

story:
On August 11, 2012, my wonderful, generous, sassy, independent, 25 year old sister was in a horrible car accident. She did exactly what she had been trained her to do. She was out partying, had a sober designated driver and was wearing a seatbelt. But in one second of a mistake by the driver, her life is now forever changed. She was rushed to LA/USC medical center trauma unit and underwent 14 hours of surgery and 13 blood transfusions to attempt to save some movement below her waist.
 
On impact, the seatbelt saved her life but it twisted and crushed her vertebra into her spinal column. Her lungs were punctured and her liver was lacerated. They had to go in and rebuild her. Thankfully, she has a great team of doctors overseeing her care. They were able to place a rod in her back and build a cage for support. Her back alone is now worth 6 million dollars in titanium. She is insured now, but won't be after her birthday in December.
 
She has an overwhelming and incredible amount of love and support coming from her all of her awesome friends and family, but will need relief financially as great medical care does cost a great deal of money. That’s where you come in. We have set up this Indiegogo account as means to help raise funds for her medical bills.Anything you can donate will be more than appreciated by our family.
 
Also, if you know and love Bailey, share stories and photos here for everyone to reflect on, enjoy, and find comfort in. She needs love, light and positive thoughts sent her way. Here’s to Bailey’s road to recovery!!

story:
Summary

Our project, From Beef to Beets(TM), makes it easier for people who want to change their food choices and move to a plant-based diet. 

Right now, you are in the minority, and vegan options are few and far between.  That is all changing and we think this app will go a long way to making that change easier and more fun.

From Beef to Beets makes that change easier and more fun by delivering really useful nuggets of information every day to your smart phone. For example:

  • it provides you with a list of simple ingredient substitutions
  • you get great advice on protein sources and debunking of the 'protein myth'
  • you get examples on how to make it easy when you are invited to a dinner hosted by a non-vegetarian
  • you get great info on the kitchen tools that will make it easy to create great food
  • you get reminders of why you have started this journey
  • you join a great community of others who are using the app, and you can add your experiences to our blog

and much, much more! 

Each day, your smart phone turns into your best vegan or vegetarian friend with helpful advice, reminders and support. From Beef to Beets will make it easier to change to a plant-based diet, and, once the change has been made, will make it easier to continue your lifestyle choice.  

What We Need & What You Get

To launch the first version of From Beef To Beets, we need to raise $5,000 to cover some of our development for the re-Course delivery engine, design and production costs, and to fine-tune the great content we have ready to deliver.

As a supporter, your perks include items like:  

  • A subscription to three months of content From Beef to Beets, delivered daily right to your Android or iPhone.  You can use the subscription yourself, or send a gift subscription to a friend who is trying to make this transition.
  • Exclusive recipes from some of the top Vegan chefs of today
  • An e-book to help keep you on your path
  • Exclusive signed copies of the Vegan Secret Supper Cookbook - Wow!  you get the amazing cookbook plus all the other perks!
  • Your chance to contribute your best hints on how to transition to a plant-based diet, and see your name in lights as your contribution goes out to everyone who has the app. We all have ideas - Share yours and get some glory!

The Impact

No matter what the reason for changing to a plant-based diet, by contributing to this project you will help yourself or a friend make a change that is good for your own health, and the health of the planet.

Follow us on this small journey that can make a big difference!

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate every penny of your contribution. Even if you can’t contribute, you can help us by liking the From Beef to Beets Facebook page, and tweeting about us. If you have already made the transition to a plant-based diet, we would also love it if you could contribute your own story via this link to our From Beef to Beets website at http://www.frombeeftobeets.com/mystory.php

Help us to help others by supporting our efforts to make it easier for people to transition to a plant-based diet.

story:
~~UPDATED~~

I am a cancer patient and I'm happy to say that I am beating the cancer but I need a little help.


I plan to finally return to work very soon (Within the next month) and I am in desperate need of the following to help me re-enter the work force.

  • I am in serious need of clothes for work. As my weight has changed so much since I last worked and I mainly worn hospital gowns and sweat pants since being sick, I seriously have 2 t shirts and 1 pair of shorts and those are the only clothes I have.
  • I am in need of new shoes as the only pair I have are splitting on each side and would not make a good look at work, not to mention having no idea of how long they might last.
  • Lastly and extremely importantly. I am in desperate need of new glasses or contact lenses. While I prefer contacts, I am perfectly happy with glasses until I get back on my feet. I have a single pair of glasses now but they are more than 7 years old and desperately need at very least new lenses. I have checked into reusing my frames but no one will do it. I'm going to have to find a way to get new frames as well.
  • I am so thrilled to finally be going back to work if only with the help of the wonderful people out there that are reading this can see their way to help me to hop these last few hurdles then everything will be perfect and I will have an excellent shot at a strong comeback from cancer. Thank you in advance to anyone who is able to help.

story:
Be-THE CHANGE!

At Be The Change Yoga & Wellness, we believe that change starts from within. In order to bring about change in the world, you must first start with yourself.

As a donation-based studio, this concept of Being The Change, is at the heart of our business model where we value people before profits.

We are raising the mat with an inclusive policy that removes the high price tag of Western yoga and allows us to provide quality, affordable yoga for everyone.

Expanding on the concept of Being The Change, we believe that yoga is a platform for people to safely explore how they can create positive change in their own life. Yoga strengthens the body, the mind and the spirit, and allows those who practice to face life with a sense of peace and resiliency they may not have previously known.

Many aspects of our modern day world work against the natural rhythms of our body and mind. Yoga has the power to heal and has been used for centuries as a way to achieve optimal health and well-being.

Yoga has the ability to reduce stress naturally and decrease the risk of suffering from stress-related health problems like heart disease, diabetes, depression and anxiety. These conditions are some of the leading causes of death in the U.S. and I think we all can agree that it’s time to reverse those trends.

Be-A GIVER!

We ask you to join us in Being The Change by making a contribution today!

Like any business, our vision takes time to build and establish and this campaign will help us take the next steps toward self-sustainability and expansion.

Funds will be invested in infrastructure, equipment, outreach and development.

  Your contributions will help:

  •    Offset operational costs during our phase of initial growth
  •    Expand our studio class offerings
  •    Fund outreach programs to underserved communities
  •    Purchase new equipment such as yoga mats and bolsters
  •    Marketing materials (flyers, posters, event fees etc.)        

We value working together and are continuously creating partnerships with other community organizations. Your support will help us persevere as we expand our services beyond our urban walls to schools, low-income communities, shelters, senior centers and other locations where people don’t have access to the tools needed to truly thrive in today’s modern world.

We invite you to explore the partners of Be The Change and the collaborations you can help support! Visit www.btcwellness.org/community

Be-UNITED!

Can donation-based yoga really work? The answer is YES! and it has been working for years in studios across the country. As long as we act as a collective community and students donate within the suggested guidelines, we can flourish into a self-sustaining organization. We strive to lead by example and encourage others to be the change they wish to see for themselves and in the world.

In our first 5 months of growth, we have held over 230 classes, served over 600 students, facilitated an array of wellness workshops and participated in numerous community events.

Your contributions will help us amplify these numbers and bring the transformative practice of yoga to more people.

Be-RESOURSEFUL!

If our story resonates with you, but you are not in a position to contribute financially, don’t fret, you can still help us out! Spreading the word to everyone you know is the greatest help, as it allows us to reach people we couldn't on our own. 

  • Share! Share! Share our story using Indiegogo share tools or through good ol’ word of mouth
  • Stop by and join us for a class! 
  • ‘Like’ and ‘follow’ our social media pages like Facebook and Instagram
  • Keep us in your heart, and dedicate a mediation or prayer to us
  • And don't forget, simply BE THE CHANGE! 


Please visit our website for more information about Be The Change www.btcwellness.org

story:
Short Summary: a multi-country run

We're four girls (Kunali, Sapna, Priyanka and Tina) looking to delve into many fundraising projects around the globe in the hopes of raising awareness of different development issues in our bustling cities. We're based in Hong Kong, Singapore, England and Spain. 

Our first goal is to support the Indian NGO, Tathapi, in raising funds to build a women's health centre by running 10k in our respective countries on the same day (a multi-country run). 

“It is our dream at Tathapi to build a health centre of excellence where women can access practices for managing their own health, the health of their families and their communities.

“This is to ensure that all women, particularly poor, are freed from the financial and social burdens resulting out the current canvas of commercial and irrational health practice.”

- Tathapi

The health centre is named “Anandi” (meaning bliss in hindi) and here’s what it aims to do:
 
  • provide different services  related to women’s health, including counseling, preventative, curative, referral, holistic and alternative health services.
  • provide self-help and rational health skill-building relating to nutrition and wellness, menstruation and contraception, infertility, menopause.
  • answer women's queries with technical and scientific information, referral options and peer support
  • build a library for women and women's health
 
Anandi will also be a place where women can learn, relax and be part of a collective that will reach many more women, through running courses to provide health education to women to create an environment for rational practice. Women will be trained as para-health workers to provide primary health services in the geographical areas in which they live in, and they will be supported by mobile health clinics.
 
Please help us to make Anandi possible by sponsoring our 10K run - your contributions will go a long way. 

 

What We Need & What You Get (All contributions of any amount are welcome!)

We realise we can't fund the entire project but we want to give the project an impactful push.

We've promised to run 10k and we're asking you to sponsor us knowing that all donations will go towards helping OneHandFiveFrames and Tathapi achieve their goals. 

The Impact

A kickstart in the donations will hopefully result in many other donors contributing towards this cause.

As a result, we will soon see a unique women's health centre that brings issues on women and health to the forefront in India.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word - Facebook, Twitter (@1hand5frames, Instagram #onehandfiveframes)!

Also please visit our blog: www.onehandfiveframes.wordpress.com to learn about other issues we're looking at.

Thank you!

story:
I'm in horrible pain.  Sharp, stabbing pain.

I need some major dental work.

My molar has been causing me severe pain. The dentist isn't sure if I need a root canal (he put in a medicated temporary filling to see if it stops the pain.)  At the very least, I will need a tooth build up and crown on that tooth.

I also have a tooth that had a root canal in many years ago but never got a crown on it so that tooth is now falling apart.  So they need to build up the core of that tooth and put a crown on it.

I also need 5 fillings (yes, I brush at least twice a day!)  My dentist says that he may encounter other problems that need to be resolved but he won't know until he begins the procedure.  Plus, one other wisdom tooth needs to be pulled.

My insurance doesn't cover this dental work.  I'm a single mom of a son who is on the autism spectrum and has an immune deficiency.  I've put my own health on the back burner while tending to my son's needs. I really need to take care of myself so that I can take care of him.

Update November 19th: I was in the hospital again on Sunday due to a severe allergic reaction to the antiobiotic I was taking for the tooth.

Update:  I ended up in the ER last night due to the pain intensifying.  They gave me antibiotics and vicodin.  Even the vicodin doesn’t take away the pain entirely.   They said an infection like this needs to be taken care of immediately because it can get life threatening quickly. 

Please note: Indiegogo will take out 9% of the funds I earn for their fee. Please keep that in mind if you make a donation.  Thank you!

Help get the word out:

Please post this link on Facebook, Twitter, and email!

Thank you for your support!
