story:
In October 2011, mother of three Adelle Huckins was finally diagnosed after a long mysterious illness. The disease she has is called Lyme disease. Lyme disease is a bacterial infection carried by ticks (blood-sucking parasites) which is transmitted when the tick bites and feeds on a person or animal.

Ticks are found in the countryside but can also be present in town parks and gardens where wildlife visits. They usually feed on the blood of wildlife but they can also bite people, passing on any diseases they may be carrying.

Adelle (32), her husband Rob (34), and their children Joshua (10), Kaitlyn (7) and Dexter (2) all love to go camping in the Lake District and other areas of natural beauty. However, whilst they get to experience all the wonders of nature, they have also been exposed to ticks. Prior to Adelle becoming ill, they didn’t know about the simple precautions you can take against tick bites.

Lyme disease is an insidious disease which can invade every system of the body from the blood, to the heart and brain. It can cause long-term health problems if not diagnosed and treated promptly.

Not only Adelle has health problems, her husband and children do too. But despite numerous visits to various NHS doctors, a cause for their children’s multiple health problems has not yet been found. Although a private test has proved positive for Kaitlyn for Lyme disease.

Adelle’s illness took years to diagnose and during that time her three children were born. It is possible for Lyme disease to be passed from a mother to her unborn baby or transmitted through breastmilk and the child can suffer health problems as a result, but in order for Adelle and Rob to find out whether this is why their children have these health problems, they need to see an expert doctor. Now they have an opportunity to see a top consultant in Germany. This consultant has years of experience in treating tick bourne infections, including Lyme disease, but the family has to raise in the region of £70,000 for them all to have the tests and any treatment they need.

Rob and Adelle have been together for 15 years but now family life is plagued by health concerns. All they want is for Joshua, Kaitlyn and Dexter to be well and to have the quality of life they deserve.

Please give whatever you can so that the family can raise the funds for specialist medical help. This is their best chance of getting better!

story:
Short Summary

Hey everybody!

I’m Nyla founder of Grateful 2 B Natural and author of The Naturalista’s Do It Yourself (DIY) Recipe Book. I am starting a series called Grateful 2 B Natural with Nyla that will focus on helping women embrace their natural beauty through healthy lifestyle decisions. We will discuss health, beauty, relationships, finance and food (yummers!) I will be conducting interviews, providing tips and recipes to assist in having beautiful skin, healthy hair, a great body and an overall naturally fabulous life, hellooo!

                                

Your contribution to this project will help make this all possible.  I am super excited and I can’t wait to release the series!

What We Need & What You Get

Here’s the deal. We are trying to raise $20,000 for this project. A lot of the funding will go towards production and equipment. I’ve been working on parts of the series for a while and it’s taking a good deal of money as well as a whole lot of time because I’m doing a lot of it on my own. I really want to get this out there. Especially since I’m getting so many requests and questions about it. Your contribution will help in giving the people what they want:-)

 

I will be giving contributors a range of perks from t-shirts, to the pilot episode, the first season and coaching programs and event tickets to my live Natural Beauty Academy! Did I mention that I’m mad excited?!

The Impact

Natural beauty seems to have hit mainstream however there is more to natural beauty than skin and hair. Grateful 2 B Natural with Nyla will show that and help women around the world to embrace their natural beauty. We can show how easy it is to be healthy and happy and natural as well as how to love ourselves the way we were created and to take care of that beautiful creation with good food, healthy relationships and a powerful lifestyle. We can do it together and your contribution will help.

 

                                 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don’t forget to spread the word and share on your blog, social media and with family and friends!

 

Embrace your beauty. Be Grateful 2 B Natural!

~Nyla

story:
Hello, my name is Alex and I’m 26 years old. I was born in Brooklyn NY on January 8th, 1986. Currently I reside in Jamaica Queens NY. I have been living here over 10 ½ years with my mother, younger brother, step-father, grandmother, aunt, and niece.

The purpose of my campaign is to help raise funds for surgery that I need to have on my keloid scars. Unfortunately, my insurance will not be accepted by this specialist due to the cosmetic nature of the surgery. I have lived with these horrible scars since the age of 6, and for the last 20 years of my life I’ve been made fun of, ridiculed, discriminated against, misjudged and misunderstood just because of my looks! That is only half the pain I go through on a daily basis, the other half is from the constant physical pain I’m in living with this ailment! I need to be able to enjoy my life while I’m still young! With your help I can do so by having this surgery!

The surgery will cost a total of $11,000 and I will also have to fly down to Houston TX, to have the surgery because this is the state in which the doctor operates. The surgery will take approximately 10 hours to complete and I will need to remain in the hospital for 5-7 days and remain in Houston TX for approximately 2 weeks according to the details the doctor gave me.

I have my very own t-shirt business that I’ve started last September. ALL contributors will receive FREE t-shirts for helping me with donations in this campaign! Any shirt of your choice!

All funds raised will be put toward surgery costs, even if my goal is not met.

The following URL is a link to the story I wrote last June about my life with keloids. It explains things in further detail:

http://www.keloidresearchfoundation.org/encount...

 

Here is another link with the surgeon who will be performing the surgery. He speaks about a product that he has released that helps keep keloid scars from returning. He also has one of his patients present during the interview:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hPzqiEaW61w

For those of you who honestly cannot help financially but want to help in any way you can, please spread the word to your family and friends! You can do so by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What Exactly Are You Funding?

It's my goal to open my own gym in the very near future. I love fitness and I enjoy lifting and competing in sports but I want to open a gym mainly because I love people. I want to help my friends, my family and my community be healthier, be stronger, be faster and be comfortable in their own skin. 

But I'm discovering more and more that the world of fitness and health is broken up into a very distinct gender and sex binary. This breakdown of fitness goals informed by gender norms doesn't serve a lot of my friends, family and community. Not fully. 

I want to change that. I want to be a trainer and coach that can speak knowledgeably and respectfully about fitness issues that not only straight cisgender folks have but also issues that are unique to members of the LGBTQ community. 

The first step in realizing this goal is getting the proper certification. I already have a wealth of knowledge and experience gained through independent reading, research and my own training. I wouldnt, however, feel comfrotable coaching and training others unless I held a certification from a governing body that I believe in and trust and that others trust as well. 

That certification is through the USA Olympic Committee as a USA Weightlifting Sports Performance Coach. There is no higher authority in sports than the Olympics and I'd like to be certified by them. 

However, the seminars to get this certification tend to only take place in very large cities several states away from me. The cost of travel plus registration is expensive but it's the time off work that would make it cost prohibitive. I simply need every hour I can get scheduled. 

As luck would have it, after two years of waiting, there will be a seminar in my area. It's less than an afternoons drive away and I wouldn't have to miss work to go. I just need your help to meet the registration costs.  

What I Need & What You Get

I need $650 in order to register for the course. The cost of the course is $495 plus gas money and one night in a motel close to the seminar. 

Thats it. It's super easy but it's much more than a part time barista can save in less than a month. 

What do you get? Besides helping to fund a campaign dedicated to doing one small part to make this world a better place, you also get some swag. Personal coaching and consultation from a USA Weightlifting Sports Peformance Coach, a patch, a tshirt, an awesome handwritten note personalized just for you! 

The Impact

It's going to start small but this certification and my gym will ultimately begin to break down the barriers that keep people in the LGBTQ spectrum from being as healthy as they can be. Beyond that, we can begin to push past the binary gender barriers in competitive sports, develop contests of strength and endurance that don't just benefit cisgender men, fight for inclusive of all people in their chosen sports while accurately reflecting their gender and sexual identities. 

It's my small way of adding to a growing movement of inclusiveness and openness in the sporting world. 

If You Can't Help Monetarily

Please share this. Tell your friends. Tell your family. Tell your softball team. Tell your church. Getting the word out there is just as awesome as any monetary contribution. I will give all I have to this cause but change takes all of us.

story:
Hi dear audience!
My name is Valentin Savchenko, i am 23 years old, living in Tallinn, Estonia.

My brother got sick with Lymphoma(cancer) of central brain in Russia, his name is Ilya Savchenko

http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100005404362799&fref=ts

 ,living in Saint-Petersburg,Russia. He was treated first month in Russian Military hospital from Lyme disease(March),my father Igor Savchenko works there. After that he was treated for herpes sickness for another month.

Only after i went with his documents to the hospital in Tallinn, they said that doctors in Russia did not pay attention that it might be Lymphoma, and they have to confirm it or not.So 2 month were lost just because Russian doctors could not find the right diagnosis. My brother had biopsy after that, and they confirmed Lymphoma. Currently we are looking for that amount of money to buy medicine that are part of 2nd,3rd corse chemoterapy, the first corse was already made and we did cover this with our family with our personall money. Right now we need to buy medicine and we neet to recover him because he lost some moving apin arms and legs,and also he need special treatments to recover his brain functions At this particular moment we are out of money.We need to have that medicine before 30th, where 2nd corse is planned to be started.


Myself i tried to get a bank loan here in Estonia, but because i have permit residence that valid untill october, i could not get any long term loans from banks.
At the moment we are not talking about sending him to germany, because it will cost around 120-000 euro, but at least find enough to get the medicine.
I do greatly appreciate all you can help, and special thank to Wouters Van Den Brink from Netherlands, who showed me this site.

story:
COMPANY PROFILE:

 

Eulysis UK is devoted to optimizing pharmaceutical delivery and access through novel packaging innovations. Our groundbreaking technology, the Single Vial System, is the only one capable of delivering lyophilized pharmaceuticals within a single, easy-to-use container. Applications include vaccines, cancer treatments, antibiotics and antidotes. Optimizes the entire supply chain while reducing contamination risks, simplifying administration and saving more patient lives at point of use.

 

To date, the company has been endorsed and supported by the: World Health Organization, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Royal Society of Edinburgh, Scottish Enterprise and Prince's Trust.

 

BACKGROUND:

 

Life threatening, preventable diseases plague millions of people globally on a daily basis. Access issues are the primary reason precluding the vast majority of people around the world from receiving essential, life saving pharmaceuticals. "Cold chain" transportation is required for a majority of pharmaceuticals and disruptions along the cold chain can lead to ineffective, damaged or even harmful products being delivered to the end patient. However, "cold chain" transportation is expensive; in the case of vaccines for example it can comprise between 14-20% of the total cost. Current primary packaging technologies for lyophilized pharmaceuticals require a minimum of two containers to be delivered. This places an excessive burden on limited cold chain storage space, prohibiting access to developing countries where cold chain space is limited.

 

SOLUTION:

 

Our Single Vial System offers the only "all-in-one" solution for lyophilized pharmaceuticals. The first version we are developing offers injectable (parenteral) drug delivery. By integrating the two containers currently required into one, critical benefits are realized. Imagine the potential to use the same truck that can currently transport and deliver one million vaccines, now being able to transport and deliver two million vaccines.

 

That could translate to saving twice as many lives simply by using the Single Vial System as the primary packaging technology. In addition through reduced use of raw materials, it is more cost efficient and environmentally friendly than existing technologies.

 

BENEFITS:

 

The essential benefits derived by the technology do not end there. Below, segmented by stakeholder, some of the additional benefits are presented:

 

Patient- Expanded access to essential pharmaceuticals regardless of geographic location. Contamination risk is drastically reduced since entire reconstitution occurs within a single, aseptic container.

 

Doctors- Simplified and expedited administration process, particularly critical in emergency situations. Ease of use minimizing potential for user error. Reduced time consumption per administration.

 

Hospitals- Reduced storage burden in limited cold chain space- offering the potential to store twice as many pharmaceuticals without modifying existing infrastructure. Decreased environmental impact through disposing of a single container as opposed to two per administration delivered.

 

PROJECT GOAL:

 

With funding from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, we successfully established Proof of Concept with an ETEC Vaccine through Feasibility and Accelerated Stability Studies. These Studies were conducted in partnership with Program for Appropriate Technology in Health (PATH), a global, non-profit organization dedicated to improving global health.

 

The goal for this Project is to complete Proof of Principle Studies. These studies will again be conducted in collaboration with PATH.

 

Our Team:

 

Founder, Spyridon "Ross" Tsakas:

 

(LinkedIn Profile Link: http://uk.linkedin.com/pub/spyridon-edouard-%22...)

 

Spyridon "Ross" Tsakas is an innovative, multi-award winning entrepreneur with diverse Start-Up, Product and Market Development experience. He is the Founder & President of Eulysis Group based at the Roslin Biocentre in Scotland, specialising in Personal Health Care and Pharmaceuticals. His current project titled the Single Vial System involves a unique manufacture and reconstitution technology for pharmaceuticals.

 

Some of his more prominent Accolades include:

 

- Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation: Grand Challenges Explorations Initiative Grant

 

- World Health Organization: Certificate of Endorsement

 

- Royal Society of Edinburgh: Enterprise Fellowship

 

- Scottish Enterprise: R&D Award Grant

 

- Prince's Trust : Outstanding Business Innovation Award

 

Chief Scientific Advisor, Professor Grahame Bulfield, CBE, FRSE:

 

(LinkedIn Profile Link: http://uk.linkedin.com/pub/grahame-bulfield/29/...)

 

Grahame Bulfield CBE is an Emeritus Professor of Genetics at the University of Edinburgh and a Consultant in Biotechnology. From 2002 to 2008 he was Vice Principal and Head of the College of Science and Engineering at the University of Edinburgh, and is a former Director of the Roslin Institute.

 

Professor Bulfield was appointed an Honorary Professor of the University of Edinburgh in 1990, to a Personal Chair of Animal Genetics in 2002 and elected to a Fellowship of the Royal Society of Edinburgh in 1992. In 1999 he was appointed Honorary Fellow of the Royal Agricultural Society of England. He was awarded a CBE for services to Animal Genetics in the 2001 New Year Honours.

 

Chief Commercial Advisor, Mr. Malcolm Bateman:

 

(LinkedIn Profile Link: http://uk.linkedin.com/pub/malcolm-bateman/2b/8...)

 

A Chartered Management Accountant, who has extensive operational and general management experience. Worked for UK, US and German automotive and pharmaceutical multinationals both in the UK and overseas. More recently involved with a world renowned research establishment, university commercialisation initiatives, science park management and early stage life science companies. Comprehensive board experience with directorships in private, public and not for profit organisations. Strengths include strategic vision combined with excellent influencing, communication and organisational skills.

 

Project Potential:

 

Establishing Proof of Principle for the technology is quintessential to secure its adoption by pharmaceutical manufacturers. With your help and support, we can prove the value this technology offers in expanding access to pharmaceuticals in developed and developing countries alike.  Creating this compelling case for the Single Vial System will enable it to achieve the potential of enabling people globally to lead healthier, more productive lives through expanded access to medicines.

 

Following on from the first injectable (parenteral) version of the Single Vial System, we have conceived alternative embodiments for it that will optimize inhalation and oral delivery. This way all essential modes of pharmaceutical delivery will be optimized and enhanced to their fullest potential.

 

Our pipeline of innovations is critical to improving global health and expanding access to pharmaceuticals regardless of geographic location.

 

With your help and support we can enable pharmaceuticals to help people where they are most in need; enabling them to achieve their fullest potential and paving a solid and sustainable foundation for the future of global health.

 

Thank you in advance for your time and consideration,

 

Spyridon

vaccines, cancer treatments, antibiotics and antidotes. Optimizes the entire
supply chain while reducing contamination risks, simplifying administration and
saving more patient lives at point of use. 
 
To date, the company has been endorsed and supported by the:
World Health Organization, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Royal Society
of Edinburgh, Scottish Enterprise and Prince's Trust.
 
BACKGROUND:
 
Life threatening, preventable diseases plague millions of
people globally on a daily basis. Access issues are the primary reason
precluding the vast majority of people around the world from receiving
essential, life saving pharmaceuticals. "Cold chain" transportation
is required for a majority of pharmaceuticals and disruptions along the cold
chain can lead to ineffective, damaged or even harmful products being delivered
to the end patient. However, "cold chain" transportation is
expensive; in the case of vaccines for example it can comprise between 14-20%
of the total cost. Current primary packaging technologies for lyophilized
pharmaceuticals require a minimum of two containers to be delivered. This
places an excessive burden on limited cold chain storage space, prohibiting
access to developing countries where cold chain space is limited. 
 
SOLUTION: 
 
Our Single Vial System offers the only
"all-in-one" solution for lyophilized pharmaceuticals. The first
version we are developing offers injectable (parenteral) drug delivery. By
integrating the two containers currently required into one, critical benefits
are realized. Imagine the potential to use the same truck that can currently
transport and deliver one million vaccines, now being able to transport and deliver
two million vaccines. 
 
That could translate to saving twice as many lives simply by
using the Single Vial System as the primary packaging technology. In addition
through reduced use of raw materials, it is more cost efficient and
environmentally friendly than existing technologies.
 
BENEFITS:
 
The essential benefits derived by the technology do not end
there. Below, segmented by stakeholder, some of the additional benefits are
presented:
 
Patient- Expanded access to essential pharmaceuticals
regardless of geographic location. Contamination risk is drastically reduced
since entire reconstitution occurs within a single, aseptic container. 
 
Doctors- Simplified and expedited administration process,
particularly critical in emergency situations. Ease of use minimizing potential
for user error. Reduced time consumption per administration.
 
Hospitals- Reduced storage burden in limited cold chain
space- offering the potential to store twice as many pharmaceuticals without
modifying existing infrastructure. Decreased environmental impact through
disposing of a single container as opposed to two per administration delivered.

 
PROJECT GOAL: 
 
With funding from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation,
we successfully established Proof of Concept with an ETEC Vaccine through
Feasibility and Accelerated Stability Studies. These Studies were conducted in
partnership with Program for Appropriate Technology in Health (PATH), a global,
non-profit organization dedicated to improving global health.
 
The goal for this Project is to complete Proof of Principle
Studies. These studies will again be conducted in collaboration with PATH. 
 
Our Team: 
 
Founder, Spyridon "Ross" Tsakas: 
 
(LinkedIn Profile Link:
http://uk.linkedin.com/pub/spyridon-edouard-%22...)
 
Spyridon "Ross" Tsakas is an innovative,
multi-award winning entrepreneur with diverse Start-Up, Product and Market
Development experience. He is the Founder & President of Eulysis Group
based at the Roslin Biocentre in Scotland, specialising in Personal Health Care
and Pharmaceuticals. His current project titled the Single Vial System involves
a unique manufacture and reconstitution technology for pharmaceuticals.
 
Some of his more prominent Accolades include:
 
- Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation: Grand Challenges
Explorations Initiative Grant
 
- World Health Organization: Certificate of Endorsement
 
- Royal Society of Edinburgh: Enterprise Fellowship 
 
- Scottish Enterprise: R&D Award Grant
 
- Prince's Trust : Outstanding Business Innovation Award 
 
Chief Scientific Advisor, Professor Grahame Bulfield, CBE,
FRSE:
 
(LinkedIn Profile Link:
http://uk.linkedin.com/pub/grahame-bulfield/29/...)
 
Grahame Bulfield CBE is an Emeritus Professor of Genetics at
the University of Edinburgh and a Consultant in Biotechnology. From 2002 to
2008 he was Vice Principal and Head of the College of Science and Engineering
at the University of Edinburgh, and is a former Director of the Roslin
Institute.
 
Professor Bulfield was appointed an Honorary Professor of
the University of Edinburgh in 1990, to a Personal Chair of Animal Genetics in
2002 and elected to a Fellowship of the Royal Society of Edinburgh in 1992. In
1999 he was appointed Honorary Fellow of the Royal Agricultural Society of
England. He was awarded a CBE for services to Animal Genetics in the 2001 New
Year Honours.
 
Chief Commercial Advisor, Mr. Malcolm Bateman:
 
(LinkedIn Profile Link:
http://uk.linkedin.com/pub/malcolm-bateman/2b/8...)
 
A Chartered Management Accountant, who has extensive
operational and general management experience. Worked for UK, US and German
automotive and pharmaceutical multinationals both in the UK and overseas. More
recently involved with a world renowned research establishment, university
commercialisation initiatives, science park management and early stage life
science companies. Comprehensive board experience with directorships in
private, public and not for profit organisations. Strengths include strategic
vision combined with excellent influencing, communication and organisational
skills.
 
Project Potential:
 
Establishing Proof of Principle for the technology is
quintessential to secure its adoption by pharmaceutical manufacturers. With
your help and support, we can prove the value this technology offers in
expanding access to pharmaceuticals in developed and developing countries
alike.  Creating this compelling
case for the Single Vial System will enable it to achieve the potential of
enabling people globally to lead healthier, more productive lives through
expanded access to medicines. 
 
Following on from the first injectable (parenteral) version
of the Single Vial System, we have conceived alternative embodiments for it
that will optimize inhalation and oral delivery. This way all essential modes
of pharmaceutical delivery will be optimized and enhanced to their fullest
potential.
 
Our pipeline of innovations is critical to improving global
health and expanding access to pharmaceuticals regardless of geographic
location. 
 
With your help and support we can enable pharmaceuticals to
help people where they are most in need; enabling them to achieve their fullest
potential and paving a solid and sustainable foundation for the future of
global health.
 
Thank you in advance for your time and consideration,
 
Spyridon

story:
Tumors suck, but not having insurance sucks more.

Terri has been through the ringer already, just trying to find out what was making her feel sick, and then to find out it is a tumor, not a good hand to be dealt.  She has a family and we all know that just being a mom is hard work, but being a sick mom is even harder.

I don't personally know Terri, but I do know that being a lady in the Pinup Community, means that we pay it forward, and we know when to jump in and help.

This campaign is raising funds on behalf of Terri Patton.

What am I doing?

Terri has been diagnosed with a tumor in her pancreas. I really want to donate some money to her, but I frankly am not financially capable of paying for all her bills.

I will be donating all funds raised to Terri to help her will hosptial bills, etc..

What you get:

The satisfaction of knowing you are helping out a truly remarkable lady and her family

Other possible perks to pick from:

A personal thank you note from me, mailed to your address.And they might have cats on them.

A print of a portrait of me, signed by me. I'm not famous, but this could be a neat reminder of what you helped me do. 

A print of the aforementioned portrait, also signed by me in 8x10 size

And, last but not least:

The knowledge that you helped contribute to a great cause!

Please help me if you can!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jennifer Martin, I live in East Stroudsburg and run a small in home daycare. I am currently studying to get my associates degree in early childhood education. I have two semesters left to earn my degree. I have a passion for children and helping them to reach their potential as well as a deep understanding of the every day struggles families face in order to  afford care and obtain employment.

I have seen parents struggle on a daily basis to maintain work while trying to  afford care for their children. It is a double edge sword, work to pay daycare , or stay home and collect assistance. I have seen this so often in my line of work, and I would like to be able to make a difference in more lives then I have. I have taken families into care free of charge so that they can get on their feet, but I do not have the space or the means to help more. Yes there are funds like ccis that does help defer the cost of daycare, but keep in mind you must meet their guidelines and there normally is a long waiting list. In order to receive the help,You must already be working at least 20 hours a week and meet the income criteria guidelines. My question is, how do you obtain employment if you can not obtain daycare ? How do you actively seek work and attend job interviews, if you have no where to bring your children?
I would like to reach out and help more families live  life. There are a few things I need in order  to reach my goal, one is obtaining a larger quanity of supplies to meet the needs of the children, having funds that parents can use to help cover the cost of daycare, and  finding a bigger place to meet the demand.

By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping me to make a difference in the lives of so many people. You will be helping more families to remain in the work place,while lessening the need for assistance.


What We Need & What You Get

I am starting small with this campaign, I know the amount of funding I will need to make everything possible will not happen overnight.

I plan to use around 2,000.00 to obtain new material to reach the needs of the children currently in my care. I plan to put the rest of the money aside to help offset the cost of care for families that need it. If we do not reach our goal, all funds received will be used to help families cover the cost of care so that they can obtain employment.

For helping us to reach our goals we will be offering perks such as personal thank you letters, artwork made by my students, and your name on our wall of fame.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute in the form of money, but you can help spread the work. Can you imagine the difference we can make as a community if every daycare center agreed to help just one family? It would make a huge impact on the lives of our children and our families.

story:
Why Ged Hidalgo Needs Our Help

One of the most inspiring individuals in the Philippines today is Ged Hidalgo, a special education teacher, organizer, and indigenous musician. She has been quietly struggling with a terrible knee injury for nearly a year. While Ged remains active helping survivors from Typhoon Haiyan, her condition is not improving, and she is facing additional health problems. She needs our help to heal.

On April 10, 2013, Ged was working with a group of special needs teenagers in Quezon City. An 18-year-old boy with severe autism ran toward the busy street, so Ged ran after him. She tripped and fell, tearing ligaments in her right knee. 

Since then, Ged has been unable to work full time. With crutches and a constantly inflamed knee, she cannot take public transportation or return to her job as a teacher. She's sold personal items, worked from home by computer, begun several small businesses, and borrowed money from friends and relatives for treatment. She's gone through her savings. She's tried to resume her normal physical activities. But the cost of treatment is outside her reach, and she remains in pain, with her injury worsening each day. Recently, Ged's ENT doctor found three nodules in her neck, but Ged cannot afford further testing to see what the nodules might indicate.

Despite these health limitations and her severe loss of income, Ged has been a tireless worker for vulnerable populations both within and outside Metro Manila. She borrowed a car to volunteer at Villamor Airbase every night, providing unpaid logistical support to the refugees of Typhoon Haiyan traveling to Manila to restart their lives. She continues to work with special needs children. And she organizes charity bike rides. She's made an incredible impact on the lives of the most vulnerable here in the Philippines, and I hope we can make an impact on hers.

What We Need

  • Ged's orthopedic doctor has informed her she requires surgery to repair the ligaments in her knee. This procedure, combined with physical therapy, will be a total of $3600 USD, or 160,000 pesos. 
  • Ged's Ear, Nose, and Throat specialist will follow up with Ged next month. A possible removal procedure will cost about $400USD, or 18,000 pesos.
  • All funds raised will go toward Ged's health care costs.

The Impact

    • By helping one vital person, you'll be helping hundreds of vulnerable Filipinos get the invaluable guidance, education, and the unique, on-the-ground support Ged Hidalgo provides.
    • Even just a dollar goes a long way; with the exchange rate, one US dollar equals 44 Philippine pesos.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know it's tough out there, but if you can't contribute money, please share our campaign on Facebook or Twitter with other folks who can help! Thank you for reading Ged's story.

story:
Toronto's Coolest Toy for everyone around the world to enjoy! 

Fully functional SqueezeFord™ Toy

During the past few months I have seen Torontonian's frustrated and stressed out, so I decided to design and build a squeeze toy, to help Torontonian's with their stress and frustration. 

We believe this funny and useful toy will turn negative energy into something fun and positive for everyone. This is how SqueezeFord™ Started.

Use it as fun toy with your co workers, play catch with your  friends, relax by squeezing it, have rolling, bounce, backflip competitions, or use it for office warfare. 

Design:

After weeks of design and prototyping we have come up with a unique design. We went through many prototypes until we had the one that best represented our toy. We wanted our Squeeze Ford to be funny, positive looking and have a cartoon looking feel.  

Future Editions: If this indiegogo campaign goes successful there will be different Squeeze Ford characters to come.

How it Works:

Use it as fun toy with your co workers, play catch with your  friends, relax by squeezing it, have rolling, bounce, backflip competitions, or use it for office warfare. 

SqueezeFord™ toy offers several benefits for stress relief and it’s convenient because it can go just about anywhere you can. When squeezed it decreases muscular and emotional tension, exercising the muscle of the hand, to improve blood circulation.

What is Squeeze Ford Made of?

SqueezeFord™ is made of non-toxic high quality closed-cell polyurethane  foam rubber.

Is it safe for Children?

There is nothing to worry about, SqueezeFord™ is 100% safe for children, in fact its been proven that using a stress toy can help your children manage ADHD. However supervision for children under 8 is recommended.

What will the money be used for?

Production: Our biggest expense is getting the new molds made for the full production of Squeeze Ford. 

Packaging & Shipping and distribution: Our second biggest expense is to have our Squeeze Ford shipped to everyone. We have gone through great lengths to find the very best manufacturer. Our manufacturer has to ship the Squeeze fords to us in downtown Toronto and then we would distribute to the corresponding backers.

When is Squeeze Ford Shipping? 

We are aiming to ship during January. If we get an unexpected amount of pledges we might have to delay the shipping .

What is the current stage of production?

    We have completed all the preliminary stages and we are ready to start production. In order to do this we need your help to raise the necessary funds for the final stages. Our CAD files are ready for the manufacturing process to begin. We need an iron cast mold in order to initiate the production of the Squeeze Fords, this is an expensive stage that requires upfront investment that’s why we need your help. 

  • Design: Done
  • Computer Render: Done
  • Budgeting & Cost calculation: Done 
  • Material Selection: Done
  • Manufacturer Screening: Done 
  • Manufacturer Selection: Done
  • Production: Ready to start
  • Mold Casting Fabrication: Awaiting Funds 
  • Shipping & Distribution: Pending

Help me create one of the coolest toy you have ever seen.

Prototype 3D Printing & Pre-cast from 3DPhacktory

Our friends at 3DPhacktory printing studio in Toronto have helped us with our Prototype and 3D printing needs. 

Website 

@3DPhacktory





Material Simulation video

We have talked to different manufactures in search of the highest quality for both materials and construction. The material chosen is a high quality 100% non-toxic, closed-cell polyurethane foam rubber; it has been proven as an effective stress reliever due to its elastic properties and is high durability. Below is a video with a sample of the material we have chosen, (this was sent to us by our manufacturer). The purpose of this video is to illustrate the elastic properties of the material.


Shipping

Shipping is included Canada wide for international shipping please include the  amount required in the description. For Canada Post takes an average of 3 days for shipping in Canada and 5 days for international delivery. Please follow us on twitter @squeezeford for more specific updates.  

Corporate Sponsorship 1

Great for advertisement and getting noticed in Toronto. 

Logo or a personal graphic design (1 colour imprint 0.75in x1.3.5 in) in the bottom of the toy. Your logo will be imprinted on all the indiegogo rewards. Meaning everyone will get a copy of your logo on the toy. And receive 50 Squeeze Fords (for some awesome office warfare)


 Corporate Sponsorship 2

Great for advertisement and getting noticed in Toronto. Logo or a personal graphic design (1 color imprint 1.37in x1.5 in) in the back of the toy. Your logo will be imprinted on all the indiegogo rewards. Meaning everyone will get a copy of your logo on the toy. And receive 50 Squeeze Fords (for some awesome office warfare)


Wireframe

We have CAD files ready and have been approved by our manufacturer here is a detail wireframe with background rendering.

Thank You.

www.squeezeford.ca

@squeezeford

story:
DropMyStuff.com is an easy to use website that will monitor all your favorite sites, feeds, photos and even enterprise systems—all in real-time.


If you are anything like me, you might have over a dozen social media sites you monitor, several news sites you like to visit, a bunch of video and photo websites that you keep up with and at least a couple of email addresses that you log into daily.

What if you could just go to one place and have all your favorite stuff load up in a very useful way? What if you could avoid clicking multiple tabs, bookmarks and drop down menus to get access to your favorite sites? What if you could check out all your friend's notifications in a single sidebar?

With DropMyStuff.com everything that matters to you is just a click away.


.........................................................................................................................................

DropMyStuff.com delivers blazing performance and introduces breakthrough technologies.

Organize and Discover
Innovative features make it simple to return to sites you visit often — and discover new sites as well.

Move your sites around, launch a full screen view or delete sites from your dashboard. Customize it any way you want!

Playlists
With the redesigned "Playlists", it’s easy to organize your favorites. Make one just for your social media, one playlist for work and one for home.

One click loads all my sites wherever I'm at and whenever I want.

My News
Keep up with the latest interesting content. Get emails, LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter updates and more! All in one place, all in real time.

"My News" in the new sidebar shows what all your friends and contacts are sharing all over the web.

There are also unique advancements under the hood so the web pages you visit feel snappier and more responsive.

DropMyStuff.com is simply the best way to surf.

.........................................................................................................................................


Nelson Romero - Founder at DropMyStuff.com

As software designer for BellSouth and AT&T, I was able to create software that was enjoyed by millions of customers. Products such as:

• AT&T U-Verse
I was one of the first people in the world to design and develop apps for the iPhone. I designed a highly usable touch-screen interface with a focus on minimalism and stunning visuals for the AT&T U-Verse Digital TV services. I also conceptualized, designed and developed the interface for the set-top box applications.

• AT&T News Portal
Managed creative development and production of online content for the BellSouth.net News Portal (websites, video, games, activities, third party advertisements and promotions). Managed an internal team of associate producers, designers, illustrators, animators and web developers in an exciting fast-paced production environment.

• AT&T Media Player
GUI design work and functional prototypes.

• AT&T Instant Messenger
Determined instructional strategies, design solutions and provided support in development.

• AT&T Video Chat
Responsible for a variety of tasks including user experience design, visual design and usability testing.

• AT&T Pay Per Viewer

Developed user interfaces, communications and control software for Windows and Apple-based host systems.

Designed, documented, tested and implemented application features and enhancements.

• AT&T Web Browser
Conducted design, job tasks, content and audience analysis.

Goals
I plan on launching the utility in March 2014 but our backers will able to start using the Beta by January 2014. The goals of this project are:
  • Beta version of the DropMyStuff.com utility site by January 2014.
  • Performance improvement of the utility - we want it to be snappy and quick because like most people we don't like to wait.
  • Full coverage testing to reduce future bugs - this is nerds stuff but we have to get it done so that nothing breaks in the future.
  • Broader support for other platforms for mobile devices.
  • UI/UX Design iterations to improve the user experience. Some of the flows require more user testing to get them just right, and here what we really need is more "real world" testing. These will be small details but it's what makes the difference.
The ultimate goal is to boost the adoption of DropMyStuff.com as a simpler way to navigate the internet.

Timeline
  • December 2013: Build the software.
  • January 2014: beta version of the utility ready.
  • February 2014: Testing and bug fixes.
  • March 2014: Soft launch of utility to public.
  • June 2014: Launch of mobile apps.
What we need
The 50.000 USD will be spent for:
  • Pay full time development for a software developer for 3 months.
  • Rent for the office and expenses.
  • Rent for bandwidth and servers.
  • Manufacturing and Shipping Physical Rewards.
  • IndieGoGo and Payment Processing Fees
  • Taxes :-(
What if we don’t reach the goal?
Well, plan B is to work on the utility until I run out of money, then try a new fundraising and hope that the work done will convince more people to donate for the development.

story_txt:
DropMyStuff.com is an easy to use website that will monitor all your favorite sites, feeds, photos and even enterprise systems—all in real-time.If you are anything like me, you might have over a dozen social media sites you monitor, several news sites you like to visit, a bunch of video and photo websites that you keep up with and at least a couple of email addresses that you log into daily.
What if you could just go to one place and have all your favorite stuff load up in a very useful way? What if you could avoid clicking multiple tabs, bookmarks and drop down menus to get access to your favorite sites?  What if you could check out all your friend's notifications in a single sidebar?
With DropMyStuff.com everything that matters to you is just a click away.

.........................................................................................................................................DropMyStuff.com delivers blazing performance and introduces
breakthrough technologies. Organize and DiscoverInnovative features make it simple to return to
sites you visit often — and discover new sites as well.Move your sites around, launch a full screen view or delete sites from your dashboard. Customize it any way you want!
PlaylistsWith the redesigned "Playlists", it’s easy to organize your favorites. Make one just for your social media, one playlist for work and one for home. One click loads all my sites wherever I'm at and whenever I want.
My NewsKeep up with the latest interesting content. Get emails, LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter updates and more! All in one place, all in real time.
"My News" in the new sidebar shows what all your friends and contacts are sharing all over the web.
There are also
unique advancements under the hood so the web pages you visit feel snappier and
more responsive. 
DropMyStuff.com is simply the best way to surf.

story:
From time to time our kw family is effected by life's tragedies and it is an opportunity for us to help each other out.  

One of our kw family's father was diagnosed with terminal cancer a while ago and he is currently on his death bed with only 5-10 days left to live.  

To cut to the chase, the burden of funeral expenses are falling upon our kw family member's shoulders.  If you have had a loved one pass the last few years, you know how expensive funerals are these days. Funeral expenses can be stressful and can be diificult to come up with the $15,000. 

I am writing you to ask for VERY GENEROUS donations to help support one of our own.

story:
WHAT IS YUMALITE? ( A safe, effective, clinically proven, ergonomically designed, convenient and affordable one-of-a-kind light therapy visor named after the sunniest place on earth! phew... that about sums it up!)

YumaLite is a head-mounted, medical light therapy visor that helps alleviate the symptoms of low energy and low mood due to a lack of sunlight. YumaLite utilizes patent pending, clinically proven technology that is safe and effective, as well as convenient and affordable (see clinical studies below).  

WHY LIGHT THERAPY?

You’re not getting enough light

Light, preferably natural light, is important for your health. Sunlight is needed for you to feel normal and healthy. The lack of enough light, what we call light deficiency, can have a negative effect on how you feel. In fact, more than 90% of the population suffer each year. There are many reasons you might not receive adequate light. The winter months, rainy days, working inside at the office, jet lag and shift work can also rob you of light and make you feel these same symptoms. Seniors commonly suffer from not getting the light they need, as do mothers with newborn babies who must be awake at all hours.  

How lack of light makes you feel

When you’re light deficient, you can experience a wide range of symptoms. You might feel sad or lethargic. You might have trouble getting out of bed in the morning. You might eat more and gain weight. You can also find it difficult to concentrate. You may even withdraw from friends and family and you might find your libido (sex drive) has decreased. These symptoms can range from mild to severe. Some of us feel severe forms of these symptoms and suffer from winter depression, known as Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD); however, it is a phenomenon that affects people all year long.

When natural light isn’t available, YUMALITE can provide a source of light to help you feel better and give you more energy!

 
FEATURED ON CITYLINE (ENDORSED BY DR. DAVID GREENBERG)

I was fortunate enough to be featured by Dr. David Greenberg, M.D. on "CityLine", the longest running and most successful daytime show for women in Canadian history, when he was discussing light therapy. Please watch the video as I think it sums up YumaLite and its benefits pretty well. 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I___HwJGwK0

BETTER THAN THE ALTERNATIVES

Light therapy—the old way

Traditionally, light therapy has meant sitting in front of stationary lamps for up to 90 minutes each day. Although light boxes have been shown to be safe and effective, traditional devices are expensive and inconvenient. Many cost hundreds of dollars and most light boxes are floor or desk-mounted lamps that require you to sit in front of them. Because they generally work best with exposure for up to 90 minutes in the morning and aren’t portable, people usually find it hard to fit light therapy into their morning routines.

Light therapy—the new way with YumaLite

YumaLite was created to address the shortcomings of traditional stationary light boxes. Not only is YumaLite a head-mounted, light therapy visor that uses clinically proven technology that is effective and safe, it is also ergonomically designed as a lightweight cordless device that rests comfortably on your head. Its portability has revolutionized light therapy devices, allowing you to easily wear it and absorb the power of light while doing any number of things—from having breakfast and reading the paper, to doing housework or exercising. In as few as seven days, users wearing YumaLite for just 30 minutes a day have experienced a significant improvement in their mood and energy. Furthermore, YumaLite is affordable, which means you don’t have to spend a lot of money to get the light you need in your life.

HOW DOES LIGHT THERAPY WORK?

Light affects your mood through its impact on your body clock. Your body clock refers to the internal system inside your body that regulates your physical and mental functions over the course of a day, known as your circadian rhythm. Light establishes your body clock by affecting various hormones in your body, including hormones that tell us when to wake up or go to sleep. Specialized cells in the retina at the back of your eyes, called photosensitive ganglion cells, interpret light/dark and carry this information to the brain signaling the release of various hormones. At night, when no light is detected, the eye sends the signal to the pineal gland in the brain to begin releasing melatonin, which causes you to feel sleepy. Because melatonin is only produced in humans at night, it is known as the ‘hormone of darkness’. In the morning, when light hits your eyes, your brain tells your body to stop making melatonin, and instead to start producing serotonin, another hormone, typically called the happiness hormone because it gives you a ‘lift’ in your day.

Exposure to enough light in the morning and afternoon, and darkness at night, helps your body clock to work properly so you feel normal. But when natural light is not available due to your busy schedule or seasonal changes, your brain doesn't receive the signals it should, when it should. When that’s the case, your body continues to produce too much of the sleep hormone, melatonin, while you’re awake, making you feel lethargic, and too little of the happiness hormone, serotonin, making you feel sad. But melatonin controls more than just sleep. It also regulates reproduction, behaviour, hair growth, hunger, and libido (your sex drive). So when your body clock gets out of whack, these other aspects of your life are impacted. Furthermore, the lack of light affects other hormones, such as insulin and ghrelin, which control your appetite. With your body clock derailed, you may feel, to varying degrees, any of the symptoms of light deficiency—sadness, lethargy, over-sleeping, over-eating, weight gain, difficulty concentrating and diminished libido. 

When natural light isn’t available, light from a specially designed light source like YumaLite can play the role the sun normally would. Using YumaLite to replace the lost light in your life can help you keep your body clock working all year long.

You can use white or red LED light with one simple click on the YumaLite visor. Both work as effectively when used for 20-30 minutes a day in the morning. 

YUMALITE TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS

Features

  • Tilting mechanism for optimal placement
  • Adjustable head mount for easy fitting
  • Folds easily into convenient travel pouch (microfiber bag)
  • Can be comfortably worn while wearing glasses
  • Light mode options include red or white light
  • Made from durable, lightweight, recyclable materials
  • Designed by award-winning design firm Fig40
  • Health Canada compliant
  • Utilizes clinically proven technology

Specifications

  • Weight:           0.7 lbs
  • Dimensions:    6 x 4 x 0.75 inches
  • Light Source:   3 x red LEDs and 3 x white LEDs
  • Power Source: 3 x AAA batteries (no cords)

DRAGON'S DEN APPEARANCE 

Dragon's Den is a Canadian Television show that highlights inventors and entrepreneurs who seek funding for their projects. There is a similar series in the US called Shark Tank that includes 2 of the Canadian Dragons. I appeared on Dragon's Den toward the end of last year. It was an amazing experience that provided tremendous publicity and resulted in me receiving 30% of the funds that I require. 

WHY INDIEGOGO?

While I was able to raise 30% of my funding goal, I still need to raise the remaining 70% to take YumaLite to the next level. Indiegogo funds will be used so that a minimum order quantity can be reached for the commercial production of YumaLite as well as to develop a key "bonus" product that will help drive our sales on The Shopping Channel as well as on Direct Response TV spots. If I am fortunate enough to receive additional funding it will be used to enhance the product as well as for marketing and to continue to expand distribution. 

PLEDGE NOW TO RECEIVE GREAT REWARDS!

Please pledge for GREAT rewards - pledging now will mean that I will receive the funds necessary to produce the YumaLite units for this season!

Whether you work the night shift, are an avid traveller or a new mom, or are one of thousands that suffers from seasonal depression, I urge you to be a part of changing the face of how we as a society address the symptoms of light deficiency. 

THANK YOU SOOOOOOO MUCH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

As someone who has suffered from depression my goal in creating YumaLite was to find a natural solution to help as many people as possible. Thank you for supporting my project - your support means so much to me. I know that with your help we can make this a tremendous success and bring sunshine to people all over the world. 

CLINICAL STUDIES

YumaLite's technology has been recognized in top medical journals:

Kripke, D, Light treatment for nonseasonal depression: speed, efficacy, and combined treatment, Journal of Affective Disorders 49, 1998, pages 109-117.

“Bright light treatment for winter depression is recognized in the Clinical Practice Guidelines issued by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (Depression Guideline Panel, 1993). The American Psychiatric Association’s Treatment of Psychiatric Disorders also endorsed bright light treatment (Rosenthal, 1995).” From Kripke, “Light treatment for nonseasonal depression”. 1997

http://www.jad-journal.com/article/S0165-0327(98)00005-6/abstract

Avery, D, Eder, D, Bolte, MA et al, Dawn Simulation and Bright Light in the Treatment of SAD: A Controlled Study, Society of Biological Psychiatry, 2001; 50:205-216, page 205.

Although bright light therapy is effective, 69% of SAD patients complain of the inconvenience of finding time to sit in front of the bright light (Oren et al 1991). As many as 19% of SAD patients stop bright light treatment because of inconvenience (Schwartz et al 1996). From Avery et al, 2001 “Dawn simulation and Bright Light in the Treatment of SAD: A Controlled Study”.

Levitt, A, Presented by Dr Anthony Levitt, M.D. R.R.C.P.(C) at the Canadian Psychiatric Association Conference, Montreal, P.Q. September 1992.

Dr Anthony Levitt concluded at the Canadian Psychiatric Association Conference in 1992, that “… (light therapy) when delivered using LED light from a light visor has equivalent efficacy as compared with previously studied light units”.

Joffe, R, Moul, D, Lam, R, Levitt, A et al, Light Visor Treatment for Seasonal Affective Disorder: A Multicenter Study, Psychiatry Research, 46:29-30, 1993, pages 31, 33,& 34.

Joffe, Moul, Lam et al administered light therapy at 60, 600, and 3500 lux “for 1/2 hour daily for a period of 2 weeks.

http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0165178193900052

Laurie Tarkan. Your eyes may be the windows to a faster aging process.The New York Times, Herald-Tribune (Tuesday, February 21, 2012)

The New York Times reported on February 21, 2012, that people whose circadian rhythms are out of sync, like shift workers, are at greater risk for a number of ailments, including insomnia, heart disease and cancer, and that researchers have discovered that the body clock relies on light to function properly. According to Dr. David Berson, of Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island, the role of synchronizing our circadian rhythms lies with the eye, which detects light through specialized cells and then sends signals to the brain to release the hormones that our body needs to function properly throughout the day.

http://health.heraldtribune.com/2012/02/21/your-eyes-may-be-the-windows-to-a-faster-aging-process/

R. Manfredini, F. Manfredini, C. Fersini, and F. Conconi, Circadian rhythms, athletic performance, and jet lag,Br J Sports Med. 1998 June; 32(2): 101–106. (PMCID: PMC1756080)

“Rapid air travel across several time zones exposes the traveller to a shift in his/her internal biological clock. The result is a transient desynchronisation of the circadian rhythm, called jet lag, lasting until the rhythm is rephased to the new environmental conditions. The most commonly experienced symptoms are sleep disorders, difficulties with concentrating, irritability, depression, fatigue, disorientation, loss of appetite, and gastrointestinal disturbance. Apart from the decrements in mental and physical performance directly consequent on such symptoms, competitive athletes are also exposed to the additional negative consequences of a shift from the optimal circadian window of performance.”

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1756080/
story_txt:
WHAT IS YUMALITE? ( A safe, effective, clinically proven, ergonomically designed, convenient and affordable one-of-a-kind light therapy visor named after the sunniest place on earth! phew... that about sums it up!)
YumaLite is a head-mounted, medical light therapy visor that helps alleviate the symptoms of low energy and low mood due to a lack of sunlight. YumaLite utilizes patent pending, clinically proven technology that is safe and effective, as well as convenient and affordable (see clinical studies below).  
WHY LIGHT THERAPY?
You’re not getting enough light
Light, preferably natural light, is important for your health. Sunlight is needed for you to feel normal and healthy. The lack of enough light, what we call light deficiency, can have a negative effect on how you feel. In fact, more than 90% of the population suffer each year. There are many reasons you might not receive adequate light. The winter months, rainy days, working inside at the office, jet lag and shift work can also rob you of light and make you feel these same symptoms. Seniors commonly suffer from not getting the light they need, as do mothers with newborn babies who must be awake at all hours.  
How lack of light makes you feel
When you’re light deficient, you can experience a wide range of symptoms. You might feel sad or lethargic. You might have trouble getting out of bed in the morning. You might eat more and gain weight. You can also find it difficult to concentrate. You may even withdraw from friends and family and you might find your libido (sex drive) has decreased. These symptoms can range from mild to severe. Some of us feel severe forms of these symptoms and suffer from winter depression, known as Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD); however, it is a phenomenon that affects people all year long.
When natural light isn’t available, YUMALITE can provide a source of light to help you feel better and give you more energy!
 
FEATURED ON CITYLINE (ENDORSED BY DR. DAVID GREENBERG)
I was fortunate enough to be featured by Dr. David Greenberg, M.D. on "CityLine", the longest running and most successful daytime show for women in Canadian history, when he was discussing light therapy. Please watch the video as I think it sums up YumaLite and its benefits pretty well. 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I___HwJGwK0
BETTER THAN THE ALTERNATIVES
Light therapy—the old way
Traditionally, light therapy has meant sitting in front of stationary lamps for up to 90 minutes each day. Although light boxes have been shown to be safe and effective, traditional devices are expensive and inconvenient. Many cost hundreds of dollars and most light boxes are floor or desk-mounted lamps that require you to sit in front of them. Because they generally work best with exposure for up to 90 minutes in the morning and aren’t portable, people usually find it hard to fit light therapy into their morning routines.
Light therapy—the new way with YumaLite
YumaLite was created to address the shortcomings of traditional stationary light boxes. Not only is YumaLite a head-mounted, light therapy visor that uses clinically proven technology that is effective and safe, it is also ergonomically designed as a lightweight cordless device that rests comfortably on your head. Its portability has revolutionized light therapy devices, allowing you to easily wear it and absorb the power of light while doing any number of things—from having breakfast and reading the paper, to doing housework or exercising. In as few as seven days, users wearing YumaLite for just 30 minutes a day have experienced a significant improvement in their mood and energy. Furthermore, YumaLite is affordable, which means you don’t have to spend a lot of money to get the light you need in your life.

HOW DOES LIGHT THERAPY WORK?
Light affects your mood through its impact on your body clock. Your body clock refers to the internal system inside your body that regulates your physical and mental functions over the course of a day, known as your circadian rhythm. Light establishes your body clock by affecting various hormones in your body, including hormones that tell us when to wake up or go to sleep. Specialized cells in the retina at the back of your eyes, called photosensitive ganglion cells, interpret light/dark and carry this information to the brain signaling the release of various hormones. At night, when no light is detected, the eye sends the signal to the pineal gland in the brain to begin releasing melatonin, which causes you to feel sleepy. Because melatonin is only produced in humans at night, it is known as the ‘hormone of darkness’. In the morning, when light hits your eyes, your brain tells your body to stop making melatonin, and instead to start producing serotonin, another hormone, typically called the happiness hormone because it gives you a ‘lift’ in your day.
Exposure to enough light in the morning and afternoon, and darkness at night, helps your body clock to work properly so you feel normal. But when natural light is not available due to your busy schedule or seasonal changes, your brain doesn't receive the signals it should, when it should. When that’s the case, your body continues to produce too much of the sleep hormone, melatonin, while you’re awake, making you feel lethargic, and too little of the happiness hormone, serotonin, making you feel sad. But melatonin controls more than just sleep. It also regulates reproduction, behaviour, hair growth, hunger, and libido (your sex drive). So when your body clock gets out of whack, these other aspects of your life are impacted. Furthermore, the lack of light affects other hormones, such as insulin and ghrelin, which control your appetite. With your body clock derailed, you may feel, to varying degrees, any of the symptoms of light deficiency—sadness, lethargy, over-sleeping, over-eating, weight gain, difficulty concentrating and diminished libido. 
When natural light isn’t available, light from a specially designed light source like YumaLite can play the role the sun normally would. Using YumaLite to replace the lost light in your life can help you keep your body clock working all year long.
You can use white or red LED light with one simple click on the YumaLite visor. Both work as effectively when used for 20-30 minutes a day in the morning. 
YUMALITE TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
Features

Tilting mechanism for optimal placement
Adjustable head mount for easy fitting
Folds easily into convenient travel pouch (microfiber bag)
Can be comfortably worn while wearing glasses
Light mode options include red or white light
Made from durable, lightweight, recyclable materials
Designed by award-winning design firm Fig40
Health Canada compliant
Utilizes clinically proven technology
Specifications


Weight:           0.7 lbs
Dimensions:    6 x 4 x 0.75 inches
Light Source:   3 x red LEDs and 3 x white LEDs
Power Source: 3 x AAA batteries (no cords)



DRAGON'S DEN APPEARANCE 
Dragon's Den is a Canadian Television show that highlights inventors and entrepreneurs who seek funding for their projects. There is a similar series in the US called Shark Tank that includes 2 of the Canadian Dragons. I appeared on Dragon's Den toward the end of last year. It was an amazing experience that provided tremendous publicity and resulted in me receiving 30% of the funds that I require. 

WHY INDIEGOGO?
While I was able to raise 30% of my funding goal, I still need to raise the remaining 70% to take YumaLite to the next level. Indiegogo funds will be used so that a minimum order quantity can be reached for the commercial production of YumaLite as well as to develop a key "bonus" product that will help drive our sales on The Shopping Channel as well as on Direct Response TV spots. If I am fortunate enough to receive additional funding it will be used to enhance the product as well as for marketing and to continue to expand distribution. 
PLEDGE NOW TO RECEIVE GREAT REWARDS!
Please pledge for GREAT rewards - pledging now will mean that I will receive the funds necessary to produce the YumaLite units for this season!
Whether you work the night shift, are an avid traveller or a new mom, or are one of thousands that suffers from seasonal depression, I urge you to be a part of changing the face of how we as a society address the symptoms of light deficiency. 
THANK YOU SOOOOOOO MUCH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
As someone who has suffered from depression my goal in creating YumaLite was to find a natural solution to help as many people as possible. Thank you for supporting my project - your support means so much to me. I know that with your help we can make this a tremendous success and bring sunshine to people all over the world. 

CLINICAL STUDIES

Kripke, D, Light treatment for nonseasonal depression: speed, efficacy, and combined treatment, Journal of Affective Disorders 49, 1998, pages 109-117.
“Bright light treatment for winter depression is recognized in the Clinical Practice Guidelines issued by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (Depression Guideline Panel, 1993). The American Psychiatric Association’s Treatment of Psychiatric Disorders also endorsed bright light treatment (Rosenthal, 1995).” From Kripke, “Light treatment for nonseasonal depression”. 1997
http://www.jad-journal.com/article/S0165-0327(98)00005-6/abstract

Although bright light therapy is effective, 69% of SAD patients complain of the inconvenience of finding time to sit in front of the bright light (Oren et al 1991). As many as 19% of SAD patients stop bright light treatment because of inconvenience (Schwartz et al 1996). From Avery et al, 2001 “Dawn simulation and Bright Light in the Treatment of SAD: A Controlled Study”.
Levitt, A, Presented by Dr Anthony Levitt, M.D. R.R.C.P.(C) at the Canadian Psychiatric Association Conference, Montreal, P.Q. September 1992.

According to Dr. David Berson, of Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island, the role of synchronizing our circadian rhythms lies with the eye, which detects light through specialized cells and then sends signals to the brain to release the hormones that our body needs to function properly throughout the day.

story:
Kilifi Kids is an all-volunteer partnership of young professionals in the US and Kenya working to make real changes in the world. Our focus is on the health and education of kids in a small region of Kenya called Kilifi.

We’re looking for support for our “Cornerstone Trip” to:

  1. Share the story of the people in Kenya who building a brighter future for their communities by collecting video, pictures, and writing to share with US supporters like you; and
  2. Help 10,000 kids in Kilifi fight malnourishment by “mHealth”: innovative use of cell phones in healthcare and malnutrition treatment

Funds will complement existing resources to send co-founder Michael Olsen and board member Erik Michielsen to Kenya for two weeks of interviews with lots of community members and intensive meetings with government, community, and technology partners to improve the mHealth project.

Your support will allow you to take part in the trip as much as possible—see our perks.

Background: Non-profit Kilifi Kids was founded in 2006 to create healthier and brighter futures for the kids in Kilifi, Kenya. To date, over 25,000 children have been served, mainly through de-worming medication that keeps them healthy and in school. In sum, the effort has added over 6,000 years of schooling to the community. See our snazzy new website for more info.

story:
Summary

Our founder is Tristan Lim, an avid inventor and passionate technology and design activist. He had spent more than 10 years in technology firms; Microsoft, Xerox, Google...  His passion for great ideas often led him to think about better ways to get things done and he has now personally taken on the challenge of bringing a whole new product to market.

The inspiration for this particular product came when Tristan's baby girl was  frequently getting sick and the doctor helped to trace the source to the bedroom's humidifier. It was hard to clean properly and its water tank was breeding and spewing fungi and bacteria all over the room! Google what the health hazards of a dirty humidifier! The baby was also very fascinated by night lights and the humidifier's mist jet. He couldn't find anything satisfactory in the market and decided to create a safer, healthier one for her himself and the race was on!

After 1 and a half years of effort to research and redesign an improved humidifier from a dad's point of view, we proudly present myPearl® , a powerful, fun, portable, cordless, ultrasonic, air-cleaning, germ-killing, easy to clean, easy to use, practical, aromatherapy humidifier!

It is the first product of its kind in the world. We love it and hope you will too!
* Protected by multiple international patents.


myPearl® Benefits!

Waterproof Fully waterproofed shell for up to 50 cm of water. Yes, you can charge it with the USB cable while it floats and runs, and yes, the plugs are also waterproofed! Also features a detached reservoir. Bath toy, home spa accessory, vase, fish tank, pool decoration, etc... The ways to use this are limited only by your imagination.
Portable Only 10cm wide and 8cm tall, this is a truly portable turbo humidifier. Perfect for those cold, dry hotel nights! Just drop into a basin or big bowl for a night long session or use with the included reservior for a quick refresher.
Cordless
(USB & Li-ion Battery) 		2000mAH of Li-ion battery delivers up to 3 hours of wireless run time. After that, just plug it into any USB charger and it comes back to life. Or if you prefer, just leave the cord in for continuous mist
Latest
Ultrasonic Technologies 		Older humidifier technologies have many disadvantages. We are using the most advanced, energy efficient and sustainable, ultrasonic technology, Ultrasonic Vibrating Mesh Technology, or UVMT, (used in the most advanced medical devices) as the basis of our product.
Germ killing: 110 kHz vibration kills off 99.5% of bacteria, fungi and spores
Air cleaning: Powerful mist jets binds with air pollutants and drags them out of the air
Energy Saver: 1.5 watts, less than a quarter of a regular humidifier
Fine mist: 5 nanometer mist, each a droplet so small, it can drift along in the air and enter pores instantly. Breathe in the pure luxury. (A human hair is 80,000 to 100,000 nanometers wide)
High Output: 3 synchronized, turbocharged mist ports delivers powerful mist jets that rival full sized, plugged-in models.
Aromatherapy Only 3 drops of essential oils for more than a week of relaxation! Save on your precious oils.
Yes! You can use it multiple times with one infusion of your favourite oils!
And the fine, cool, nano mist spreads the goodness all around, without heating and denaturing the oils.
Ultrabright LED Brings out the magic in the floating mist. Lights come in Ultra White and Aurora Multicolor.
One Touch Operation Capacitive technology lets you easily toggle through 4 modes: Mist with Light, Light only, Mist only and Off.

How myPearl® Works

Liquid is pumped from the bottom by capillary action and turned into cool, refreshing mist by the ultrasonic chips.

Add essential oils or perfume to the water to quickly spread the fragrance!
It can either be floated in a big bowl/tank/pool or simply placed in an elegant saucer.

What We Need & What You Get

We have done all of the preproduction and testing work and now we need to your help to kickstart our first large scale production run. (We have already self-funded a successful preproduction run of 1000 units to shorten and the time we need to deliver to you!) We plan to start production on Jun 30 and finish the first run by 15 Jul 2014. Yes, you can look forward to a fixed delivery date from us! 

We have also prepared a series of unique deals to reward your efforts and to spread the goodness around. Deals of more than 55% off are in the Perks section! So do take a close look and please help out!

100% of the money we raise here will be used for the production run as we have already absorbed the R&D and initial production pilot-run costs. We only need your help to make the first large scale production run as efficient as possible; bigger orders will help us to negotiate better prices with our suppliers.

If we exceed our goal, the excess will go towards enlarging our first production run and making more units and lowering production costs! We are committed to bringing 100% of the value of the campaign back to our supporters.

If we don't get the full funding we are asking for, we will still go ahead with the production run on our own. Unit costs will go up sharply, so we really hope to have your help to make this more economical.

Why do we do this?

Most home humidifiers we see in the market today are boring, bulky, wired and hard to clean. In our design, we are addressing these issues by making it a fun, funky, compact, cordless and extremely easy to clean (just rinse it with warm dishwater).

This is the first portable, cordless ultrasonic device designed to operate in a wet environment. In fact, some of our beta-testers love using it in their bathtubs, fish tanks, swimming pools, jacuzzis, home spas, vases, etc. We'd love to hear, and see, more creative ways to use our product so do email us @ info@fountainworks.sg with a video or a pic and we will pick a winner every month (til Dec) 2014 for a limited edition, personalized myPearl® Crystal.

Also, in this initial run, we are making white and limited edition crystal shells. With your help to make this a success, we intend to make a wider range of colors including luminous, fluorescent and glow-in-the-dark shells and continue to add features to the product such as remote control, customized shells, etc.

Planned add-on accessories include personalized/cartoon/festive snap on shells, so you can change its look according to your mood today! More ideas are in the pipeline. If you have any ideas for us, please email us @ info@fountainworks.sg and if we can use your idea, we will reward you for it!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel the need for one of our products but still find our ideas interesting, do help us by letting others know about our campaign!
Thank you for reading our pitch, and have a great day!
