We have done all of the preproduction and testing work and now we need to your 
help to kickstart our first large scale production run. (We have 
already self-funded a successful preproduction run of 1000 units to shorten and the 
time we need to deliver to you!) We plan to start production on Jun 30 and finish the first run by 15 Jul 2014. Yes, you can look forward to a fixed delivery date from us! 
We have also prepared a series of unique deals to reward your efforts and to 
spread the goodness around. Deals of more than 55% off are in the Perks section! 
So do take a close look and please help out!
100% of the money we raise here will be used for the production run as we have 
already absorbed the R&D and initial production pilot-run costs. We only need 
your help to make the first large scale production run as efficient as possible; 
bigger orders will help us to negotiate better prices with our suppliers.
If we exceed our goal, the excess will go towards enlarging our first production 
run and making more units and lowering production costs! We are committed to 
bringing 100% of the value of the campaign back to our supporters.If we don't get the full funding we are asking for, we will still go ahead 
with the production run on our own. Unit costs will go up sharply, so we 
really hope to have your help to make this more economical.
    Why do we do this?

Most home humidifiers we see in the market today are boring, bulky, wired and 
hard to clean. In our design, we are addressing these issues by making it a fun, 
funky, compact, cordless and extremely easy to clean (just rinse it with warm 
dishwater).
This is the first portable, cordless ultrasonic device designed to operate in a 
wet environment. In fact, some of our beta-testers love using it in their 
bathtubs, fish tanks, swimming pools, jacuzzis, home spas, vases, etc. We'd love 
to hear, and see, more creative ways to use our product so do email us @ 
info@fountainworks.sg with a video or a pic and we will pick a winner every 
month (til Dec) 2014 for a limited edition, personalized myPearl® Crystal.
Also, in this initial run, we are making white and limited edition crystal 
shells. With your help to make this a success, we intend to make a wider range 
of colors including luminous, fluorescent and glow-in-the-dark shells and 
continue to add features to the product such as remote control, customized 
shells, etc.
Planned add-on accessories include personalized/cartoon/festive snap on shells, 
so you can change its look according to your mood today! More ideas are in the 
pipeline. If you have any ideas for us, please email us @ info@fountainworks.sg 
and if we can use your idea, we will reward you for it!
    Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel the need for one of our products but still find our ideas 
interesting, do help us by letting others know about our campaign!
Thank you for reading our pitch, and have a great day!

story:
What This is All About

My passion for improving the health and well-being of young people around the world has led me to embark on this journey to gain more experience on how to educate adolescents on their health in order to improve health outcomes. I have been invited (a unique honor) to attend a workshop on Research Methodology in Sexual and Reproductive Health,  organized by the Geneva Foundation for Medical Education and Research (GFMER) at the World Health Organization Office in Geneva, Switzerland. This is a one-week course in September, after which I will head to Lagos, Nigeria to begin my nine months to one year immersion in adolescent health work. The GFMER has offered to cover my accommodation costs (hotel and daily allowance) while I attend the workshop, and I need your help to offset my travel costs. 

Why This Matters To Me/My Story

Born in Nigeria and raised in the United States, I have always had a passion for cross-cultural experiences and giving back. My academic and career path have led me to focus on Global Public Health - working to improve the livelihoods and health outcomes for all persons, with a particular focus on adolescents. My experience as an adolescent was relatively different from many of my childhood peers. Living in the United States, I was able to enjoy the benefits of unlimited access to health information and services that were, and continue to be inaccessible to my peers in developing countries like Nigeria. In fact,  many of the world’s 1.2 billion adolescents never get to enjoy the benefits of the adolescent period due to factors such as malnutrition, STDs/HIV/AIDs, and violence. Hence, this cause is important to me because i want to ensure that youth all over the world, particularly those in marginalized communities (especially girls and orphans) are empowered with knowledge and practical skills to live out their fullest potential as citizens of the world. Through your support, we will transform the current state of poor adolescent health outcomes and empower our most productive citizens to create the better world we all envision.

What I Need & What You Get

I kindly ask that you support my passion for youth by helping me offset my travel expenses. Your contribution of any amount will help me pay for fees associated with changing my original flight arrangements for Nigeria in order to accommodate the workshop in Geneva. My goal is to raise $600 between now and August 12 when i leave the US. My $600 goal is based on current estimates of my travel adjustment costs. Your support is greatly appreciated, and to show my gratitude, every person who makes a contribution will receive a special token of appreciation from me (e.g. souvenir from Nigeria and/or a thank you note with a picture from Geneva). I also promise to provide a summary of my experience at the workshop via my traveling blog (stay tuned for link).

The Impact

Simply stated, your donation will give me a big boost in fulfilling my lifelong dream of being the change that I want to see in the world. Through my participation in the GFMER course, I will gain valuable insights and practical knowledge on how to conduct effective research on health issues that affect young people globally. I will leave the workshop with skills and a unique network of global health professionals which will be valuable as I transition to work in adolescent health in Nigeria. By empowering young people with the tools they need to live healthy and productive lives, we are making our world a better and safer place for everyone. I hope you will help me make this a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

While I am seeking (and appreciate) your financial contribution, I also ask for your prayers for protection, wisdom, and success as I take this leap of Faith in this next life adventure. Please pray for safe travels, peace in Nigeria, and good health and unwavering  courage for me as I pursue my passion for youth.

Your support means the world to me! Thank you for however you choose to support me on this journey. 

Sincerely,

Onyinye

story:
FU Real Talk

FU. The real. The talk. Seinfeld infused with Bill Murray. The Sandlot with a heavy dose of Amen Corner. It's Beethoven's 5th laced with Kate Upton. It's ear milk. A frat movement. A culturematic. But most importantly it's the authentic voice of sports wisdom a tight community like ours has been craving for. So grab some headphones and join the movement. 

We go back like rocking chairs. Not just our brotherhood, but the entire Furman community. We often questioned why our story didn't resonate outside of Furman. It is strong inside the campus gates, but beyond Poinsett our voice was faint. We also knew that there are alumni that feel detached from Furman after they leave or feel the desire to get involved with their alma mater but don't know how. In addition we knew that in the South, where college athletics reign over professional sports, Furman has become somewhat of an afterthought in the grand scheme. Time has passed, we have graduated, and found jobs in Southeast. We have seen high school friends, colleagues, and family and heard them describe their college experiences. In conversation we realized that they all were connected with their peers and respective schools, but no one seemed to have the same genuine relationships (with friends and school) as we did. We have created a true, tight knit bond that will continue to endure and that passion for community is what drives us.

That being said, we wanted to create a voice. A common ground for all Furman fans, sports fans, or even just people who like to disagree on topics they know nothing about. Not only to promote Furman athletics, but to expand sports knowledge and push the boundaries of perspective, all while enticing others to join. This is how we do it.

FU Real Talk. A podcast, created to promote Furman athletics through the spoken word. We talk sports on a daily basis, so why not share our conversations, ideas, opinions, and experiences all while being true to who we are. Who we are as former Furman athletes, who we are as sports fans, and who we are as individuals. Yet, this is more than just a podcast. Our mission is to create a community. A community of fans, alumni, friends, and family. A community that proudly represents Furman and the Diamond F. A community that lives and breathes sports. A community that values relationships and the fellowship that endures. Most importantly, a community that enjoys life and loves to have a good time.

*This project is and will be fan created is in no way affiliated with Furman University or Furman Athletics. The opinions and views expressed wherein are not the views and opinions of Furman University or Furman Athletics.

The Crew

Ben Granger
Furman University '12
Greenville, SC

Chas Short
Furman University '12
Atlanta, GA

Gary Scott
Furman University '13
Charlotte, NC

Feel free to contact us with any questions or comments at furealtalk@gmail.com

What We Need

In order to make this venture a reality, we need some help. Our plan is to create:

  • a website that will serve as a home for our community
  • a podcast that will serve as our voice
  • any additional promotional materials to help spread the word

    • If you contribute to this project you will help provide the resources needed in order to begin FU Real Talk. Contributions of any amount will be greatly appreciated. We thank you in advance for your time and consideration.

      Risks & Challenges

      Being that FU Real Talk is and will be fan created and have no affiliation with Furman University or Furman Athletics, one of our challenges will be making sure we are able to gain support and help from the Furman Athletics community on campus (being coaches, athletes, and fans). We would love to feature coaches, athletes, and fans on our podcasts during interviews and segments, therefore we will make sure to follow the necessary and proper steps in order to do so legally and always in good taste.

      Our biggest challenge will come in the form of time. We are not looking to profit from the venture. This project will be constructed in our free time and outside of our weekly obligations and responsibilities with our respective jobs. We are positive that we will succeed in finding the time to create our podcast and community, because FU Real Talk will serve as an outlet from our day-to-day grinds as well as yours.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you are unable to contribute, there are plenty of additional ways you can help:

      • Share, Share, Share this project with your friends and family
      • Indiegogo has an app - download here: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/indiegogo/id752234889
      • Give the crew some words of encouragement and motivation to help move this project forward (we're also open to any thoughts and opinions)

      We thank you for your time and consideration

story:
Making a difference

“A picture paints a thousand words” what we see here is painted by a very talented elderly with photographic memories, Mr William. He doesn’t only love his city so much but also created many absolutely beautiful local attraction in his works. However, the place he stays turns out to be a contrary to his work.

We are a group of university students, Tiam Foo from Malaysia (Studying in UK), Jimmy from China (studying in Australia), Ajinkya from India, Jhona from Colombia and Caroline,Mavi and Maisa from Brazil, who spent 6 weeks of our summer volunteering with AIESEC Salvador, Brazil. AIESEC is a global non-profit organisation that offer local volunteering works to students. So, our work in Salvador is merely just putting an effort to make them feel loved and cared again as they have been getting so little attention from society and even from their own children.

Maria and josé’s house is where we work. Mr William and other 16 elderly are currently living there. After spending a couple weeks there, feedbacks from the owner of the house were fantastic! There are improvements of the atmosphere in the homes. The elderly are laughing more than they ever have and workers are filled with positive energy too.

However, we also realise the great need of improving the condition of the house for the fellow elderly. Some of the equipments for the elderly need to be repaired and Some of the old people need special attention because Hypernatremia, Diabetes and handicapped.  We believe we can help them to have a better environment for their retired life.

Inspiration

Every one of the elderly here was once a capable parent who raise up their own children. However, aging is cruel and it takes away their abilities to take care and nourish their children. Then they are left here alone with disabilities and no attention is given to them from the society. We are fortunate enough to get well taken care of by our beloved grandparents/elders when we are young. It’s time for us to give some love back to the less fortunate ones!

Challenges

We have built a healthy emotional status to them through, dancing, interacting and singing. What we can do for them now is to give them a better environment to stay comfortable and make the most out of their many years to come after we leave

What we need

We need fully functionally wheelchairs and sturdy furniture to prevent accident from happening, special milk powder for elderly, new pillows & blankets, paints for new wall and new furniture.

For donation, please check our perks list for more rewards!

Other ways you can help

Thank you very much for checking out our campaign. From the bottom of my heart, I wish to make a difference to their retired life, a more colourful life! Please Give a lending hand to mr William so that he can continue to pursuit his passion and help to improve the elderly there who need all the cares we have! Also, please spread the word by sharing the link > http://igg.me/at/makingadiff

story:
Our Story...

My name is Ariana Rolon, I am 29 Years old and I am the only biological child to Magaly Lopez & Raul Rolon (Deceased). 

 

On January 1st at around 6am Kuwait Standard Time I received one of the worse calls of my life. I was informed that my mother had just had a motorcycle accident and was in critical condition. Being so far away from my family I felt hopeless. I thank God for the friends and family that have stuck by me since day one. With out their love and support I do not know how I would have endured the pain I felt and went through all in a matter of seconds from a phone call.

 

At the age of 48 my mother has endured more than anyone will ever will in their full life's span. She was diagnosed with cancer at the age of 19 (immediately after I was conceived). Recommended to abort me by doctors she put it in God's hands and here I am. My mother is a daughter, sister, aunt, and friend to many and it is now that she needs the most support, just as she has given many in her life. She will put her needs before others and deteriorate in her own health without even realizing it. 

 

My mothers current care giver is my Grandmother America Plaza 75 years old it is only so much she can do at her elderly age and fragile state of health. Since her accident my mother has had 3 surgeries, blood transfusions, skin graphs amongst many other procedures. From metal plates, screws, braces inserted to her left leg and left arm etc she still has managed to keep that infectious smile on her face. As of 1 March my mother has been placed in a physical therapy facility located in Puerto Rico (Millennium Institute) until full recovery.

 

I know that with your help I can have my mother nursed back to full health and walking by the end of the year. I thank you all for your time and attention. Thank you for opening your hearts and minds. For all the prayers for me and my family I also thank you. May God multiply you with endless blessings.

 

God Bless

Ariana Rolon

The Impact...

Reaching this goal will have a tremendous impact on my mothers life. She will strengthen her faith knowing that there are still caring and humanitarian giving people willing to help from their hearts.

What We Need...

The ultimate goal of this campaign/fundraiser is for the renovations to my grandmothers house in order to accommodate and facilitate my mother with the comforts, easy access and mobility that she needs since now in a wheel chair.

Other Ways You Can Help...

Cards & Motivation Letters can be sent to the Below Address:

Magaly Lopez

P.O. Box 5574

Caguas, P.R. 00725

story:
My mother's name is Jacquelyn Fargano. She is a teacher, a mother, a loyal sister, and friend. She has had a long road of struggles and accomplishments all of her life. She has had to experience a lot of give and take. Coming from a large working class family, she was the only one to attend and graduate college. However to do so, she had to take out a lot of loans that she is still paying for. In her 30's, she decided to become a single working parent and have me, her daughter and only child. The only draw back to that is that an extra person to support has meant she has had to work 3-5 jobs a month ever since I can remember. Besides being a full time teacher, she would take on teaching night classes at private and city colleges, teaching courses online, tutoring and even working retail. Through out her life she has lost both parents, three of her four siblings, and her husband in 2005.

Despite facing so much adversity and hardship, my mother has always been such a vibrant person. Those who have met her always comment on how intellectual, funny, open minded, kind, supportive and giving she is. And all of these things are so true. She is a beautiful light in this world.

After her husband's death, and when taking on a more sedentary job, my mom began to experience major health issues. Not only is she experiencing a variety of genetic health issues, my mom also experienced lifestyle change health issues that are now leading her to need Gastric Bypass surgery. This is NOT a fat shaming campaign, by the way. There is a serious misconception in our society that fat is unhealthy. There are many healthy fat people just like there are many unhealthy thin people. Everyone is different. For my mother though, her frame has always been naturally very small. Due to her current weight, however, my mom is experiencing serious physical problems, including knee and feet issues that make it hard for her to move around in a general manner.

The surgery is being mainly covered by her health insurance, but there is still an ample copay of $650. That may not seem like a lot, but due to the deep financial hole my mom has recently found herself in, and the reality that her current place of work is being liquified into the school district, and having a hard timing finding jobs she can access online, $650 is a lot of money. At least, to us.

I have two options: try out Indiegogo or try to take out a loan and pay for it myself. I am very wary about the latter, seeing that I already have personal bills and school I am trying to pay for on a limited salary, and thus I have decided to do the former. Secretly, I might add, for my mom has asked me in the past to not tell anyone about her condition. We sadly did not learn about the copay till maybe a week ago, which is why my time is very limited to get the money in on time for her surgery date at the beginning of the year.

Whatever it takes, I am going to help my mom get better. She has always been there for me, even though I haven't always been able to be there for her. She has always been so giving, and she really deserves to finally be the one receiving some positivity and kindness.


Thank you for your consideration and happy holidays.
story_txt: My mother's name is Jacquelyn Fargano. She is a teacher, a mother, a loyal sister, and friend. She has had a long road of struggles and accomplishments all of her life. She has had to experience a lot of give and take. Coming from a large working class family, she was the only one to attend and graduate college. However to do so, she had to take out a lot of loans that she is still paying for. In her 30's, she decided to become a single working parent and have me, her daughter and only child. The only draw back to that is that an extra person to support has meant she has had to work 3-5 jobs a month ever since I can remember. Besides being a full time teacher, she would take on teaching night classes at private and city colleges, teaching courses online, tutoring and even working retail. Through out her life she has lost both parents, three of her four siblings, and her husband in 2005.Despite facing so much adversity and hardship, my mother has always been such a vibrant person. Those who have met her always comment on how intellectual, funny, open minded, kind, supportive and giving she is. And all of these things are so true. She is a beautiful light in this world.After her husband's death, and when taking on a more sedentary job, my mom began to experience major health issues. Not only is she experiencing a variety of genetic health issues, my mom also experienced lifestyle change health issues that are now leading her to need Gastric Bypass surgery. This is NOT a fat shaming campaign, by the way. There is a serious misconception in our society that fat is unhealthy. There are many healthy fat people just like there are many unhealthy thin people. Everyone is different. For my mother though, her frame has always been naturally very small. Due to her current weight, however, my mom is experiencing serious physical problems, including knee and feet issues that make it hard for her to move around in a general manner.The surgery is being mainly covered by her health insurance, but there is still an ample copay of $650. That may not seem like a lot, but due to the deep financial hole my mom has recently found herself in, and the reality that her current place of work is being liquified into the school district, and having a hard timing finding jobs she can access online, $650 is a lot of money. At least, to us.I have two options: try out Indiegogo or try to take out a loan and pay for it myself. I am very wary about the latter, seeing that I already have personal bills and school I am trying to pay for on a limited salary, and thus I have decided to do the former. Secretly, I might add, for my mom has asked me in the past to not tell anyone about her condition. We sadly did not learn about the copay till maybe a week ago, which is why my time is very limited to get the money in on time for her surgery date at the beginning of the year.Whatever it takes, I am going to help my mom get better. She has always been there for me, even though I haven't always been able to be there for her. She has always been so giving, and she really deserves to finally be the one receiving some positivity and kindness.Thank you for your consideration and happy holidays.

story:
Hi, My name’s Migle!

I’m Lithuanian and I grew up in Australia. I finished year 12 at Melbourne Girls’ College in November of last year (2014) with an awesome score of 91.4. Now I’m 18 and exploring the world during my “Gap Year”. I plan to study Human Sciences at The University of Oxford in 2016, or otherwise a double degree in Arts and Science at Monash University in Melbourne.

I have been interested in environmental issues as well as animal rights from a young age, as well as Humanitarian issues more recently. I went vegetarian at 15 and I am currently Vegan. Veganism is something which motivates me to help the world as much as I can by implementing positive change as well as taking action.

On the 3rd of October this year I am going to Tanzania, Africa for 2 weeks. While I’m there, I will hands-on volunteer with an organization called E.P.I.C which stands for Everyday People Initiating Change. I will be building a well with a small group of volunteers. The well will bring Clean Fresh drinking water to a community which doesn’t currently have access to this resource which many of us take for granted. I can feel a strong of community about this project, and I can tell that working with the whole Team there, Including the local Tanzanians and the other fellow volunteers, will be an unbelievable learning experience and a major opportunity for Growth.  I can’t wait to become a stronger, kinder, more balanced leader. A better Example than I am today. Closer towards being my Best Self. And I can’t wait to meet the Team!

The on-ground part of my participation in this project requires $ 2950 US (Approximately $3970 Aus and 2670 Euros). This is my fundraising goal. On-ground does not include flights, Vaccines or Insurance which my parents are helping me cover.

Thank You so much for your Attention
I’m Infinitely Grateful for every dollar contributed from the bottom of my heart

Mig

story:
Ethical values

Today, my conviction is that I want to participate in this change by sharing my experiment to make a commitment all together from day to day not to waste this wonderful Earth and to become aware that the happiness is not in the overconsumption, but that the well-being lives, is in reasonable one attitude and the self-respect (of its body) other human beings and other species (animal or plant).
You want to change the world, change your consumer habits, become a “clean eater”, a “flexitarian!  You want to preserve your health and the Earth!
« the food is our first natural medicine (Hippocrate – 460 before A.D).

Life is wonderful and happiness is just the result of small quite simple actions and shares: the effects of which are guaranteed!

Les valeurs

 Changer le monde c’est changer maintenant nos habitudes de vie et de consommation. Préserver la planète et se nourrir pour se faire du bien. Manger « Propre » !
Prendre le temps de préparer ses repas c’est prendre soin de soi et des autres, prendre soin du monde et de la nature.

La vie est merveilleuse et le bonheur le résultat de petites actions toutes simples dont les effets sont garantis.



Prepare your own meals in less than 15’

If you want to feel better you need to eat better: change the way you see meals and listen to your body. I’ll show you how. I’ll share what I have learnt.

I’ll show you how to break the mould, trust your judgment and common sense:  feel good seven days a week!

Préparez votre repas maison en 15 minutes !

Vous voulez vous sentir mieux : Bien manger, changer l’idée que vous avez du repas, écouter votre corps, je vais vous apprendre, partager mon expérience de flexitarienne.

Toute l’année ! Une newsletter tous les jeudis vous proposera des recettes, des infos, vous donnera les produits de saison et vous apportera un plus d’idées et de bonne humeur, donc de bien-être !


Why? “Frichticook.com”?

What Is a « Frichti »?

Pop. Repas, mets qui est cuisiné. Je vais vous faire un frichti que vous vous en pourlécherez les babouines (Bruant, 1901, p. 388).


The advantages

The recipes I propose on my web site are not time-consuming to prepare and don’t require particular culinary skills. Preparation times vary from ten minutes to half an hour.

One course meals

The recipes are often for one-course meals prepared with vegetables, carbohydrates (slow sugars) and protein (animal or vegetable). All of them can be adapted to suit your tastes: you can replace fresh cream with natural yoghurt or cream cheese, almond paste, soya or organic oats; butter by margarine or oil, the list is endless.

No stress

Use your leftovers

Fruit and veg every day

Saving money


Even as a single mum with two children and a full-time job I found time to cook.

LES AVANTAGES

Préparer son repas 

Pas besoin d’être un « pro » de la cuisine. Temps de préparation moyen 15 minutes !

Plats uniques

Légumes, féculents (sucres lents) et une protéine (animale ou végétale).

Recettes modulables

S’adaptent à vos goûts omnivores ou végétariens, sans gluten (indication des produits équivalents pour remplacement),recette régionales...

No stress

Utiliser les restes !

Manger des légumes et des fruits tous les jours !

Faire des économies

Même seule avec 2 enfants à charge, travaillant toute la journée, j’y suis arrivée ! Vous pouvez le faire !


Subscribe to Frichticook.com

For all, a newsletter every Thursday will propose you recipes, information, will give you seasonal produce and will bring you one more ideas and in a good mood, thus of well-being!

For the subscriber:

Every thursday with your newsletter :

5 RECIPES OF SIMPLE AND BALANCED ONE COURSE MEAL

And the smart shopping list to do it

Advice :

Easy cooking tricks (kitchen), the bases of kitchen’s cupboards (summer & winter), fresh products in season, seasons fruits & vegetables calendar…

For 6€ a month (student, less than 25 and funders are 3€/month)

Abonnez vous à Frichticook.com

Pour tous une newsletter, le jeudi vous apportera un billet de bonne humeur, des informations sur les produits de saison, des informations, des recettes de saison…de la simplicité !

Pour les abonnés :

Tous les jeudis

5 RECETTES DE PLATS UNIQUES SIMPLES et EQUILIBRES

Et la liste de courses intelligente pour les réaliser

Les conseils :

Astuces cuisine facile, les bases de placards (été, hiver), de produits frais en saison, le calendrier des fruits et légumes …,

Pour 6€ par mois : (étudiants – de 25 et participants au financement 3€)


For the making of the website

In French and in English for everyone in Europe and oversea

I need your help to realize my dream!


What I need:  7 000€

To create the website , paying the webmaster work (1 500€), 

for the translation (1 500€), 

the owners right for the pictures and the administrative fee (1 200€)

for the informatic equipment, efficient informatics software, management of the site and for a camera (2 800€)

(all of it will be used for the efficiency of this project).

What you get:

free months of subscriptions ...

All the funders will benefit a half price discount on the monthly subscription for 2 years (3€/month instead of 6€/month)

And of course your names and thanks on the website!

Pour réaliser ce site

En français et en anglais, pour tous en Europe et ailleurs !

J’ai besoin de votre aide pour réaliser mon rêve!

J’ai besoin de :   7 000€

Pour créer le site, payer le travail du webmaster (1 500€)

Les traductions (1 500€)

Les droits des photographies et les frais administratifs (1 200€), 

m’équiper en informatique performant et softs de graphisme et de gestion, appareil photo et vidéo (2 800€)

tout cela pour vous proposer un site simple et efficace.



Who am I?

A 55 years old woman wanting to create her own job and business that will give her partners a job working on this project (translator, webmaster, photograph…)

I was born into a family that is French from Alsace on one side and Spanish and Maltese on the other. My mixed origins have been very enriching – as has my life in Lyon, the gastronomic capital of France (Paul Bocuse). Like the ‘mères lyonnaises’ (Lyon Mothers) I have kept notebooks of everyday recipes – and many more – over the past thirty years.

I started preparing family meals at the age of 10 or 11 from recipes my mother wrote on pieces of paper. I followed them to the letter.

I would like to pass on this knowledge to others.

I took a training course in enterprise creation in Lyon in 2009.

I am a flexitarian, I limit my consumption of meat.

My dream is to help you discover new tastes in the simplest of ways  and for you to take pleasure each and every day by eating a healthy, balanced diet.

My aim is to work in accordance with my own values and to marry my work with those values and my life style.

The site will evolve to give you information and good news onto the planet, of course new recipes and other surprises to know the French “savoir vivre”, and my most expensive wish is that it helps to protect you healthy and good-humored!

I hope to soon be able to accompany you!

Qui suis-je ?

Une femme française de 55 ans qui désire créer son emploi et développer un business qui donnera de l’emploi à d’autres !

Grâce à mes origines espagnoles et alsaciennes, à ma résidence à LYON (capitale gastronomique) pendant 30 ans et aux conditions de mon éducation, j'ai commencé à préparer les repas familiaux dès l'âge de 10-11 ans, recettes écrites par ma Maman sur un morceau de papier que je suivais à la lettre. Comme les « mères lyonnaises » j’ai mes cahiers où j’ai noté mes recettes, celles de tous les jours et les autres.

Un Frichti à savourer !

J'ai bénéficié d'un stage de création d'entreprise auprès de la Chambre de Commerce et d'Industrie de LYON.

Aujourd'hui je veux travailler en accord avec mon éthique, faire correspondre mon travail à mes valeurs et à mon choix de vie, ces valeurs étant : le partage, la création, la découverte.

Le site évoluera pour vous donner des informations et des actualités sur la planète, bien sûr d’autres recettes et d’autres surprises sur le savoir faire et le savoir vivre français,  et mon vœu le plus cher est qu’il aide à vous préserver en bonne santé et de bonne humeur!

J’espère vous accompagner bientôt !

Merci par avance,

Marie-Pierre BOSLE


Frichticook.com

story:
Our Story

I am a volunteer for The Fresh Air Fund (http://www.freshair.org), which is a not-for-profit organization that provides FREE summer vacations to NY City children (ages 6-18) from low income neighborhoods. The Fresh Air Fund has been around since 1877. My area has been participating as a Friendly Town since 1998. Volunteer host families open their doors and hearts to these children every summer.

Last year I started an annual fund raising event locally to help cover the cost of activities that we do with the children while they are in town. The cost of the event took a large chunk away from the funds we raised. I am hoping to off set that this year by getting contributions toward the event itself. This way any money raised can go directly to our Lynchburg Friendly Town, and directly benefit the children that come visit us.

 

Our fundraiser this year is a Luau theme, and will be Saturday June 25th at DeVault Famly  Vineyards in Concord VA:  http://www.devaultvineyards.com/.


 

The Impact

The Friendly Town program allows children to experience the joys of summer outside of the city, and share the beauty of our local community. The simple, summertime traditions of bare feet, swimming, campfires and star-gazing are important to every child. We are fortunate enough to have this in our backyard, and with your help many more city youngsters will be able to enjoy it as well.

Without extra funding, the volunteer host families are limited in activities. The Fresh Air Fund has a saying - "Share a little fresh air, Change a child's life." By contributing to this campaign, you are touching a child's life. Every experience a child has, whether good or bad, is a building block toward their future. Please help us give them more positive experiences.


 

What We Need & What You Get

This is our second annual fundraiser. We have to cover the costs of the facility, the food and beverages, the decorations, the flyers, tickets and any special permits required.

All funds received will go directly toward the fundraiser cost. If we do not meet the goal, we will still have the fundraiser. The remainder of the cost will just come out of the funds raised from ticket sales. If we receive more money than needed, the extra money will be donated directly to The Fresh Air Fund's Lynchburg Friendly Town.

 

Any amount, small or large will be helpful. Please consider helping us today.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any one can help by posting links to our campaign on their social website. We are always in need of volunteers. Go visit the fresh air website at (http://www.freshair.org) for more information. Tell as many people about us as you can. We are doing good things for children one summer at a time.

We are fortunate enough to have this in our backyard, and with your help many more city youngsters will be able to enjoy it as well. 
Without extra funding, the volunteer host families are limited in activities. The Fresh Air Fund has a saying - "Share a little fresh air, Change a child's life." By contributing to this campaign, you are touching a child's life. Every experience a child has, whether good or bad, is a building block toward their future. Please help us give them more positive experiences.
 


What We Need & What You Get
This is our second annual fundraiser. We have to cover the costs of the facility, the food and beverages, the decorations, the flyers, tickets and any special permits required. 
All funds received will go directly toward the fundraiser cost. If we do not meet the goal, we will still have the fundraiser. The remainder of the cost will just come out of the funds raised from ticket sales. If we receive more money than needed, the extra money will be donated directly to The Fresh Air Fund's Lynchburg Friendly Town.
 
Any amount, small or large will be helpful. Please consider helping us today. 
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Any one can help by posting links to our campaign on their social website. We are always in need of volunteers. Go visit the fresh air website at (http://www.freshair.org) for more information. Tell as many people about us as you can. We are doing good things for children one summer at a time.

story:
Build connection with #MindfulSeating

mello{be} cushions enable mindfulness with supreme comfort, posture support, and modern design. Mindful seating helps you pause, show up for the present moment, and feel your body. Not just in meditation - they help you become mindful in everyday life.

Connect your mind and body, and become attuned to the world around with #MindfulSeating.

mello{be} started from a literal pain point - our founder and her daughter both suffer from chronic pain. They turned to mindfulness to cope with stress and improve their physical health, but traditional sitting and meditation cushions aggravated their discomfort! Julia created the first mello{be} cushion as the solution. With use, her posture improved, flexibility and core strength increased, and well-being soared. She knew mello{be} had to be shared. This campaign is our chance to share our product with a broader audience, and raise funds for new production.

Our vision is to enable mindfulness in your everyday life, and increase connection with yourself, the people in your life, and the world around you.

 

    Made in Texas for comfort, posture, & style

    • Comfort: Our crescent design distributes and supports your body weight, while buckwheat hull filling provides support that conforms to your unique body shape. Simply lift your cushion to shift the filling and adjust support. You'll continue to feel comfortable with evenly distributed, adjustable support.
    • Posture: An angled foam insert at the cushion’s center actively engages your body by opening your hips, straightening your back, and relaxing your shoulders, improving flexibility and increasing core strength. With use, you will find your posture has improved even when not sitting on the cushion!
    • Style: Hand-sewn, machine washable covers come in a range of colors, textures, and patterns to handle frequent use and match your style. We use durable canvas and upholstery materials so your cushion can be used indoors/outdoors and maintain its beauty.

    What are the benefits of sitting in a mello{be}?

    • Improve posture and balance, increase flexibility, and build core strength through active seating!
    • Reduce stress and anxiety while promoting calm and happiness!
    • Versatility! Perfect for meditation, picnics, camping, comfort during pregnancy, playing videogames, and more. How will you use it?

    • "Destroyer of excuses"- a daily reminder to take time for yourself, whether through meditation or simply engaging your body by sitting in a healthier posture.   

     

    Early wins!

    • You can now find mello{be} cushions in West Elm stores across Texas! We are thrilled to be featured in the West Elm Local line, and hope to advance to regional and national distribution in the future.
    • We were at South by Southwest conference, partnering with the amazing Peace Box: Mindfulness on the Move!
    • mello{be} got started by winning "Crowd Favorite" in a San Antonio startup weekend in 2017!
    • We were featured in Spirituality & Health magazine and will be in Mindful Magazine this summer!
    • Over 30 5-Star Reviews!

    The people love it - 5 Star Reviews!

    • 5 stars: "I love my mello{be} cushion! The shape of the foam insert and overall shape provide the support needed to sit comfortable in meditation." 
    • 5 stars: "Straight up amazing! Perfect for using it outdoors, and it's quite durable too! Would highly recommend!" 
    • 5 stars: "Adds energy and clarity to my practice. It's one of the best cushions that I've found for posture and lower back support. The shape does a great job of raising the hips above the knees and allowing the spine to lengthen." 
    • 5 stars: "Great for the living room, especially for mindful snacks with friends around the coffee table."
    • 5 stars: "Love using the cushion when I’m playing with my bunny. 11/10 for how comfy it is!”
    • 5 stars: "My mello{be} cushion has served most importantly, as my destroyer of excuses. Every time I see my cushion, I’m instantly reminded to meditate. The comfort minimizes pain and discomfort. I strongly recommend this product to anyone trying to find a bit of peace in this chaotic world.”

    Check out more reviews on Facebook and Google!

     

    The Dynamic Duo!

    Julia Bates, Founder & CEO, is a Registered Nurse, certified mindfulness coach, founder of Mindful in Life and Work meditation, and proud mother of two. She is passionate about inspiring people to change their lives through education, mindfulness, and stress reduction. mello{be} is the natural union of her career background, personal life, and passions!

    Dimitri Antoniou, Co-Founder & COO, is an aspiring entrepreneur and Venture for America fellow. A Boston native, he graduated from the University of Pennsylvania with a BA in Urban Studies and moved to San Antonio to work in a startup as part of his VFA fellowship. 

    Together, we're a dynamic duo on a mission! At first glance we might make an odd pair, but damn do we work well together! We met over a year before we joined forces on mello{be}, and quickly bonded over Boston, mindfulness, and a common kindred spirited-ness.

    We're incredibly thankful to our friends, families, Geekdom members, Venture for America community, and everyone else who has helped along this journey.

     

      Where is it going?

      We're young and hungry, but we can't spread mindfulness without your support! Now that we've picked up some momentum, we are seeking to scale by developing new retail partnerships and expanding our e-commerce presence. Those goals require a lot of working capital for new production and marketing! Everything coming in from this campaign is going back in to help grow the business. 

      • Explore new manufacturing options and create prototypes to cut production costs
      • Fund additional production runs for new retail partnerships and online inventory
      • Build a marketing budget to build website traffic and increase online sales

      How can you help?

      We really value the mello{be} community, and would love for you to join our mission. Here's how you can help!

      • Contribute directly to the campaign above
      • Share this campaign page with friends, family and co-workers! Share this link!
      • Like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram
      • Subscribe to our newsletter

      We hope you join the mello{movement}, and thank you for your support!

story:
I have made a difference. I am making a difference. I am going to make a difference. I am a Girl Scout. 

We are the Camp Counselors of Camp Timber Trails in Toland, MA, and Camp Candlewood in New Fairfield, CT, and one thing we love more than our camps, are our campers! We are girl scouts, girl guides, friends, sisters, brothers, leaders, mothers, fathers, mentors, hero's, and professional role models. Our staff represent every corner of the world. Flying in from across the country, across the globe, and down the road, we are the most diverse family and support system around. 

 

This year, we have put our heads together and decided that we want to give back to the talented and inspirational people who come into our lives, and change us forever. Campers. These beautiful individuals come into our lives with smiles, positivity, love and life, and they support us as much as we support them. Thats why we need your help! A vast majority of our campers rely on donations and sponsorship from the community to get them to camp. 

 

On behalf of us, the hero's and professional role models to girl ages 7-17, we ask you: Will you be our hero?

 

 

 

It starts with you!

As a thank you for being apart of our cause to make sure every Girl Scout gets to go to camp, we hope you accept these gifts from us to you, as a thank you for your donations and support!

 

 

 

For every donation of 5$ or more: You will receive a personal  thank you card from an international staff member and a photo of a gorgeous moment at camp!

 

For every donation of 10$ or more: You will receive a hand made friendship bracelet from one of our staff members, a  personal  thank you card from an international staff member and a photo of a gorgeous moment at camp!

 

For every donation of 20$ or more:  You will receive a camp patch from one of our camps, a hand made friendship bracelet from one of our staff members, a  personal  thank you card from an international staff member and a photo of a gorgeous moment at camp!

 

For every donation of 50$ or more: You will receive a hoodie from one of our camps, a camp patch from one of our camps, a hand made friendship bracelet from one of our staff members, a  personal  thank you card from an international staff member and a photo of a gorgeous moment at camp!

 

For every donation of 100$ or more: You will receive the matching sweatpants and hoodie set from one of our camps, a camp patch from one of our camps, a hand made friendship bracelet from one of our staff members, a  personal  thank you card from an international staff member and a photo of a gorgeous moment at camp!

 

 

For every donation of 250$ or more: You will receive a Camp Staff Shirt, matching sweatpants and hoodie set from one of our camps, a camp patch from one of our camps, a hand made friendship bracelet from one of our staff members, a  personal  thank you card from an international staff member and a photo of a gorgeous moment at camp!

 

 

 

 

 

 

For every donation of 350$ or more: You will get a personalized stepping stone placed at one of our camps, Camp Staff Shirt, matching sweatpants and hoodie set from one of our camps, a camp patch from one of our camps, a hand made friendship bracelet from one of our staff members, a  personal  thank you card from an international staff member and a photo of a gorgeous moment at camp!

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Get the word out and help our campaign make the splash that it needs to make our goal!

Use the Indiegogo share tool to share us on one of your social network pages!

Support the girl scouts of Connecticut by volunteering your time and check out their website at www.gsofct.org

story:
Einick Gitelman was a remarkable man, who left a huge imprint during his memorable life. He treated a stranger as a friend and a friend as a best friend. A man of many traits and willing to help anyone in need; he was most happy when given the opportunity to aid someone. His smile and love of life that he shared with everyone he encountered has left us precious memories. 

                                       

Einick was tragically killed on November 11th, 2011.In memory of Einick, we would like to invite you join us for a fun filled day of hockey and excitement at the First annual Einick Gitelman Fund Hockey Tournament that will take place at the Bill Durnam arena at 4988 Rue Vézina, Montréal. All the proceeds of this year's event will go to NDG Minor Hockey. The object is to raise funds for NDG Minor Hockey in order to help boys and girls who cannot afford hockey equipment or fees to play hockey: the sport that Einick so loved. 

There will be door prizes, raffles , music, food , and even a silent auction, so bring the whole family and come out and enjoy some good old fashioned friendly hockey. Can't wait to see you all there!!

Einick started playing in NDG Minor hockey at the young age of five in pre-novice, continuing right through to the Hurricanes Midget BB. His love for hockey was rooted in him and he continued playing hockey and coaching throughout his short adult life. We thank you for considering your sponsorship to this special fund raising opportunity in memory of Einick…. 



What We Need & What You Get:

PLATINUM $1,750 (Exclusive sponsorship) 

  •  Visibility of company name on all team jerseys 
  •  Your company banner at arena entrance 
  •  Your company name at auction room entrance 
  • Visibility on official program (main page) 
  •  Visibility on our Facebook home page 
  • 4 VIP after party passes

GOLD $750 (4 Sponsorship Opportunities) 

  • One of 4 teams named after your company 
  • Company name on one of 4 team’s jersey 
  • One of 4 company names on banners at arena entrance in large visible print 
  • Visibility on official program (full page ad) 
  • Visibility on our Facebook home page
  • 2 VIP after party passes

SILVER $ 300 (Unlimited Sponsorship) 

  • Company logo or name on banner (6 per banner) 
  • Visibility on official program (full page ad) 
  • Visibility on our Facebook home page 
  • 2 VIP after party passes

BRONZE PLUS $250 (2 Limited Sponsorship) 

  • First page or back cover official program (full page ad) 
  • Visibility on our Facebook home page 
  • VIP after party pass

BRONZE $150 (Unlimited Sponsorship)

  • Visibility on official program (full page ad) 
  • Visibility on our Facebook home page
  • VIP after party pass
ROOKIE PLUS $75 (Unlimited Sponsorship)
  • Visibility on official program (half page ad) 
  • Visibility on our Facebook home page 

Rookie $40 (Unlimited Sponsorship)

  • Visibility on official program (business card) 
  • Visibility on our Facebook home page 

Player $20 (Unlimited Sponsorship)

  • Visibility on our Facebook home page 


The Impact

NDG Minor League Hockey is an outstanding way to help teach kids positive, healthy lifestyles including: teamwork, exercise, sportsmanship, and strategy. Learn more at http://www.ndghockey.ca and http://einickgitelmanfund.org/

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign and help contribute to continue to make hockey available to all kids.

story:
Summary

Trinity's story is very similar to Meamya's as child. Friends and family members frequently talk about how challenging it was to provide care for her as a severe asthmatic child. As creator of the m.AE concept, she has both the caregiver and asthma sufferer in mind.  Meamya is an active volunteer with The American Lung Association where she promotes the Open Airways for Schools  program. " In the completed version of m.AE, I hope to see programs like Open Airways for Schools listed in all of the local directories as a resource".

 

Why Mobile Asthma Education/Local Directory?

In a recent report by Pew Internet Research, 39% of U.S adults are caregivers and many navigate health care with the help of technology, four in 10 adults are caring for an adult or child with significant health issues. When surveyed, 59% percent said online sources were helpful to their ability to provide care.

m.AE provides one touch access to local resources and asthma education by Certified Asthma Educators.  

 

With your contribution to this campaign, you will help us Develop, Consult, & Create

Contributions will be used to:

(1) Develop the free resource for caregivers and people with asthma that includes: a mobile website, app, and local resources directory.

(2) consult with a team to create a working prototype of the corresponding personal health monitoring device.

(3) create visual media and marketing collateral that will enable us to communicate the concept to future stakeholders such as: schools, healthcare providers, medical supply companies, and health and wellness vendors.

 

 

 

(sample)

 

Our goal is to serve as a free mobile resource for caregivers as an effort to help reduce hospital re-admissions caused by asthma attacks.

 

How it Works?

 

 

Remote Health Monitoring Unit and Personal Asthma Management

Advanced features of the app will be available to users of the integrated mobile device. These features will include:

1. Convenient access to a digital asthma actions plan

2. The ability to manage medications with one touch refill/pharmacy  

3. Appointments calendar with one-touch scheduling

4. Remote monitoring of indoor air-quality w/ text alerts 

5. Ability to monitor and record sp02 levels

6. Text reminders

 

Some Quick Facts:

 

Asthma is one of the leading causes of school absenteeism;in 2008, asthma accounted for an estimated 14.4 million lost school days in children with an asthma attack in the previous year

 

 

 

 

Even if we do not reach our entire goal of $20,000. We will continue to develop this concept with the resources provided. Regular updates will be provided about the project on our website. All contributors will receive quarterly updates by email.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are using this campaign to help build our directory, so please like this campaign and share it with any one you think would be interested in helping move us along.

 

Sources:  

American Lung Association: Asthma and Children Fact Sheet, accessed on August 15, 2013 from website at: http://www.lung.org/lung-disease/asthma/resources/facts-and-figures/asthma-children-fact-sheet.html

Family Caregivers are Wired for Health, by PEW
Internet Research. June 20, 1013. Available at: http://www.pewinternet.org/Press-Releases/2013/Family-Caregivers-are-Wired-for-Health.aspx

Contributions will be used to:
(1) Develop the free resource for caregivers and people with asthma that includes: a mobile website, app, and local resources directory. 
(2) consult with a team to create a working prototype of the corresponding personal health monitoring device.
(3) create visual media and marketing collateral that will enable us to communicate the concept to future stakeholders such as: schools, healthcare providers, medical supply companies, and health and wellness vendors.
 

 
 
(sample)

 
Our goal is to serve as a free mobile resource for caregivers as an effort to help reduce hospital re-admissions caused by asthma attacks. 
 
How it Works? 

 
 
Remote Health Monitoring Unit and Personal Asthma Management 
Advanced features of the app will be available to users of the integrated mobile device. These features will include: 
1. Convenient access to a digital asthma actions plan 
2. The ability to manage medications with one touch refill/pharmacy  
3. Appointments calendar with one-touch scheduling
4. Remote monitoring of indoor air-quality w/ text alerts 
5. Ability to monitor and record sp02 levels 
6. Text reminders 
 
Some Quick Facts:
 
Asthma is one of the leading causes of school absenteeism;in 2008, asthma accounted for an estimated 14.4 million lost school days in children with an asthma attack in the previous year
 
 
 

 
Even if we do not reach our entire goal of $20,000. We will continue to develop this concept with the resources provided. Regular updates will be provided about the project on our website. All contributors will receive quarterly updates by email.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
We are using this campaign to help build our directory, so please like this campaign and share it with any one you think would be interested in helping move us along. 
 
Sources:  
American Lung Association: Asthma and Children Fact Sheet, accessed on August 15, 2013 from website at: http://www.lung.org/lung-disease/asthma/resources/facts-and-figures/asthma-children-fact-sheet.html
Family Caregivers are Wired for Health, by PEWInternet Research. June 20, 1013. Available at: http://www.pewinternet.org/Press-Releases/2013/Family-Caregivers-are-Wired-for-Health.aspx

story:
Our Story

Our Story began with a Father of four daughters and Grandfather of three. They inspired him to research healthier snack alternatives.

Taking a look at the junk food that had spread to epidemic levels throughout the schools, it was alarming to find the number of ingredients in processed food that is nowhere near being healthy. Ingredients such as sugar, glucose, fructose, gelatin, artificial flavour and colour.  

One of the largest culprits found was refined sugar. 

Over the last 5 years many studies have proven a distinct link between sugar consumption and obesity, type II diabetes, heart disease, stroke, and certain types of cancers. In September 2011, the Province of Ontario implemented new nutritional guidelines that were to be introduced in the school systems that encouraged healthier eating. This soon expanded across many other provinces in Canada as well into the United States.

So we began researching ingredients that would replace the unhealthy ones in traditional snacks. This became quite the challenge as albeit the product maybe healthier, it still has to taste good!

 

Where better to start than the conventional marshmallow square? These treats were sold everywhere and a favourite for many children (and adults!) through the last several decades, but they were unhealthy and therefore no longer allowed in schools. The quest was not to re-invent marshmallow squares, but to make them healthier. 

We found Xylitol, a natural sweetener, to replace sugar. Brown rice to replace the traditional white rice. We were able to make them gluten free, peanut free, low in sodium and safe for diabetics. The end product is something that we certainly love to eat, and are proud to call it the healthiest marshmallow square. 

 

Our next step is to make Rice Delites available to everyone as a healthier snack option. This is where you come in!

What is the money for?

The money we are raising will allow Rice Delites to begin our first production run, including ingredients, packaging, shipping costs, and other related fees. The purchase of inventory will ensure prompt delivery to our customers.

The money will also fund the marketing and promotional campaign.For Rice Delites to be able to become a household name, it will require a fair amount of marketing and consumer education about the benefits of Rice Delites and its ingredients.  We want people to know that this product is available in stores, how good it tastes, and how much better it is than the traditional sugar-loaded marshmallow squares. We also want to be transparent about the ingredients that go into our product, so consumers can make an informed decision regarding the purchase of a healthier snack food.

What's In It?

  Ingredients:

  Brown Rice

  Polyglycitol

  Xylitol

  Isomalt

  Water

  Coconut Oil

  Glycerin

  Agar

  Egg White Powder (dried egg, albumen, yeast, citric acid)

  Natural Flavor

  Sunflower Oil

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford to donate, but still want to help? There is still a lot you can do!

Share our campaign with your friends and family and on your facebook pages.

Join us on facebook and twitter to promote healthier snacks!

story:
Is Snoring Ruining Your Life?

Are you ready for the comfortable, convenient, and inexpensive solution?

Snorelax stops snoring before it can happen by providing jaw support keeping your airway open so you can breathe easy. It’s so comfortable, you won't even notice it.

With Snorelax, you'll wake up feeling better. Your partner will wake up happy. And you won't become a snoring statistic (1 in 4 couples sleep apart and snoring is the #3 cause of divorce in the U.S.) 

65 years of combined medical experience went into creating Snorelax. Our founding Medical Doctors created the perfect way to wake up refreshed. Every morning. Their revolutionary design is patent pending.

The Buzz

How We're Different (It's Comfortable!)

Snoring solutions abound. So what makes Snorelax different?

  • Comfortable - Snorelax are easy to apply and comfortable to wear – and they're quick and painless to remove. No pulling your beard, no sticky adhesive on your skin. It’s the most comfortable solution on the market today.
  • Non-invasive -From mouth guards to tongue suction devices, invasive snoring solutions are everywhere. Snorelax is gently applied to the face, not in your mouth or up your nose so there is nothing to fall out during the night. It also doesn’t hurt. 
  • Helps you Breathe - Not all solutions are created equal. Snorelax not only stops your snoring, but improves your breathing during sleep.  (Exploding pillow anyone?)

 

Beard Friendly!

Wear Snorelax, comfortably, with or without a beard.  They won't pull your facial hair and stay on all-night while wearing them.  Watch our brief video below, about applying Snorelax, wearing them with a beard, and removing them.
 

 

 

Easy-to-Use

Snorelax comes with a scored backing which makes it easy to peel and apply. The graphic indicators make placement easy and it's organic shape fits perfectly to the contour of your face.

Why Snorelax?

Did you know you’re not alone? 64% of people say that their partner snores. Like many snoring sufferers, you and your partner may have tried some crazy gadgets, chin straps, nose plugs, and mouth-guards.

Snorelax is different. They’re non-invasive, comfortable and effective from the moment you apply them. You can move your mouth freely, but when you relax they hold your jaw in place. You can sleep in any position you like, and Snorelax stays on all-night long.

Improve Your Health, for Good!

According to Harvard Medical School* snoring can actually lead to death.

Stroke, Heart Attack, and Dementia can be related to snoring and airway obstruction.  Even the non-fatal consequences are nothing to mess around with: headaches, low sex drive, obesity, anxiety, depression and more.

Snorelax are easy-to-use and can greatly improve your health and quality of life. We’ve designed them to be high quality,yet inexpensive, so everyone can afford to improve their health.

Save your Relationship

 

If you’re the partner of someone who snores, you won’t be surprised to find out that snoring is the #3 cause of Divorce in the U.S. It goes beyond annoying, it’s disruptive and causes 1 out of 4 couples to sleep apart.

We’re here to help. Your partner will stop snoring and you'll love the quiet. Plus, check out our reward packages for the deep sleep mask and the meditation cards. It’s a way for you and your partner to reconnect and relax together. Bring on the bliss.

Wake Up with Energy

 

There isn’t enough coffee in the world to make up for a bad night’s sleep. Snoring leaves you exhausted and sluggish. With Snorelax you’ll wake up in the morning feeling happier, more refreshed, and ready to tackle the day.

How it Works

Snoring is more than just noise. The noise is annoying and stops you and your partner from getting the restful sleep you need. But, when you snore, a lot of other bad things are happening inside of you.

If you snore, it means you’re not getting enough air. When you sleep your muscles relax and your jaw drops back, obstructing your airway. The abnormal airflow causes turbulence and vibration which is heard as snoring.

If you are a snorer, your heart, brain, and other vital organs are not getting the air they need. Snoring is our body’s siren indicating that something is terribly wrong; don’t ignore it!

Snorelax doesn’t just stop the sound of snoring, it solves the problem. Snorelax comfortably supports your jaw so you can breathe better and sleep in any position. They improve your sleep quality and enhance your next day's performance. Snorelax gently adheres to your skin and is beard friendly.

Our Technology

Snorelax utilizes a unique patent-pending technology to eliminate snoring. Years of research and testing went into the development of Snorelax. (Our team has tried dozens of other “snoring solutions” over the years, only to leave them under the sink collecting dust). The result of all of our work is a rigorously tested product that gives instant snoring relief.

Share Snorelax

Our rewards are designed to improve your health and relationship and thank you for your support. 
 
Whether or not you can financially contribute to our campaign, one of the best ways to support us is through social sharing.  Please share Snorelax with your friends and network by clicking on any of the links below.
 

Let's Talk About Rewards

We've created several rewards for all to enjoy.  Whether you are buying for yourself, your partner, or as a gift - our rewards will fit almost any need. If you have a specific request, please message us.  Our team is standing by to help.

When Will We Ship?

We’re excited to announce that ALL ORDERS will begin shipping within 3 months from the end of this campaign. When you back this project, you’ll be provided with shipping rates for your home country. We are headquartered in the United States. Please note that if you live outside of the U.S., you may be responsible for local duties, fees, and taxes. 

Our Story

Snorelax fulfills the personal quest of our founding team of Medical Doctors to end snoring.

Unhappy with existing treatments and products, they decided to create their own solution for snoring.

It had to be comfortable, easy to use and produce fast results. All at an affordable price.

Along the way, they gave prototypes and samples to their friends to test. People kept asking for more, saying it was saving their marriages and improving their quality of life.

Years of innovation and testing later, Snorelax was perfected.

Our founders refined their prototypes to the Snorelax you see today: soft yet strong; slim yet stable; comfortable yet effective in eliminating snoring.

Kickstarter will enable us to reach the minimum order quantity required and produce the first commercial run of Snorelax. We need your help. 

Timeline

We’ve self-funded the technology, design, development, and testing for Snorelax. Every dollar pledged will go towards manufacturing, quality assurance, and packaging. 
 


FAQ

We're standing by to answer your questions, but here are some of the most common inquiries we receive:

I have facial hair.  Will Snorelax still work?

  • Yes!  Snorelax works on all faces, with or without facial hair.  We do not recommend using Snorelax if your facial hair is longer than 1 inch, but rest assured that our R&D is aggressively working on creating a version intended for long facial hair.

Does it pull on the skin...is that what it's doing?

  • Definitely NOT.  Snorelax adhesive is created with sensitive skin in mind, as not made with natural rubber latex.  Snorelax adheres to the skin, comfortably, and keeps your jaw from dropping when your muscles relax.  Your skin will not feel a pull or tightening when wearing Snorelax.  Our adhesive is intended for long-term wear.

Do you have other colors?

  • We sure do.  Snorelax comes in Midnight Black and Tan.  Who knows, we might even be able to offer Snorelax in clear!

Does it work for both men and women?

  • Absolutely!  Snorelax works for anyone.

Will Snorelax work if I have been diagnosed with Sleep Apnea?

  • Snorelax does not cure or treat Sleep Apnea.  Snorelax improves breathing by preventing obstruction from your jaw dropping.  Please consult your physician for Sleep Apnea treatments.
* https://www.health.harvard.edu/blog/snored-to-d...
