story_txt:
It's time for a positive Change
IMAGINE THE POSITIVE CLIMATE CHANGE possible by
using DCARBON on millions of vehicles WORLDWIDE, thereby creating less toxic
pollutants such as hydrocarbons (HC), carbon monoxide (CO) and nitrogen oxides
(NOx).
This can be initiated by creating a GLOBAL grassroots
movement of up to 5,000 motor vehicles owners/leasers who will become
active SMOG BUSTERS by making their own motor vehicles environmentally
friendly.
The worldwide motor vehicle fleet will take at least
15-20 years to change and become 100% ECO-Responsible…we should and can do something NOW
to improve AIR Quality.
September 21, 2014, lot of peoples took to the
streets calling for climate action…more than on any other day in history. From New York City to Rio, London
to Delhi – they
were everywhere.


From now on, more world leaders will gather to talk about
climate action than ever before. They’ll be gather with the knowledge that more
people than ever are demanding action, not just words, and that their political
future is on the line -- as well as the future of the planet.
The 2014 launch phase is
to manufacture a massive quantity of DCarbon products and to provide FREE
DCarbon units for gasoline motor vehicles (cars and small trucks) of less than 6 liter
capacity to the DCarbon Campaign participants, based on the contribution rules described
on the indiegogo site. This will be done in order to create a global group
of 5,000 users who will have made their vehicle more eco-responsible, and
who will be able to testify and demonstrate that it is really possible
to improve the AIR quality emitted by exhaust pipes of Gas Engine vehicles using the DCarbon
product. 
OUR promise is that the
emissions that cause serious health problems for humans which are caused by
the incomplete combustion of fuels while producing HC (unburned hydrocarbons),
CO (carbon monoxide) and NOx (nitrogen oxides) are reduced or completely
removed at the exhaust pipes of the gas engine vehicles by an improvement
of the fuel combustion by using DCarbon.
We have obtained
scientific proof and passed many tests which confirm that the DCarbon product is safe for
humans and improves AIR quality at the exhaust pipe of Gas engine vehicles.

Go to the www.dcarbondevice.com to learn more about our test results.
One of the professionals
who support this technology is the Canadian engineer Mark Porringa,www.zeroptech.com, He describes the
technology behind the DCarbon product as a scientific and technological
revolution equivalent to the discovery of electricity almost 100 years
ago. 




The DCarbon product is
VERY easy to install yourself, it does not create any electrical or electronic interference and its
10 year + lifetime enables it to be reinstalled on other engines of the same
type.






Today we want to take another step forward... Bring
this product to the world stage so that the population itself can, by reducing
costs through mass production of DCarbon, improve AIR quality for
EVERYONE. 
Today the technology that supports DCarbon is
protected in 183 countries by the copyright system www.usdsystem.com.









Potential impact
Air pollution created by
more than 1 billion vehicles is a global curse that affects the health of all the
world's inhabitants. 
Knowing that worldwide vehicle fleet will take at
least 15-20 years to change and become 100% ECO-Responsible…What can we do
collectively NOW.
TOGETHER we can MAKE
A POSITIVE CLIMATE CHANGE by using the DCarbon technology on millions of vehicles WORLDWIDE and therefore
producing less toxic pollutants like HC, CO, and
NOx!


To illustrate the
fantastic potential of the DCarbon product to reduce the emissions of toxic and mortal Carbon Monoxide (CO) emissions,
we will use as an example a City where 1 million gas engine vehicles are
in circulation, each covering an average of 10,000 miles a year.




Based on EPA (Environmental
Protection Agency) records, in 1950’s, the emission standard for carbon
monoxide (CO) was 87 gram per miles. In comparison from 2015-2019 the future
USA California emission standard is at a maximum
of 3.4 grams per mile (during a vehicle lifetime of 50,000 miles?). 
Using this most recent
legal limit for Carbon Monoxide (CO) in our city of 1 million gas engine
vehicles, this group will emit 34 millions kilograms of toxic and mortal CO
in the AIR per year, and up to 170 millions kilograms over 5 years. WE
CAN DEFINITELY have a better life WITHOUT THIS! 






With DCarbon on millions of vehicles
WORLDWIDE we can…MAKE A POSITIVE CLIMATE CHANGE with less HC, CO, and NOx !





What we need
 We need a lot more
than money…We need your implication for a positive climate change by sharing,
promoting and advertising the DCarbon project



We are presenting here,
a funding request for up to $ 1 million Canadian. 
This project will allow us
to achieve two key (2) objectives:
• Create a worldwide
community of passionate people committed to promote and use the DCarbon product
for AIR quality improvement.
• Raise sufficient funds 
for mass production of the DCarbon product at the lowest possible price


Funds raised will be
used to achieve the following key project milestones
Manufacture and
distribution of the 5,000 units of the DCarbon product at the lowest cost (92.5%
of budget)
Setting deployment and website
operation to ensure effective communication with contributors 
Management and automation of the
DCarbon manufacturing processes for mass production 
Management, manufacturing,
packaging, storage and distribution of up to 50,000 FREE DCarbon units 
Logistics support for
installation and troubleshooting (7.5% of budget)
Website and user feedback
management system
Professional videos for easy
installation on gas engines 
Set up of a technical support
team and operations 5 days a week, for users. (website, blog) 
Administration of the entire
project. 
If we obtain LESS or MORE money than the goal of $1 millions Cdn, we will use these funds to
manufacture and distribute the largest possible number of units while still
pursuing the same DREAM of creating the largest possible grassroots
movement of motor vehicles owners/leasers to become active SMOG BUSTER by
making their own motor vehicle environmentally friendly.




Risks
and Challenges 


The first challenge
     in this project is to reach the largest number of contributors and
     contributions. 

The second challenge
     is to obtain the involvement of the largest possible number of
     contributors to share and promote the DCarbon project worldwide. 

The third challenge
     is to install an excellent Internet tool for all users of the DCarbon
     product to communicate their satisfaction. 

The manufacturing risk has been well managed. Our partner, Keltech inc., who
     participated in the R & D and product design is capable of producing
     50,000 units a month in the second month of operation.What you will get


What you will get
It
is a win-win situation for EVERYONE and the environment.
IMAGINE
A POSITIVE CLIMATE CHANGE with less toxic pollutants like HC, CO, and NOx produced by millions of vehicles WORLDWIDE using
DCarbon!
Contribution
choices:


PERKS
1$ = Smog Buster Helper
PERKS
10$ = Smog Buster Supporter
PERKS
25$ = Aware Smog Buster
PERKS
50$ = Concerned Smog Buster
PERKS
75$ = Active Smog Buster
PERKS
100$ = Committed Smog Buster
PERKS
200$ = Certified Smog Buster
PERKS
1000$ = Level I Smog Buster promoter
PERKS
5000$ = Level II Smog Buster promoter
PERKS
10000$ = Level III Smog Buster promoter



We hope that DCarbon users will demonstrate their pride for their ECO-ACTION by using this type of
sticker on their vehicle. 

We will launch a request
among Indiegogo contributors to design the best
sticker or any other way to demonstrate their
pride in improving AIR Quality at gas exhaust pipe …one engine at a time.
Other ways to help 
Click Here to register yourself and share the project on
facebook!  You can also use
Indiegogo sharing tools!

The
pollutant produced by gasoline engines affects us all. All humans have an interest to reduce or eliminate toxic and
deadly pollution produced by internal combustion engines, for themselves and
their children. So, we thank you very much for spreading the word and promoting
this HumanitAIR project.
We want to thank in profound way all
participants and contributors to this  DCarbon project.

AmaYoga, The world's most safe Yoga Tool. Everyone can do yoga at Home. 

Why AmaYoga?

Safe, easy & effective

Safe:  stable with four legs, will no fall down like Yoga Wheel or Ball

Easy: Easy to use, everyone can yoga

 

 

 

 

How to use AmaYoga?

Open your chest

 

Lengthen the spine

Sarvangasa

Viparita

Cross the legs

Relax the lumbar spine  

Halasana

Full assembly in the box ! You can use it once take it out the box.

NO NEED ANY ASSEMBLY FOR YOU. 

 

 

 

Usonic Inc is a team of designer and Yoga Fans. 

  • We invent the AmaYoga after many years Yoga...

  • It is very stable and keep you more safe on Yoga. 

 

Risks & Challenges

20 years supplier make the project with NO risk for the delivery... All your AmaYoga will be shipped out on Nov. 2020

story:
Live healthier. Know what you breathe.

 

PiCO Home is an elegant, personal smart air quality monitor that can tell what's in the air you breathe. It measures dangerous particulates in the air in real-time.

 

Our high-quality sensors provide critical, real-time information about the air quality around you instantly, at a glance and give you recommendations on what you can do to improve the air you breathe.

Unlike traditional air monitors, PiCO Home provides you peace of mind with a combination of high-reliable data, portability, and a low price.

 

 

As demonstrated here, you can see how a change in the environment affects the mobile app, illustrating the performance and integration of PiCO Home's hardware and software. What is seen here are some of the key features and functionality of PiCO Home.

As you can see here, this shows our new molds and injection in our factory. We are excited to bring this to you soon!

 

 

4.3 million people die annually from exposure to household air pollutants. Most perish from stroke (34%), heart disease (26%) and chronic pulmonary disease (22%). Pneumonia and lung cancer account for 12% and 6% of deaths, respectively.

Women and young children, who spend the most time near the domestic hearth, are particularly vulnerable. More than 50% of pneumonia deaths among children under 5 are linked to household air pollution.

 

 

We expect PiCO Home to be used mainly at home (power plug with USB Cables).

Every PiCO Home comes with dedicated USB cables. We provide one USB-C to A to connect to a power plug, USB hub, or a power bank for indoor use such as at home or in the office. We also provide one USB-C to Micro-B, USB-C to C, and USB-C to Lightning each that connect to a smartphone OTG for outdoor use.

Please note that iPhone series DO NOT provide OTG (on-the-go) functions, so we've developed a very special cable for iPhone series, which is USB Type to Lightning that can supply power to PiCO Home.

 

 

 

Step 1: Connect to USB-C cable power supply (to an external battery, plug, or smartphone).

Step 2: Push the power “ON” and launch the mobile app (iOS/Android).

Step 3: PiCO Home will give you an immediate visual reading of your air quality with multi-color LED indicators.

Step 4: Browse further to get more helpful recommendations and tips.

 

 

We’ve listened.

Since launching the 1st generation PiCO, we’ve learned so much. And very humbled by the experience it has taught us. Since then, we have continuously sought ways to make our service and our product better for our backers. Now, it’s time to deliver. In this 2nd generation update, reborn as PiCO Home, we’ve made the following improvements:

  • Added Wi-Fi communication
  • Enhanced accuracy of the temperature, relative humidity, and VOCs
  • Added flash memory for storing air quality data without a network connection
  • Interworks with Amazon’s Alexa
  • Mobile application updates with better UI & UX ( Coming in October )
  • A complete, new, and beautiful redesign of PiCO Home

 

 

1. MEMS Metal-oxide Gas Sensor: MEMS is the industry standard for detecting potentially harmful gases in the air. PiCO senses Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) released by cleaning agents, paints, and carpets, flooring, and even your family! The MEMS sensor picks up any trace of Acetone, methanol, ethanol, and other harmful compounds in the air.

High levels of VOCs in the air can have an impact on general comfort and well-being, as well as taking a toll on cognitive abilities.

The MEMS Metal-oxide Gas sensing element is first class when it comes to real-world application. It has long-term stability and a low drift (meaning 1 will always be 1). It’s also protected against dust and water making it extremely robust and durable.

2. CMOSens® Sensor: When professionals need to measure temperature and humidity, they trust CMOSens®. So do we.

3. Laser Particle Sensor: PiCO's laser-based particle sensor is far more accurate than cheap, dull LED sensors, ensuring accurate measurement of fine dust (PM2.5 and PM10) in the air. These small particles are among the most dangerous and difficult forms of air pollution to protect yourself against. PM2.5 particles (just 0.0025mm in size) are so small they get through most masks and window seals right into your lungs and blood.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

100% Delivery Guarantee and EU-Friendly Delivery

There’s no secret about the challenges involved in delivering bits and atoms, but we know what we are doing. We give you our word and guarantee that every backer will receive a quality product made with skill, dedication and passion.

We're so sure about PiCO Home that we are offering a 100% Delivery Guarantee. If we fail to deliver the rewards for whatever reason, we will reimburse the full amount you pledged on Kickstarter.

 

International backers: PiCO Home will ship worldwide. Please note that you will be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

Estimated delivery: While we do not expect major issues, the estimated shipment date may shift one of two months. We will update backers as soon as shipping dates are confirmed.

Warranty: We are firmly proud of our product. Each PiCO Home includes a 7-day (upon receiving) money back guarantee and a 1-year limited warranty.

Support: Need help? If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach us at cs@brilcom.com.

We will strive to ensure that we deliver to our backers on time.

story:
My name is Irina,I'm from Georgia,Rustavi. I have non-governmental organization "Animals Friends" for more than 7 years. My organization depends on People Charity, but here in my Country there is a lack of supporting People and we always have a bad financial situation.
Right now the organization looks after about 150+ homeless animals and daily we need about 100$ too feed them and treat,but unfortunately sometimes daily we get only 20-30$,that is not enough and thats why we have really bad financial situation.
Despite of this horrible financial situation we coudnt leave this poor Thing in the street. She has her Uterus fell out and she needs a surgery ASAP.
Please,help us raise the money for her surgery and treatment.

And please don't forget to share this with your friends and other dog lovers. 

Bellow is our Facebook link and you can Check our activities:

https://www.facebook.com/TskhoveltaMegobrebi

story:
About Me:

I’m an internal medicine MD with experience in patient care, clinical research, drug safety and medical consulting.  And I’m a mother of 2 teenagers.  Inspired by this background, I saw that using social media would be a great way to reach adolescents with accurate and unbiased health information.  I’ve been slowly building a teen health social network called Real Talk with Dr. Offutt  using input from volunteer advisors and teens.   Even the video you just watched was put together by a high school student!

Here's the evolution of Real Talk with Dr. Offutt  thus far:

                                       


In order to remain relevant, I need to diversify teen input, have more structured help, and broaden Real Talk with Dr. Offutt's reach.  Funding received through this campaign would allow for teen advisors' stipends, expanding teen input, and book writing. 

To continue this work, my funding goal is $10,000: 

                


Why bother and what’s the impact?  

We all know that teens are online and use social media.  Rates of social media use nearly double between the ages of 12 to 13 to more than  80%; and more than half of 7th – 12th graders look online for health information.  By the age of 16, more teens go online for health information than go to their parents.  Thus, there is a huge need to make sure that when teens go online searching for health information they find their way to accurate and unbiased sources.  I have made this my passion.

Do you share my passion and want to help, but don’t have money to contribute?  Remember, any amount, even a single dollar, helps and is appreciated.  And, it would be great if you can share this campaign with others.  Post on your social media!  Email your professional and personal contacts!   Talk it up!  And any ideas that you might have, I’d love if you share them with me.

For more information, and to see how Real Talk with Dr. Offutt  works, click these blue links below to access the website and social media pages directly:

Real Talk with Dr. Offutt

Twitter    Instagram     Tumblr     Pheed 

                                                   Thanks, and here's to #TeenHealth

story:
한글 설명서    ｜    中文简介与讨论

 

What is Officiser?

Officiser is a unique, fun and effective sedentary lifestyle solution for anyone who sit 4+ hours a day. It is an innovative gadget that incorporated the health and productivity benefits of an under-desk exerciser and an ergonomic footrest. And it is also the world's first fitness device that implemented ankle rolling function (patent-pending) which most naturally mimics the walking motion. Officiser is fun and easy to use, and the movements feel as natural as fidgeting. And you can use it at home and in the office, and anywhere you want to.

Officiser is co-designed by SAIDII, Red Dot Design Award Winner, CTL(Changing The Lifestyle) Ltd. and Ryan Cho, Ergonomic Expert. And It Is Vetted By Danahan Clinic.  

 

Product Concept and Engineering

Officiser is designed to be used throughout the day whenever you sit to increase physical activity (Some call it NEAT/NEPA, Non-exercise Activity Thermogenesis/Non-exercise Physical Activity ) and reduce the potential physical inactivity time. That is distinctly different from typical exercisers which you use during the short workout sessions. 

To realise those requirements, Officiser is full of unique technical innovations, including the world’s first zero-gravity glide system and ankle-rolling function. And you will be amazed by how much more physical activity you can gain from using Officiser during the 8 hour work time - the effect is similar to walking 15 to 25 miles a day! And the extra calorie burn is similar to 60+ minutes of intensive gym workout! 

Why "zero-gravity" glide? 

We believe the device that can be used all day have to be intuitive and fun to use. And it also needs to give you a stable upper body so that your normal work productivity won’t be affected by using Officiser. We are inspired by the leg swaying and foot pedaling kids naturally do while they sit by the pool. And we have tested hundreds of rail systems and tension combinations to find the motion that we wanted. Officiser's easy glide feels exactly like pedalling in water or as some testers said, walking on the cloud. It is an enjoyable movement that you don’t want to stop.

Why ankle-rolling? 

The ankle rolling feature not only has its unique physical benefits like stimulating diverse muscle groups and increase joints flexibility, but it also substantially intensified the gliding movements without affecting your upper body posture. Our muscles strain easily from small and repetitive actions. But with ankle-rolling and zero-gravity glide, Officiser offers dynamic movements at a larger range that not only avoid the muscle strains and fatigue, but effectively stretches and strengthens the muscles. 

 

Why Do You Need An Officiser?

Officiser is created to address the problem of insufficient physical activity as a result of prolonged sitting, which is detrimental to our health, regardless of regular exercise ( i.e. moderate to intensive workout for  30-60 minutes a day). In fact, the World Health Organization (WHO) has identified physical inactivity as an independent risk factor for chronic disease development, and it is now the fourth leading cause of death worldwide. (Watch a TED-ed video on the negative effects of sitting)

Physical activity reduces body fat and blood pressure, increases muscle strength and endurance and improves flexibility and posture. And it is not only good for your body, but also helps your brain to stay sharp and energized, it has been scientifically proven to increase focus and memory, improve creativity and decision making, reduce stress and anxiety, and prevent cognitive decline. 

Officiser can help you to stay active while you sit at your desk or sofa, which will:

  • Boost your calorie burn;
  • Improve focus and energy levels;
  • Develop good posture - less strains on neck/back;
  • Strengthen diverse muscle groups and joints;
  • Improve blood circulation;
  • Lessen leg swelling ;
  • Reduce muscle cramps/numbness;
  • Prevent cardiovascular diseases, type II diabetes, and organ damage by reducing time of physical inactivity.

More details in the Features & Benefits section below.

If you are a fidgeter, Officiser will provide you an elegant way to 'fidget' at the office and in the classroom. 

We made Officiser because we found the existing sedentary lifestyle (prolonged sitting) solutions in the market cannot satisfy our needs. Listed below is the comparison between Officiser and some popular workplace solutions (Click here if you cannot see the image clearly). 

 

REWARD OPTIONS

All price listed below is in US Dollars. 

1. Officiser helps you to keep a good posture. 

Officiser helps you to naturally develop better posture while you sit. (Watch a video)  It will prevent you from unhealthy habits like crossing your legs, hunching your back, leaning on one side. And you will unconsciously get into the habit of sitting in the right posture. 

 

2. Officiser boosts your calorie burn by increasing your NEAT (Non-exercise Activity Thermogenesis). (What is NEAT?)

As its name suggest, NEAT is the energy you burn through physical activities other than sport like exercises. And it can account for as little as 15% of energy expenditure in the very sedentary and up to 50% in very active individuals. And it is a critical factor in human obesity and overall health. 

Our test has shown that Officiser can significantly boost your NEAT while you sit. In the test, we tracked two office workers for two weeks during the 8-hour work hours (One week not using Officiser, the other week using Officiser), monitoring their heart rates, oxygen saturation, VCO2, and respiration rate. And we calculated the calorie burn based on the results. 

The graph above shows us the comparison of the average calorie burn in an hour without or with officising. We can see significant increase in calories burnt per hour when officising compared to just sitting. For those two workers we tested, the extra calorie burn per 8 hour work day is equivalent to an hour of intense exercise in the gym (or 1+ hour of jogging). Or, to put it into context, using Officiser is similar to walking 3-5 miles per hour depending on your movement types. 

 

3. Officiser can help you to increase blood circulation, increase focus & energy,  and reduce stress. 

(We used thermocam to track the temperature in different part of the body. The more the dot aligned, the better: it means the body temperature is more evenly distributed and the blood circulation is better.)

Blood circulation is an essential to your health. Better blood circulation means more oxygen and energy to different part of your body, including brain, organs, and extremities. It improves brain performance which helps keep your mind sharp and focused. And it also leads to healthier skin and lower blood pressure. In addition, better blood circulation reduces/prevents numbness in your legs and feet. Learn more about our test and the benefits of good blood circulation, check out this video we made. 

 

4. Officiser can help you stretch, stimulate and relax your muscles.

You can use Officiser to make dynamic moves, which can stimulate muscles on your abs, glutes, legs and lower back. 

A. Gliding Push/Pull 

Effect: improves knee stability and flexibility. 

B. Ankle Stretches and Heel Pull

Effect: strengthen muscles around ankles, increase flexibility of ankles

Using Officiser is as natural as fidgeting. You can go with the flow while you sit and make your own combination of movements. Furthermore, you can also use Officiser to create exercise routine for yourself  (One of our stretch goal is to create a guidebook with exercise recommendation). One exercise move we love is the body rotation, which trains your core muscle and is great for your spine and it relaxes your tight back. 

One more thing, Officiser can be used with shoes or without shoes. Even office ladies with high heels can also use Officiser easily and comfortably. And we provided optional acupressure sole for more stimulation and relaxation for using Officiser without shoes.

 

5. Officiser will help you to reverse leg swelling

Lack of circulation is one of the common reason for lower body swelling. And many people experience leg swelling after sitting or standing for a long periods of time. As Officiser increases circulation, we expect officising will reduce leg swelling. And our test confirmed this belief. In the test, we measured the circumference of left and right calves of an office lady in the morning (9:00am) and noon (1:00pm), and then we gave her the Officiser to use. We can see from the graph above that the circumference is almost back to the morning status after a mere 45 minute of officising.

 

Recognition

Officiser team was selected among thousands to participate the
MIT Global Entrepreneurial Bootcamp

Officiser is currently in WESC, one of the most selective incubators in South Korea

 

As seen on:

The Officiser team is based in Seoul, South Korea with team members/partners in Melbourne, Australia and Beijing, China. 

Media Contact: Jie Min 

Email: jie@officiser.com 

 ----------------

References: papers and articles that we collected.

Short Summary

Phyte Club's mission is to make the best clean cosmetics for sweat + skin featuring pure sandalwood. While sandalwood is well-known in the West for its fragrance, it is known for its skin benefits in India. We used sandalwood masks even as children to make our skin glow. Now you can share this indulgent beauty ritual easily as you sweat in style.

My discovery of pure sandalwood's naturally anti-microbial nature was accidental. A flood in December 2015 took out my friend's entire factory - and the only things to emerge unscathed were the sandalwood logs. Apart from its creamy fragrance and golden color, to realize that it was so resilient was a revelation that made me determined to share its inner beauty with the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

 For your early support we will send you Runpowder with either Shynamite or Peacheekeen with free US shipping for $50. 

Runpowder - a finishing powder lets you sport translucent blemish-blurring coverage. 

Shynamite - a highlighter with coconut oil lets you score a subtle sheen. 

Peacheekeen - a blush with mineral pigments for a natural flush. 

Our products are talc-free and cruelty-free and vegan and start with only 3 mineral ingredients - it's swift, hard-working and clean skincare as makeup for sweaty days. Be Bold. Sweat in Style. 

The Impact

We have spent a year developing Runpowder - you will be trying version 18. We used minimalist formulation to use the least number of ingredients to produce noticeable differences. 

Pure sandal heartwood has been in use for centuries even outside India - it's the secret ingredient of the famed Cyperus powder beloved by the Medici in the 16th century. Because it takes a sandalwood tree 30 years to grow, people usually use essential oils or more often synthetic fragrances. We think you deserve to experience the nuanced bouquet and superlative skin benefits of pure sandalwood.  With each purchase you will be promoting sandalwood cultivation for the future and protect the trees we have now. 

Risks & Challenges

The fact that sandalwood even grows in the wild is a miracle, as it is a hemiparasite that relies on an amenable host tree to form an interconnected root complex called a haustoria and sandal heartwood only develops after 30 years. Wild sandal is the target of poaching and bandits so the oldest wild sandalwood tree left is still pretty young and it's location by a tiger lookout point has preserved it for us. That's the one I'm standing next to! 

Cultivating sandalwood is painstakingly hard as it needs tender attention as a sapling with lentil bushes to grow. After a few years it becomes a hardy tree but then it is more susceptible to theft. It is our hope that an appreciation of the skin benefits of true sandal will spur Indian sandalwood cultivation as it relies on a red loamy soil and a tropical climate to flourish and grow to full size so future generations can continue to enjoy this utterly remarkable tree. Learn more about the farm.

Other Ways You Can Help

We'd love for you to share our campaign and stay in touch with Phyte Club  - follow us on Instagram on this mission to share this wonderful ingredient and grow sandalwood trees for the future. Go to Phyteclub.com for the latest. Or email us info@phyteclub.com. Thank you!

Who Are We?

Hello Everyone!

My name is Jonathan and I am a student. My sister Faith and I are using this forum to tell you about our mother, Shelly Ann, a very hardworking, kind and caring parent. Although a single parent for many years, we have never been placed at a disadvantage, as our mom has continually provided and supported us to the best of her ability. Our Mother’s illness has taught us very a very important and valuable lesson, and that is we must never take anything for granted, count our blessings each day, and to be more mindful and supportive of people going through difficult times and situations.

What Is The Purpose Of Raising Funds?

Our mom sustained an injury to her back (job related) in the month of June, 2008, and continues to suffer to this day. My mother has always been passionate about helping people and misses that the most as she has been away from her job since January 2012.  Her job requires extended periods of standing, sitting and travelling long distances at times.  The rigors of the job have caused her back to further deteriorate, and she would at times live on painkillers to see her through her many pain filled days.

In 2010 after experiencing months of excruciating pain she again visited her Doctor who advised that she have a MRI done. After viewing the MRI the doctor recommended six months of Physiotherapy and Aqua therapy.  However, these types of therapy did not work. Her situation worsened considerably and she was referred to a neurosurgeon.

This injury has been progressive in nature, and our mother has been unable to stand or sit down for any extended period, even when lying down she is still in a lot of pain. This has negatively impacted her ability to perform simple household chores, as well as work and also provide adequate support for her children as well as herself.

Diagnosis

As a result of the condition she constantly has excruciating neck and back pains with paresthesia to the right C 5 DERMATOME and also left and right leg radiation. Her doctor informed her that she is a candidate for L4-L5 and L5-S1 discectomy, laminectomy and interbody cages with pedicle screw fixation.

The MRI scans were done of her Lumbar and Cervical spine shows:

  • C 3-4 level posterior central/left paracentral and left foraminal disc bulge causing mild narrowing of spinal canal and left neural foramen
  • C 4-5 level posterior central disc herniation and left facet arthropathy causing mild narrowing of the spinal canal
  • C 5-6 level mild disc bulge and left facet arthropathy causing mild narrowing of the spinal canal
  • C 6-7 level diffuse disc bulge and mild narrowing of the spinal canal and bilateral neural foramina (left>right)
  • L1 -2 and L2-3 mild ligamentum flavum hypertrophy causing mild narrowing of the spinal canal
  • L3 -4 level mild diffuse disc bulge with ligamentum flavum hypertrophy and facet arthropathy causing mild narrowing of the spinal canal and bilateral neural foramina
  • L4-5 level diffuse disc bulge with propensity to the left and ligamentum flavum and facet hypertrophy causing moderate narrowing of spinal canal and left neural foramen and mild narrowing of right neural foramen
  • L5-S1 level diffuse disc bulge with posterior broad based disc herniation(17mm TS x 5mm AP) and ligamentum flavum and facet hypertrophy causing severe narrowing of spinal canal with impingement of bilateral S1 traversing nerve roots and moderate narrowing of bilateral neural foramina.

What would your contributions used for?

Due to the fact that many patients continually suffer, or can sometimes and end up in a worse situation than they were in before after undergoing even what is considered at times to be minor surgeries, my mother is fearful to have this intricate and delicate surgery performed on her back in our country, (especially with the complexities now associated with her back) and would prefer to have this operation performed by Medical Experts with proven track records in this field in the USA. To be followed by whatever recommendations made to assist in her recovery and healing process.

My Mom does not have insurance or any personal savings to afford this type of major operation, research has shown that estimated cost of surgery and other miscellaneous expenses would cost $250,000 and more, plus already the lost of wages is a major cost to the family. Whatever small contributions you can make would be greatly appreciated.

The breakdown for the estimated expenses is as follows:

Titanium Implants: $130,000 

Surgeons Fee: $35,000

Hospital Stay: $25,000

Rehabilitation: $20,000

US Travel & Accomodation: $20,000

Medications and possible post-surgery complications ($Unknown)

 

This surgery and recovery period will definitely be physically taxing and extremely expensive to our family. My mother experiences excruciating pain twenty four hours daily, and has severe nerve damage to both her hands and her feet. The longer our mother remains in this condition the greater the risk her being unable to continue to support her family. This has become very heart wrenching and distressing to my sister and I, as we go through the trauma of seeing her endure this pain on a daily basis. We just want to have our mom back to good health, and not see her suffer so much anymore.

We are seeking all the assistance that we can get and will accept any small contribution or donation, this will be very much appreciated by our family, and we thank you in advance for your financial assistance and heartfelt generosities. We are also very grateful to Indiegogo for affording us this opportunity, to use this forum for our fund raising venture. We sincerely thank all for taking the time to read of our plight, for your support and contributions.

Other Ways You Can Assist...

We are aware that all around the world people are facing tough economic times, and it’s understandable that everyone won’t be able to contribute to our cause. If you are unable to contribute we would appreciate it very much if you can spread our campaign via facebook, twitter and any other social media site that you may be a member of. Your efforts will be greatly appreciated.

 

__________________________UPDATE#1_____________________________

We would like to sincely thank our first set of contribitors! Please be on the lookout for more interesting, informative and exciting digital perks...

story:
PLEASE HELP LUIS IN CONTINUING TO HEAL !!!

Luis is a 55 yr. old father of four, that has worked hard to be a example of hope and love to his family, as well as all those he comes in contact with.  He has dedicated his life to the service of others. He is a powerful non-profit motivational speaker and has a true heart towards humanity.

Luis has been battling guillian - barre syndrome,  cancer and peripheral neuropathy since 1996. His ability to endure is a testament of his love of life. 

A few years ago, after the cancer returned for the third time, he began to seek out holistic medicine and treatments.  His body is unable to survive anymore of what western medicine is able to offer.

One year ago, Luis had the opportunity to explore a treatment that is being conducted in other countries, that has had a success rate in curing cancer, aids, and a wide range of other diseases.

It was remarkable to see how his health rebounded.  His blood work and counts were rising back to normal. The medical profession was astounded.

We are seeking $7,000 in funding for the purpose of obtaining two machines and the mineral solutions and supplements needed to continue his healing.  This treatment needs to be performed on a daily basis.

One of the machines is a detoxification, used to draw all toxins and impurities from the body.  The other is a beam ray machine, that utilizes light, vibration and energy at differrent degrees to target a wide range of illnesses.  The estimated cost of the machinary is $5,000 - $6,000.  The minerals and suppliments required reach a total of roughly a thousand dollars for whats needed for a year.

We not only seek this for Luis, but also for others that are in similar situations..those that are not left with viable options.

We would not only use this to save Luis's life,  we would also like to open our home as a place of healing to someone that has lost hope or someone that has been told there is no more hope.  Someone who needs to think outside the box.

story:
Dalu's Eyesight - Blindness can be prevented

Dalu has keratoconous, an eye condition that leads to blindness. Surgery for this rare condition is not yet covered by provincial health care. This means that Dalu needs to raise the $7000 for the operation and vision care before the end of November 2012 to save his eyesight.

 

About Dalu

Dalu is a young social justice advocate who arrived in Canada in 2010, escpaping persecution in Zimbabwe. Since his arrival, he has supported organizations like the University of Toronto, Canadian Centre for Victims of Torture, and the Metropolitan Community Church of Toronto in various social justice initiatives. He aspires to become a human rights lawyer when he finishes his university career, which he just started this fall.

Dalu did not know anyone in Canada when he first arrived. He currently lives in a shelter for homeless youth, and works part-time to cover his basic needs, while going to school full-time.

He was recently diagnosed with an advanced case of keratoconous which, if untreated, would lead him to lose his sight. He is scheduled to have the cross-linking surgery that would save his vision in December 2012.

Total costs to save his eyesight amount to $7000. The surgery and special eye glasses and contacts that he will need are not covered by provincial health care. This means that Dalu is responsible for raising the $7000 to cover the costs for surgery and vision care.

 

Why your support is needed

This is the breakdown of the costs for Dalu to keep his eye-sight:

  • Cross-linking eye surgery in both eyes at Bochner Eye Institute - $5400
  • Fitting for hard contact lenses - $300
  • Hard contact lenses - $800. Dalu will need to use hard contact lenses after surgery as the hard contacts help to maintain the cornea in the correct shape, and to prevent potential undesired re-shaping after surgery.
  • Eye-glasses with new prescripion - $500
  • Total: $7000

 

It's not only for Dalu

Dalu has done so much work for his various communities in Toronto since his arrival less than two years ago. As an eloquent, driven, and committed individual, there is no stopping him once his mind is made. A little support to get him eye surgery will allow him to continue his studies, and to continue doing the community work with so many different organizations that he began shortly after arriving to Canada.

Helping Dalu pay for eye surgery is an investment in youth, in refugees, and in humanity.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Support not only comes in monetary ways. Please help us spread the word! Share this site on Facebook and Twitter, tell your friends about Dalu's need. Leave some words of encouragement for Dalu at this trying time. Be a part of this movement!


During and after the campaign, donations can also be accepted by:
Credit Card: www.indiegogo.com/dalu2020vision
E-mail transfer: dalu2020vision@gmail.com
Cheque: Dalubuhle Ndlovu
mailing address: 90 Ontario Street, Unit 517, Toronto, ON M5A 3V6
Cash donations.

Endorsed By

Supporting Our Youth (SOY), a program of Sherbourne Health Centre, Toronto

story:
Paul needs Club Foot Surgery

This is Paul, an 8yr old Peruvian Quechua indian with a club foot. 

He needs surgery to correct the deformity.  A clinic in Ecuador has donated the surgery that will change his life.
Now I am raising funds for the 1000 mile trip from his Peruvian village to Ecuador & for his stay during the 6 week recovery.
Be part of changing a boys life & helping a family who sees this as a hopeless condition.

Paul lives with his mother, father and 2 yr old sister in a small village almost 2 miles high in the Peruvian Andes.  They live in a mud home and live on the crops they grow.

Paul's family is very thankful for the offer of free surgery from the clinic, now we must get him there!!

How I met Paul

We first met Paul when his mother Marina brought him to a basic medical clinic near his village.  A friend met him, but could offer no help at this basic clinic.  Now 3 years later, our friend showed me pictures of him and I knew an orthopedic clinic in Ecuador that can correct this type of problem.  The clinic, Bayside Medical Mission, has reviewed his condition and agreed to do the surgery in October 2012 for free.

Why are we helping Paul

Our family is preparing to do full time mission work in Peru with the Quechua Indians.  My wife is a nurse trained in 3rd world medical care.

Club foot is caused by malnutrition during pregnancy and can be corrected by basic vitamin supplement during pregnancy.  Unfortuantely, many Indian mothers are malnourished and lack access to health care.

Here is the nuts & bolts details of the cost:

  • Surgery costs ** Already Donated by Clinic**
  • Bus transport (Peru to Ecuador & back) $ 600
  • 6 weeks of lodging during recovery $1,050
  • 6 weeks of food during recovery $ 504
  • Daily transportation in Ecuador $ 84
  • Miscellaneous costs $ 200

All funds will be used to help Paul & any extra will benefit other Quechua Indian children with medical care.

The Impact, Please Share

You can change a childs life dramatically and bring hope to his family.

Be a part of something that changes lives today.

Please share this on Facebook or Twitter or email to a friend.

God Bless, Darrell & Kim

story:
Summary

The 1st time I went to Haiti was to see what it would take to teach a public health nursing course at a school of nursing in a country with little public health. Instead, I landed there 40 minutes before the 2010 quake and spent the next week at the quake's epicenter - Leogane - a region of 300,000 with 80-90% destruction where it took outside aid 6 terrible long days to arrive...My life was forever changed.

I see Haitians differently - I see them as the heroes that they are. Kind. Generous. Remarkable.  The relationships that were forged in those dark days are as strong as any family. I went to Haiti to educate nurses - I came away with a purpose to work to create social justice.

We all have tools that we've accumulated across our life. Mine are nursing tools. Its a great fit. The domain of nursing is care; empower nurses that they might better care for their families and communities. Social justice through care seems pretty sensible.

But it isn't all that easy. For lots of reasons, there is no healthcare infrastructure in Haiti. We have to begin with a good assessment. So, with my Haitian friends guidance and some standard-based assessment tools from my years in public health, I and my team (all seasoned nurses)will begin a community health assessment (CHA) in a rural community in the mountains above Leogane: In Fondwa, Haiti. The team that is going is with Nurses for Nurses International and are all volunteers.

Before you build a house, you get a good set of blue prints. A CHA is a blueprint for healthcare. This is Phase I of four of the CHA – which we plan to complete by July 2013. We will then share the CHA with local leaders and partners and with Haiti’s Ministry of Public Health and Population (MPSS).

It will take at least 4 trips to Haiti across this next year to complete the assessment. We will share all our findings with local stakeholders and partners. The nest step is a community health improvement plan and then a strategic plan - but first - we need to ask better questions to get better answers. We are optimistic that we can create a model that can be used in any resource poor setting.

What you get:)

PLEDGE $10 OR MORE

A personal thank you photo card of Fondwa and our sincere appreciation

 

PLEDGE $25 OR MORE

Isn't this something! Cool! For this, we will give a frame-able 4x6in photo of Fondwa, Haiti & a thank you note with an image of Haiti ...and our genuine gratitude

 

PLEDGE $50 OR MORE

We are in awe just thinking of it....a person in e-land giving $50 or more to help with the CHA...now that is remarkable! For this kind gift we will give an electronic version of Today, Léogâne*, an electronic copy of the CHA, the recipe for Haitian hot chocolate (you'll never go back!), and photo and card with an image of Haiti...and our wholehearted thanks

 

PLEDGE $100 OR MORE

Oh, won't this be nice - a $100 or more gift from someone we may not know...imagine! For this we will give you all of the above @$50 + an additional signed copies of Today, Léogâne* + a 2012-2013 academic year calendar of Léogâne, Haiti, an electronic copy of the CHA, and our earnest & happy gratitude

 

PLEDGE $200 OR MORE

Wow...it is amazing to think about - a $200 or more donation! We will give you all of the above @$50 + 3 additional signed copies of Today, Léogâne* + a limited edition - definitely one-of-a-kind - commemorative poster from the 1/12/201 earthquake in Haiti + a personalized one-of-a-kind photo card thank you...and our heartfelt tribute to you :)

 

PLEDGE $500 OR MORE

Well...such a donation will be wonderful...We will design a gift just for this eventuality: It will certainly include everything at the $200 level - plus, we will put together a special gift basket just for you...it will include a one-of-a-kind photo book and a couple tiny treasures from our trips to Haiti...and our happy - and somewhat amazed – gratitude

 

*Today, Léogâne is a 225-page book / first hand account of the January 12, 2010 earthquake in Haiti written by the team leader Michele Sare.

 

What your contribution provides:

 

In short – you help pay for the CHA:)...Specifically:

 

Air travel for 4 nurses from the US

Room & Board for US & Haitian team (4 US nurses and 5 Haitians) for 12 days

Haitian wages for: 2 Interpreters, 1 Guide, & 1 Driver

Car & Fuel for 12 days

Translator (Haitian RN) for CHA 

COMPLETED Phase I of a CHA (of women 18 - 25) translated to Creole and 10 copies for stakeholders & MPSS

Compiling and interpreting the data, writing, translating, and copying the final CHA report, working meeting in US for 5 days for 5 members

More about the Impact

Being in Fondwa, it is easy to see the social injustice just by standing on the side of the only road that bisects the community and connects the north and south sides of the southern arm of Haiti: On market days (Wednesday & Saturday) farmers will begin their walk to town to sell their produce sometime past midnight. They may carry their products on their head or be lucky enough to have a donkey outfitted with a handmade wooden pack saddle and an improvised rope halter – augmented with torn pieces of cloth to make the britchen and parts of the rigging that supports the pack saddle. En route, they will have to be careful to not be run-over by an $80,000 2011 Mercedes SUV.

On that same street, you can buy a Coke from a street vendor who heaves with a cough that is no doubt tuberculosis. Just across that same street from the vendor with the Coke, you will see a fully vaccinated, healthy, American who has health insurance and can seek pretty much any healthcare she wants when she gets back home after her 12 day volunteer trip.

Community health assessments are based on what the WHO has labeled 'determinants of health'. We know that the poor do not live as long as the wealthy and that those who are educated will be healthier and live longer than those without access to an education...so poverty and education are 2 of the factors that determine health...this is what a CHA assesses: What are the determinants affecting this rural community of 8000? By asking these questions we can help Haitians to learn and create better plans to improve the quality of their lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Email or mail your family, friends, colleagues, and network and tell them about our IndieGoGo website and fund-raising efforts – encourage them to visit the site and to share it with their network!

  2. Hold Haiti and Haitians in good thoughts and your prayers

Just across that same street from the vendor with the Coke, you will see a fully vaccinated, healthy, American who has health insurance and can seek pretty much any healthcare she wants when she gets back home after her 12 day volunteer trip.
Community health assessments are based on what the WHO has labeled 'determinants of health'. We know that the poor do not live as long as the wealthy and that those who are educated will be healthier and live longer than those without access to an education...so poverty and education are 2 of the factors that determine health...this is what a CHA assesses: What are the determinants affecting this rural community of 8000? By asking these questions we can help Haitians to learn and create better plans to improve the quality of their lives.
Other Ways You Can Help


Email or mail your family, friends, colleagues, and network and tell them about our IndieGoGo website and fund-raising efforts – encourage them to visit the site and to share it with their network! 


Hold Haiti and Haitians in good thoughts and your prayers

story:
"A SMALL CLINIC WITH A FEW PEOPLE, A BIG HEART, AND A MISSION"

Hello, We are a small clinic with a few people but a huge heart and an even larger mission!  We are planning and fundraising for a medical mission trip to Honduras in March of 2013.  We are going, no matter the funds we raise, but we need your help.  With your funding of this project we will be able to buy medicines, supplies, and provide care for some of the most disadvantaged children and adults in the world.  

We are planning on a mission into the difficult to reach areas of the mountains in Honduras to bring medical care and also the word of God for all those that seek help.  We are going to open a makeshift clinic in this area and provide completely free medical care and medicine with our hard work and support from others like you.  

This campaign is important to us as we have seen how so many men, women, and children in underdeveloped parts of the world incapable of attaining even the most basic healthcare.  We have a mission to offer love and hope to all that we come across while demonstrating a true christian spirit and medical care.  

We need each and every contribution to our cause to expand the scope of the care and love we can offer.  With your help we have faith and believe we can obtain this.  Each dollar you offer will be well spent and is guaranteed to go to some of the neediest in the world.  Even if you can't offer financial backing, please offer your prayers for our successful and safe trip.  

What do we need and Why should you donate?

Our Funding from this campaign will provide the following:

  • Airfare and transportation for doctors, nurses, and ancillary staff including clergy
  • Tenting material for a makeshift Clinic
  • Medicines including antibiotics, blood pressure medicines, diabetes medicines, vitamin supplements and nutrients, and many more based on funds raised
  • Supplies including but not limited to splinting, casting, suture,  laceration, and small surgical supplies
  • Bibles and other informational information on Jesus and his word
  • Toys and gifts for the Children and Families we serve

We have calculated our estimated costs to obtain the supplies listed above at approximately $50,000 for a very successful trip that is caring for 500-600 per day for 1 week.  We would like to make this trip an annual endeavor and your proceeds can aid that as every dollar will go directly to this mission.  We also would like to offer other medical and spiritual missions to different parts of the world including:

  • Guatemala
  • Haiti
  • Ghana
  • Uganda
  • USA, including children of the Appalachian mountains and our own poor and underserved

We feel we have a special ability to provide for these underpriveleged as our medical clinic is in a very rural and underserved part of Tennessee offering care for our underpriveleged and underserved.  We offer a sliding fee as well as free care to residents that meet federal poverty levels caring for thousands since we have been in practice and we feel like we can offer the same level of love, respect, and care in other deserving areas of the world starting with the Honduras.  

What Impact will your donation have?

This project is important to all Christians and Americans as it demonstrates the American and Christian spirit of giving and love is not lost.  I have always felt that the best way to demonstrate what it is to truly be American is to show Christ's Love and Giving.  We can offer this love and Christ's spirit through medical care for the truly underpriveleged and his word and your contribution can aid this.  You will surely be blessed.  

For Institutions or individuals that donate, your contribution is tax deductible and can go a long way to demonstrating your true care for others.  

How else can you help?

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Pray, Pray, and Pray
  • Ask your Church, Clinic, and any other institution to view our Campaign on Indiegogo and offer help if they can
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • If you have any spanish written health material or bibles to offer, please send to Optimum Medical Mission Group  PO Box 54 Bon Aqua, TN  37025

Proverbs 19:17
He who is kind to the poor lends to the LORD, and he will reward him for what he has done.

Luke 6:38
Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.
